Cain, Harry A.
Source--Wetzel County Message Board    West ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> West >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Virginia
Published--February 1998
 
Cain,  Harry A. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>
Cain, Harry A. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 , of General Delivery, Wileyville, West Virginia, died Thursday, February 26, 1998, at home. He was a retired employee of Ormet Corporation., Hannibal, Ohio, and a member of Steelton Church of Christ, New Martinsville. He was preceded in death by his parents, Troy and Rhoda Morris Cain. Surviving are his wife, Shelby Adams Cain; a son, Doug of New Martinsville; two sisters, Wilda Cain and Doris Richmond, both of Weirton; four grandchildren. Friends were received at Palmer Funeral Home in Pine Grove. Services were held at the Church of Christ. Interment in Poole Cemetery, near Wileyville, West Virginia.
 
Cain, Howard Ray
Source--Wetzel County Message Board        West Virginia
Published--November  2002
            Howard Ray Cain , 72, of West Virginia
Published--November 2002
Howard Ray Cain , 72, of >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Jacksonburg, West Virginia, died Monday, November 4, 2002, at his home.
He was a Protestant by faith. He retired from Ormet Corporation, Hannibal, Ohio, and was a United States Army veteran.
He was preceded in death by his parents, Homer Hurshel and Celia Arnett Cain; 1 daughter, Ann Marie Cain; 1 brother, Charles Cain; and 1 sister, Helen Marie Cain.
Surviving are 1 sister, Mrs. William "Thelma" Bridgeman of New Martinsville, West Virginia; 1 son, Mike and wife Debbie Lippincott of Folsom, West Virginia; 1 daughter, Mrs. Terry "Vanessa" Miller of Jacksonburg, West Virginia; his former wife, Barbara Cain Oliveto of Jacksonburg, West Virginia; 3 nieces, Mrs. Richard "Deb" Springer of Pine Grove, West Virginia, Mrs. Perry "Barbara" Bucher of Reader, West Virginia, and Mrs. Tim "Lea Ann" Summers of New Martinsville, West Virginia; 3 grandchildren, Shey Anne Lippincott, Lynn Bates and Danny Bates; and several nieces and nephews.
Friends will be received from 3-9 p.m. Wednesday at Palmer Funeral Home, Pine Grove, West Virginia. Graveside services will be held at the Knights of Pythias Cemetery, Pine Grove, West Virginia, Thursday at 11 a.m.
 
Cain, James W.                                                                                                             Source--Wheeling News Register    Wheeling, West Virginia                                                               ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Source--Wheeling News Register Wheeling, West Virginia >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Published--September 3, 1943
Services will be held Saturday morning at 9 o'clock at the Olszta funeral home for James W. Cain, veteran of World War I, who died Thursday in the Veterans hospital at Aspinwall, Pennsylvania. Interment will follow in the Cain cemetery at Clarington, Ohio. The family residence is at 4260 Franklin street, Bellaire, Ohio. Mr. Cain was a charter member of Blake Brothers Post of the American Legion in Benwood. Surviving are his wife, Mrs. Elizabeth Cain, two sons, Kenneth Robert Cain ,at home, and Arlington E. Cain with the United States Navy; one daughter, Miss Regina Cain, Bellaire, Ohio; four sisters, Mrs. Frank DeBolt, Wheeling; Mrs. Howard Dunfee, Bellaire, Ohio; Mrs. Margaret Wright, Bellaire, Ohio, and Mrs. Eugene Grossenback, Woodsfield, Ohio; his father, Isaac Cain, Clarington, Ohio; his grandfather, James W. Cain, Clarington, Ohio.

  Lillie M. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Lillie M. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Calvert, 95, of 36357 ST 78, Lewisville, died December 14, 1998 at the Monroe County Care Center, Woodsfield. She was born in Monroe County, near Miltonsburg, April 9, 1903, a daughter of the late William Brubach and Rosa Burkhart Brubach. She was a member of the St. Sylvester Catholic Church, St. Francis Society, Catholic Women's Club and the Purgatorial Society.
 
  Surviving are ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a son, William G. Calvert, Lewisville; a daughter and son-in-law, Shirley and Don L. Seamon, of Wheeling; two brothers, Paul Brubach, Woodsfield, Albert Brubach, of Bridgeport; a sister Marie O'Connell, of Woodsfield; eight grandchildren; 17 great-grandchildren; several nieces and nephews.

Calvert, in September 1978; an infant daughter; two brothers, Benjamin Brubach and Lawrence Brubach; a sister, Clara Hall.

Camden, James Camden
 
May 10, 1892
 
July 1982
 
Graysville
 
 
John R. Camden Is Dead
Published--The Spirit of Democracy  Woodsfield, Ohio
March 7, 1918   
  We received ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio
March 7, 1918
We received >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 word Monday of the on Sunday morning March 3, 1918, of John R. Camden at his home at Sycamore Valley.
  Deceased was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Deceased was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in his 69th year and was one of the best known men in his township and surrounding community. His fellow citizens had honored him for many years with the office of justice of the peace, land appraisor and township assessor, having been elected assessor at the last November election. He was always trustworthy and aimed to be fair and just upon every occassion. He was a good neighbor and friend. When you asked of him a kindness of any kind you got it if it was within his reach. He leaves a wife and several children to mourn the departure of a kind husband and father. We join with the bereaved family and feel that as well as they oneof our best friends has gone to his reWard.
  May he rest in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> May he rest in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 peace.
(typed by betty
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Camden, Miss Lissa and Mr. Samuel R. Rosenberry
Source:The Spirit of Democracy
Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., April 6, 1916
               Mr. Samuel R. RoseNBERRY, a ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. Samuel R. RoseNBERRY, a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 prominent citizen of Canal Dover, Ohio, and Miss Lissa CAMDEN daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John R. CAMDEN of Sycamore Valley, were united in the holy bonds of matrimony March 2, 1916, by W. D. Richner, Justice of Peace, at his office in the court house. The contracting parties are very worthy young people in their respective neighborhoods and have many friends who unite in wishing them a long and happy life.
 
Campbell, Ernest Campbell
 
Aug 6, 1878
 
May 1967
 
Graysville
 
 
 
Campbell, Eugenia Campbell
Apr 1, 1882
 
Apr 1969
Lewisville
Eugenia M. Dick Campbell nee Dick
 
Source: The Zanesville Times Recorder, dated, 09 Apr 1969
 
(Eugenia M. Dick Campbell was born on 11 Apr 1882 in Monroe Co., Ohio. She died on 08 Apr 1969 in Burkhart, Lewisville Twp., Monroe Co., OH.)
 
SUMMERFIELD -- Mrs. Eugenia M. Campbell, 87, of Lewisville Route 1 in the Burkhart community, died at 6 a.m. Tuesday (April 8) at her home following a short illness. She was born April 11, 1882, in Monroe County, a daughter of Louis and Mary Schehl Dick. She was first married to George Burkhart, who died in 1918. She later married Walter Campbell, who died in 1956. She lived for many years in Piqua [Miami Co., OH], returning to Monroe County in 1968.
 
Surviving are two daughters, Mrs. Ida Baisley with whom she made her home, and Mrs. Minnie Kuhn of Lewisville Route 1; four grandchildren and six great-grandchildren. A brother and sister are deceased.
 
Friends may call at Brubach Funeral Home in Summerfield 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.,. Thursday. Rosary will be recited at 8 p.m. Thursday. Requiem mass will be celebrated at 9 a.m. Friday at St. Joseph Catholic Church at Burkhart with Rev. Joseph Finan officiating. Burial will follow in the church cemetery.
 
Campbell, James Campbell
 
September 30, 1958
 
Aug 1981
Clarington
 
Campbell, Lina Gertrude (nee Beardmore)
            Lina G. Weber Campbell, 89, of Barnesville died Wednesday (April 17, 2002) at her home.
            She was born October 15, 1912 in Lina G. Weber Campbell, 89, of Barnesville died Wednesday (April 17, 2002) at her home.
She was born October 15, 1912 in >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Monroe County, daughter of the late Charles and Gail (Rockwell) Beardmore.
            Mrs. Campbell was a homemaker and a former seamstress in the Barnesville area for many years.
             She was a member of the East Main Street Church of Christ of Barnesville and Barnesville Senior Citizens.
             She was preceded in death by her first ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Campbell was a homemaker and a former seamstress in the Barnesville area for many years.
She was a member of the East Main Street Church of Christ of Barnesville and Barnesville Senior Citizens.
She was preceded in death by her first >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 husband, George Weber, her second husband James Campbell; a son-in-law Richard Starr; a granddaughter, Jody Starr Phillips; and two brothers, Laymore Beadmore and Charles M. Beardmore.
            She leaves three daughters, Mrs. J. P. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She leaves three daughters, Mrs. J. P. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 (Evelyn) Sampson and Mrs. David (Myna) Chambers, both of Barnesville and Mrs. Tom (Jean) Thompson of Columbus; grandchildren, Bruce and Nancy Sampson, Cindy and Bruce McGee, Dennis and Becky Thompson, Sheryl Giesey, Brenda and Jim Castle, Darren and Debbie Thompson, Angie Ball, Tina and Dave Leach, Mike and Wanda Starr; 18 great-grandchildren; seven great-great grandchildren; two sisters, Luna McKain of Akron and Norma Robb of Lewisville; two step-daughters, Mrs. Herb (Betty) Anderson, and Mrs. Gary (Bernice) Heizer and their families of the Westerville area; step-grandchildren, Todd Chambers and Brent Chambers and their familes; step great-grandchildren, Ashley and Erica Castle; and several Beardmoe and Weber nieces and nephews.
            Friends were received Saturday at Kelly-Kemp-Braido Funeral Home, Barnesville where services were held Sunday with Minister Val Roxby officiating.                             Burial ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends were received Saturday at Kelly-Kemp-Braido Funeral Home, Barnesville where services were held Sunday with Minister Val Roxby officiating. Burial >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 followed in Crestview Cemetery in Barnesville.

Carosene, Helen and Mr. Charles E. Reischman
Source--Monroe County Beacon   Woodsfield, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio
Published--December 1, 1955
 
   Following a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Following a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 wedding trip over Virginia Skyline Drive, Mr. and Mrs. Charles E. (Helen Carosone) Reischman are residing at 426 North Grant Street, Wooster, Ohio.
   The bride, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The bride, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Nick Carosone, of 1113 East Bowman Street, Wooster, was graduated from Wooster High School and is now employed in The Commercial Department of Ohio Central Telephone Coorporation.
   The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bridegroom, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward S. Reischman, of Woodsfield, Route 3, was graduated from Lewisville High School and is employed by The Ohio Agricultural Station at Wooster.
   Out-of-town ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Out-of-town >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 guests were present from Lewisville, Canton, Rittman and Woodsfield for the double ring ceremony in St. Mary's Catholic Church at Wooster on Saturday morning, October eighth. The Very Rev. Msgr. Bernard J. Weigand officiated for the 10:30 o'clock wedding and The Nuptial High Mass which followed.
  Gladioli and ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Gladioli and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 chrysanthemums decorated the church. The choir sang the Mass, also
"On This Day O Beautiful Mother,"  when the bride presented a bouquet at The Blessed Mother's altar.
   Miss Carosone ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> when the bride presented a bouquet at The Blessed Mother's altar.
Miss Carosone >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was escorted to the altar by her father. She wore a ballerina-length gown of white Chantilly over satin and lace. The gown had a high neckline with a Peter Pan collar and lace sleeves which came to a point over her wrists. Her veil of nylon tulle was fastened to a lace Juliet cap with seed pearls.. She carried white Roses.
   Miss Kathryn ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Kathryn >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Reischman, sister of the bridegroom, was maid of honor. She wore a pink strapless ballerina-length gown of lace and net over taffeta with a matching jacket. She carried a bouquet of white carnations and wore a crown of pink nylon net.
   Virgil Kahrig, close friend of the bridegroom, served as best man.
   The bride's ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Virgil Kahrig, close friend of the bridegroom, served as best man.
The bride's >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 mother wore an aqua and black print dress with black accessories. The bridegroom's mother wore a black crepe print with black accessories. Each wore a white carnation corsage.
   A small ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A small >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 reception was held at The Lamplighters Hall for the immediate families and friends. The three-tiered wedding cake, which centered the bride's table, was flanked by the bride's and her attendant's flowers. Aides were; Mrs. Hugh McLaughlin, Mrs. Virgil Kahrig, Mrs. Harold Heizer, Miss Helen Reischman and Misses Betty and Donna Tomassetti.
   For her ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> For her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 going-away ensemble, the bride wore a light green wool dress with Brown accessories, and a white carnation corsage.

Carpenter, Agnes Wehr

Mrs. Agnes Wehr, nee Carpenter

     ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Quaker City-Mrs. Agnes Wehr, 95, of Batesville, Ohio, died at noon Tuesday (June 23, 1979) at the home of her daughter, Mrs. Jerome (Pearl) Montgomery of Batesville.

     She was born Nov. 19, 1883, in Monroe County, daughter of Ben and Emily Jones Carpenter.  She was married to Ira Wehr, who died Jan. 29, 1954.

     Other surviving daughters besides Mrs. Montgomery are Mrs. Walter (Marie) Mallett of Batesville, Mrs. Earl (Bessie) Bates of Caldwell Route and Mrs. Loe (Florence) Hall of Winchester, Ind.; two sons, John and Richard, both of  Quaker City Route 1; tow sisters, ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was born Nov. 19, 1883, in Monroe County, daughter of Ben and Emily Jones Carpenter. She was married to Ira Wehr, who died Jan. 29, 1954.

Other surviving daughters besides Mrs. Montgomery are Mrs. Walter (Marie) Mallett of Batesville, Mrs. Earl (Bessie) Bates of Caldwell Route and Mrs. Loe (Florence) Hall of Winchester, Ind.; two sons, John and Richard, both of Quaker City Route 1; tow sisters, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Pauline Carpenter of Lewisville and Mrs. Mary Ann Coultas of Zanesville; 21 grandchildren, 50 great-grandchildren and nine great-great-grandchildren.

     ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 She was a member of Calais Church.

     Friends may call at Thorn-Eberle Funeral Home in Quaker City 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday.  On Friday the body ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends may call at Thorn-Eberle Funeral Home in Quaker City 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday. On Friday the body >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will be taken to the Calais Church at noon for the funeral service at 1 p.m. Rev. Arthur Reed will officiate and burial will be in Calais Cemetery.

Carpenter, Allen Burdette
Source:The Cambridge [Ohio] Jeffersonian; 13 August 1998
Woodsfield---A. Burdette "Smucker" Carpenter, 74, of Summerfield, died Wednesday (August 12, 1998) at his home.
     He was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 October 14, 1923, in Summerfield, son of the late Ross and Alice Hayes Carpenter.
     Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Carpenter was retired farmer and a retired manager for the Ohio Division of Wildlife.
     He was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 preceded in by a daughter, Marsha Lynn Baker; three brothers, Maywood Carpenter, Roger Carpenter, and Raymond Carpenter; two sisters, Ildrith Coultas and Eleanor Carpenter; a grandson, Jason Hines and a great-grandson Tyler Carpenter.
     He leaves ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He leaves >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 his wife, Leah Lousie Leach Carpenter of the home; two daughters, Mrs. Bill (Linda) Warner and Mrs. (Melody) Warner, both of Summerfield; three sons, Lloyd Carpenter and Mickey Carpenter, both of Summerfield and Jeffery Carpenter of Sarahsville; two sisters, Melissa Carpenter of Cambridge and Margaret DeLong of Summerfield; 19 grandchildren; 11 great-grandchildren.
     Friends may ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends may >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 call from 4 to 9 P.M. Thursday at Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services will be 1 P.M. Friday with Pastor James Brown officiating. Burial will be Calais Cemetery, Calais.

======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Carpenter, Anna Lee--Piatt
Source--News clipping
Published--1952
 
The double ring ceremony read in the Methodist parsonage at Barnesville, Ohio, by Reverend Floyd L. Workman on Monday October twenty-seventh at seven o'clock in the evening united in marriage Miss Anna Lee Carpenter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond E. Carpenter, of Lewisville and Private First Class Lester L. Piatt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thurman G. Piatt, of Rinard Mills.
Miss Carpenter chose for her wedding a poudre blue two-piece rayon corded faille street-length dress with black accessories. She carried a white Bible, a gift of her grandmother, Mrs. Ross, H. Carpenter, topped with five American Beauty rosebuds with satin streamers. She carried out the tradition of something old, new, borrowed and blue and a penny in her shoe placed there by the matron of honor.
She chose as her matron of honor, her cousin, Mrs. Myra J. Dailey, who wore a grey and coral striped taffeta street-length dress. Her corsage was red rosebuds.
Mr. Ray Lorn Piatt served his brother as best man. Both wore white carnations in their lapel.
The bride is a graduate of Lewisville High School, class of 52. The groom attended Graysville schools and is now serving with the Armed Forces.
The newlyweds were honored with a shower at the home of the bride's parents on Friday, October 31st.
On Saturday evening, November first, they were honored with a supper, shower and serenade at the home of the groom's parents. They received many lovely and useful gifts for which they wish to thank everyone.
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

Carpenter, Arthur
Born: Woodsfield
 
Carpenter, Augusta Denny
(nee carpenter)
BARNESVILLE---Mrs. Augusta (Gussie) Denny, 88, of Hunts Ave., died Friday at 9:45 P.M. in Barnesville Hospital.
  She was the widow of Waldo Denny who died March 23, 1947 and leaves four children, namely Mrs. Pearl Brown of Barnesville,  Mrs. Faye James of Akron,  Blanchard Denny and Paul J. Denny, both of Beaver Dam, Ind.
  Mrs. Denny was the daughter of the Mr. and Mrs. William Carpenter and was born Dec. 11, 1874 at Temperaceville.  Funeral arrangements are being completed by the Campbell Funeral Home.  Sat. 2 March 1963 Jeffersonian.

  She was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 April 4, 1915, in Monroe County, daughter of the late Clem and Elise (Goodhart) Carpenter.
  Mrs. Drake was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Drake was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a retired seamstress and also from the former Green Cottage Restaurant in Barnesville.
  She was preceded in death by her husband, George Drake;  and several brothers and sisters.
  She leaves a niece,  Mrs. Gerald (Garnet) Tracy of Bethesda;  a nephew, Willis (Rosalie) Carpenter, of Beallsville;  three great-nieces, Mrs. Joe (Lisa) Douglass of Cambridge,  Mrs. Kim (Brenda) Carpenter of Bethesda, and Rhonda Edler;  two great-nephews, Glen and Steve Carpenter;  and two great-great-nephews.

Carpenter, Bernard W.
            Barnesville---Bernard ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Barnesville---Bernard >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 W. Carpenter, 78, of 421 Mulberry St.,
Barnesville, died this morning (September 29, 1979) at Barnesville Hospital.
He was born in Calais on May 20, 1901, son of the late Jacob and Melissa
 
Smith Carpenter. He was a a member of the Church of Christ. His wife,
 
Hazel Bunting Carpenter, died April 10, 1979.
Mr. Carpenter leaves four sons, Kenneth of Fredericktown and Robert,
 
Richard and Donald all of Barnesville; three daughters, Mrs. Sam (Ruth)
 
Allar, Crown City and Mrs. Robert (Jeannette) Hall and Sue Boulet, both
 
of Barnesville; 22 grandchildren; and 23 great-grandchildren.
Friends may call at Campbell-Plumly Funeral Home after 1 P.M. Sunday. =

Southern Cemetery, Barnesville. Sat. 29 September 1979 Jeffersonian.
 
Carpenter, Beryl Ove
            Beryl ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Beryl >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ove Carpenter, 74, of 33168 Railroad Street, Lewisville, died December 14, 1998, at his home. He was born at Calais, on June 4, 1924, a son of Forrest Tony and Hazel S. Taylor Carpenter.
He was a retired truck driver and a former employee of the Shelly Company, of Thornville. He was a United States Army Veteran of World War II serving with the 83rd Thunderbolt Infantry Division and had received the Bronze Star with five Bronze Stars and also received the Combat Infantry Badge. He was also a member of the American Legion Post 415, Summerfield.
Surviving are his wife, Darlene Winland Carpenter, whom he married on July 30, 1943; a daughter, Cheryl Lesher, of Barberton; two sons, Barry Ove Carpenter and his wife Sherri of Paden City; Dana L. Carpenter and his wife Ardi, of Lewisville; a brother, Virgin A. Carpenter of Smithfield; a sister Irene Neuhart of Batesville; six grandchildren; 10 great-grandchildren; several nieces and nephews.
In addition to his parents he was preceded in death by a brother, John Carpenter and an infant brother.
Friends will be received at the Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, from noon until time of service at 2 p.m. December 17, 1998, with Lorna Brownfield officiating. Burial will follow in the Friendship Cemetery, Lewisville, with full military services conducted by the Belmont County Veterans Council.
Memorial contributions may be made to the Washington County Nursing and Hospice, 900 Third Street, Marietta, Ohio 45750.

Carpenter, Carl and Peggy Wilhelm
Praising God for His goodness to us we, Carl and Peggy, joyously invite you to witness the uniting of our lives into one Saturday, May thirtieth nineteen hundred and eighty-seven at one-thirty in the afternoon. Your presence will be a blessing to us and our parents Mr. and Mrs. Roscoe Wilhelm and Mr. and Mrs. Carl Carpenter, at the Christ United Methodist Church, Marietta, Ohio. Source: Wedding invitation.
 
Carpenter, Carl W.
Source:Daily Jeffersonian dated, October 5,2001
  Woodsfield  ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Carl W. Carpenter, Sr., 82, of Lewisville, formerly of Kent, died Wednesday (October 3, 2001) at Grant Medical Center, Columbus. He was born Januaryuary 20, 1919, near Calais, son of the late Walter and Mar (Stephen) Carpenter.
Mr. Carpenter retired from Davey Tree Expert Co. in Kent, where he served as an area manager. He was a member of Lewisville United Methodist Church, Lewisville, American Legion Post 496 and a life member of Disabled American Veterans. He was a U.S. Army Air Corp veteran, having served during World War II.
  He was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 preceded in by two brothers, Lawrence Carpenter and Paul Carpenter; and a sister, Grace Van Meter.
  He leaves his ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He leaves his >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 wife, Cleo M. (Christman) Carpenter, whom he married May 30, 1941; a daughter, Darlene Lewis of Stow; three sons, Lyle (Helen) Carpenter of Revenna, Carl W. (Peggy) Carpenter, Jr. of Marietta, and David (Judy) Carpenter of Delaware; two sisters, Mrs. Dale (Viola) McDougal of Summerfield, and Thelma Carpenter of Zanesville; a brother, Frank Willis (Audrey) Carpenter of Zanesville; six grandchildren; two great-grandchildren; and several nieces and nephews.
  Friends may ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends may >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services will be 2:30 p.m. Saturday with the Rev. Richard Wilson and Roger Francis officiating. Burial will be in Calais Cemetery, Calais. Military graveside services will be conducted by the Belmont Veterans Council. Memorial contributions may be made to Lewisville United Methodist Church, 43618 State Route 145, Lewisville, OH 43754.

Carpenter, Charlotte L.

December 7, 1972

DEATH

Charlotte L. Carpenter (nee Dailey)

Source: Beacon

   Mrs. Charlotte L. Carpenter, of ======= JA'> Mrs. Charlotte L. Carpenter, of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Summerfield Route 1, one of Monroe County's oldest citizens, died Wednesday morning, November 29, 1972, at 9:40 o'clock at a Cambridge Hospital at the age of one hundred years.

   She has been ill for only a short ======= JA'> She has been ill for only a short >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 time.

   Mrs. Carpenter was born January 4, ======= JA'> Mrs. Carpenter was born January 4, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1872, in Monroe County, a daughter of John and Paulina Stepehns Dailey. Her husband Silas Carpenter, died in October 1963.

   Surviving are two daughters, Mrs. ======= JA'> Surviving are two daughters, Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mamie Starr, of Quaker City Route 4, and Mrs. Laura Gibson of Quaker City; two sons, Edson Carpenter and Elza Carpenter of Quaker City; ten grandchildren; twenty nine great grandchildren and twenty one great great grandchild.

   Services were held Friday ======= JA'> Services were held Friday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 afternoon at one o'clock in the Calais United Methodist Church with Rev. Glenn Saunders officiating. Burial was in the Calais Cemetery with the Brubach Funeral Home of Summerfield in charge.

 
Carpenter, Civilla A., nee Stephen
Source--Barnesville <<<<<<< HEAD Enterprise   ======= Enterprise >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Barnesville, Ohio
Published--June 9, 2004
 
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Carpenter, Civilla A., 88, of Barnesville, died Thursday, June 3, 2004 at Wheeling Hospital.
She was born October 23, 1915 near Calais, daughter of the late John Stephen and Elizabeth Miller Stephen.
Mrs. Carpenter was a member of the Pisgah Church of Christ. She retired from Barnesville Hospital and was a homemaker.
She was preceded in death by an infant son, Melvin; three brothers, Clyde, Halbert and Roland Stephen; two sisters, Daisey Gallagher and Garnet Stephen; and a great-grandchild.
She leaves her husband of 70 years, Hila Carpenter; a daughter,Melva (Larry) Howell; three sons, Vallas (Helen) , Marvin and John (Rose Ann) Carpenter, all of Barnesville; 14 grandchildren; 19 great-grandchildren; a brother , Richard (Martha) Stephen of Barnesville; three sisters, Martha (Jim) Thompson and Mary Carpenter, all of Barnesville; and Ruth Jackson of Marietta.
Friends were received Sunday at Kelly-Kemp-Braido Funeral Home, 702 East Main Street, Barnesville, where services were held Monday.
Burial was in Crestview Cemetery, Barnesville.

He was a veteran of World War 1 and an associate member of Barnesville Veterans of Foreign Wars.

DEC. 5, 1974

ENGAGEMENT

Miss Donna Carpenter

Source: The Monroe County Beacon

 

     Mr. and Mrs. Wilbert Carpenter, ======= JA'> Mr. and Mrs. Wilbert Carpenter, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of 17 East Church Street, Marshallville, Ohio, announce the engagement of their daughter, Donna J., to Howard S. Frase, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Honor Frase, of Route 1, Rittman.

     Miss Carpenter is a 1974 ======= JA'> Miss Carpenter is a 1974 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 graduate of Smithville High School and Wayne County Joint Vocational School. She is employed by Bell & Howell, MicroPhoto Division, in the Indexing Department.

     Mr. Frase is a 1964 graduate of Mr. Frase is a 1964 graduate of >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Norwayne High School and is employed by United Telephone of Ohio.

Carpenter, Elijah Denver
     Elijah ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Elijah >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Denver Carpenter, son of Vincent and Almeda Miller Carpenter, was born in Seneca Township, Monroe County , March 1,1903.  He departed this life August  24, 1966 in his sleep, being found by his ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> He departed this life August 24, 1966 in his sleep, being found by his >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 wife. He had been ailing from a heart disease since April 1965. He was 63 years, five months and twenty-three days of age.
    Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Carpenter spent his entire life near where he was born. He was a farmer, also a grader operator for The Seneca Township Trustees.
    He was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 married to Pauline Carpenter on July 23, 1927. To this union was born one daughter, Mrs. Helen Weisend, of Lewisville , Route 1.

He was preceded in death by his father and mother, one brother and one sister.
   Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held at The Calais Methodist Church on Saturday, August 27,1966 at one o'clock by Rev. Myron Guiler, of Marietta, a former pastor of The Calais Methodist Church.
 
        A loving one from us is gone,
        A voice we loved is stilled,
        A place is vacant in our home
        Which never can be filled.
 
        I never knew my heart could ache
        With such a bitter pain,
        You left one thing I can't forget
        Your precious love is with me yet.
 
        So, even tho' you're out of site
        You are with me day and night.
 
        You bid no one a last farewell,
        You said good-bye to none,
        The heavenly gates opened wide
        A loving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>
A loving one from us is gone,
A voice we loved is stilled,
A place is vacant in our home
Which never can be filled.
I never knew my heart could ache
With such a bitter pain,
You left one thing I can't forget
Your precious love is with me yet.
So, even tho' you're out of site
You are with me day and night.
You bid no one a last farewell,
You said good-bye to none,
The heavenly gates opened wide

Carpenter, Elmer J.
            Elmer ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Elmer >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 J. Carpenter, age 86, of Mount Vernon, died June 24, 2004 at the Kobacker House in Columbus. He was born February 28, 1918 in Monroe County, Ohio to Clifford and Pearl (Stephens) Carpenter.
He served in the Civilian Conservation Corps, and was a WW II Veteran of the U.S. Army serving in General Patton's 3rd Army; Company K, 357th Regiment, 90th Infantry Division, European Theater Operations receiving the Gold Conduct Medal; American Defense Service Medal; American Campaign Medal; WWII Victory Medal; European African Middle Eastern Campaign Medal with 2 Bronze Stars. He was a member of the American Legion Post # 578, in Batesville, Oh and the V.F.W. Post # 07671, in Fredericktown. After retiring, from the former Continental Can Co, after 33 years as a photo engraver, he enjoyed hunting, fishing, and golf as well as the Cleveland Indians. He was a strong family man who was a kind, loving, hardworking soul of integrity with strong opinion.
He is survived his wife of 58 years; Geraldine M. (Howiler) Carpenter; daughter: Cheryl L. Summers of Columbus; a grandaughter: Michelle Croswell of New Albany; 3 great-grandchildren: Samuel Owen and Elizabeth Anne Croswell; and Shaun Michael Barnett; a brother: Neil (Barbara) Carpenter of Mount Vernon; 2 sisters: Evelyn McCleary; and Judy Clevenger both of Mount Vernon; many nieces and nephews; sister-in-laws: Juanita Carpenter of Martinsburg; Mary Carpenter of North Liberty; Nora Carpenter of Mount Vernon; aunts: Wilma Morris of Pataskala; Lily O'Leary of Washington, PA.
Besides his parents he was preceded in death by 6 brothers: Harold, Francis, Edward, Virgil, Robert, and Irvin Carpenter; and 4 sisters: Viola Robinson, Betty Carpenter, Joann Carpenter, and Mary Ann Davis.
Friends may call Sunday 2 to 5 PM at the North-Dilley Funeral Home where the funeral will be held Monday 1:00 PM with Pastor Dan Taylor officiating. Burial will be in Mount Vernon Memorial Gardens Cemetery with Military Honors being conducted by the Knox County Joint Veterans Council. This obituary may be viewed online at www.dilleyfuneralservice.com
Memorial Contributions may be made to Hospice at Riverside Hospital-Kobacker House; 3595 Olentangy River Road; Columbus, Ohio 43214
Thursday 1 July 2004, sMonroe County Beacon, Woodsfield Ohio.

Source; The Marietta Times, dated Friday, October 24, 2003X
Eva F. Ellis Riggenbach, nee Carpenter
 
WOODSFIELD - Eva F. Ellis Riggenbach, 70, of Woodsfield died Wednesday (Oct. 22, 2003) at her home.
She was born Oct. 22, 1933, in Calais, Ohio, to Odie and Ossie Carpenter. She was a former employee of Barnesville Hospital and Ormet Corp. in Hannibal, Ohio. She was a member of Woodsfield United Methodist Church.
 
She is survived by two sons, Steve Ellis and his wife, Portia, of Jacksonville, Fla., and Brian Ellis of Yuba City, Calif.; two daughters, Robyn Guiler and her husband, Kevin, of Woodsfield, and Lisa Hartshorn and her husband, Scott, of Graysville; one sister, Leona Brown of Jerusalem, Ohio; and six grandchildren, David Ellis, Mitchell and Olivia Guiler, and Hannah, Maggie and Owen Hartshorn.
 
She was preceded in death by her parents; two brothers, Irvin and Vernon Carpenter; two sisters, Myrl Brownfield and Opal Crawford; and three other infant siblings.
 
Services are at 11 a.m. Saturday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home at 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with the Rev. Roger Brown officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery at Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 5 to 8 p.m. today at the funeral home.
 
 
Carpenter, Hostsclaw, Evelyn, nee Carpenter
Source--Toothman <<<<<<< HEAD Memorial Obituaries    >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Jacobsburg, Ohio
Published--January  2003
          Hostsclaw , Evelyn M. , 87 of Dover ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 2003
Hostsclaw , Evelyn M. , 87 of Dover >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ridge, Powhatan Point went to be with her Lord on Monday, January 6, 2003 at Ohio State University Hospital, Columbus. She was born December 8, 1915 a daughter of the late Omar and Lula Walters Carpenter.Evelyn was a life long member of the Grandview Christian Church at Clover Ridge where she attended regularly. She will be sadly missed by her loved ones there. She was also a member of Captina Chapter, Order of Eastern Star at Powhatan Point.In addition to her parents she was preceded in death by her beloved husband of 63 years, Charles who died May 24, 2002; a sister Marie Kriechbaum and a brother Ray Carpenter.Surviving are her daughters, Peggy Holtsclaw Burghy of Woodsfield; Linda Lang and husband Phil of Barnesville; Sharon Woods of Tyler, Texas; Deborah Moore and husband Neal of Alledonia; Linda Durst and husband Tom of Zanesville; granddaughters, Angela and April Burghy of Woodsfiled; two loving sisters, Opal Jenewein and husband Mel and Dorothy Graham and husband Kenneth all of Powhatan Point; two brothers, Wayne Carpenter of Powhatan Point and Floyd Carpenter of Shadyside; several nieces, nephews and cousins.Evelyn was a homemaker, loved working in her garden was a lover of animals and had a special pet dog named Poochie who will miss her so much.Friends will be received on Thursday from 4 to 9 p.m. at Toothman Funeral Home, Jacobsburg and on Friday from 10 a.m. to time of service at 11 a.m. in the Grandview Christian Church, Clover Ridge with Pastor Richard Baumberger officiating. Burial follows in Grandview Cemetery. Memorial contributions may be made to the Grandview Christian Church.

ZANESVILLE -- Frank "Willis" Willis Carpenter, 87, of Zanesville, died at 6:15 a.m. Sunday, June 30, 2002, at the Genesis Good Samaritan Campus after a Long illness.
     Born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 November 20, 1914, in Monroe County, he retired after 35 years of service as a Line Foreman for Ohio Power Electric Co. He was a member of the Eagles Aerie 302 for 57 years and a 3rd degree Knight with the Knights of Columbus council 505. He attended St. Nicholas Catholic Church.
     Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are his wife, Audrey V. (Burkhart) Carpenter, of the home, whom he married on April 30, 1938; two daughters, Wanda L. and Frank Carmichael, Connie Jo Wilson, both of Zanesville; one son, Stanley W. and Rosemary Carpenter of Howell, Mich.; seven grandchildren, Doug Geyer, Daffney Geyer, Kent Carpenter, Rene Carpenter, Kem Wilson, Travis Wilson, Kelly Lewis; nine great grandchildren, Wesley and Andrew Geyer, Madison Geyer, Brady "Willis" Wilson, Emily Wilson, Georgiana Wilson, Hannah "Audrey" Wilson, Monica and Darren Lewis; two sisters, Viola McDougal of Summerfield and Thelma Carpenter of Zanesville.

Carpenter, Fred E.
BARNESVILLE--Fred E. Carpenter, 69, of Leggett Ave., Barnesville, died Tuesday afternoon (March 9, 1982) at Barnesville Hospital.
  He was born in Quaker City on January. 19, 1913, a son of Harry and Louise Morgan Carpenter.  He was a veteran of World War II and a member of VFW Post 2792, American Legion Post 168 and Loyal Order of Moose 1294.  He was preceded in death by a daughter and sister.
  He leaves his wife, Betty Powell Carpenter;  two sons, Larry of the home and Thomas of Malaga;  a sister, Marguerite Baker of Barnesville R. D. 1;  a brother, Russell Carpenter of Barnesville and two grandsons.
  Friends may call Thursday from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 P.M. at Campbell-Plumly Funeral Home where services will be Friday at 1 P.M. with Evangelist James Gallagher officiating.  Burial will be in Crestview Cemetery, Barnesville.  Wed. 10 March 1982 Jeffersonian.
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was born in Quaker City on January. 19, 1913, a son of Harry and Louise Morgan Carpenter. He was a veteran of World War II and a member of VFW Post 2792, American Legion Post 168 and Loyal Order of Moose 1294. He was preceded in death by a daughter and sister.
He leaves his wife, Betty Powell Carpenter; two sons, Larry of the home and Thomas of Malaga; a sister, Marguerite Baker of Barnesville R. D. 1; a brother, Russell Carpenter of Barnesville and two grandsons.
Friends may call Thursday from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 P.M. at Campbell-Plumly Funeral Home where services will be Friday at 1 P.M. with Evangelist James Gallagher officiating. Burial will be in Crestview Cemetery, Barnesville. Wed. 10 March 1982 Jeffersonian.

Carpenter, Gladys L.
April 9, 1919
 
Carpenter, Grace Huntsman, nee carpenter
            Grace Huntsman, a beloved  woman of the Harmony neigbor-
 hood, died Tuesday, April 10 of acute pneumonia. Mrs. Huntsman was a daughter Paren Carpenter. She was born June 29, 1898. And had lived her entire life in the community where she died. She was married to Arthur Huntsman in January 1918. To thisunion were born three children; Ronald, 3  years Grace 2 years, and Nellie 9 weeks of age. A wife and mother she poses all the qualities of tenderness and loving kindness that enabled her to forget self and shower her love and affection on the dear ones of her family.  Funeral services were conducted ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Grace Huntsman, a beloved woman of the Harmony neigbor-
hood, died Tuesday, April 10 of acute pneumonia. Mrs. Huntsman was a daughter Paren Carpenter. She was born June 29, 1898. And had lived her entire life in the community where she died. She was married to Arthur Huntsman in January 1918. To thisunion were born three children; Ronald, 3 years Grace 2 years, and Nellie 9 weeks of age. A wife and mother she poses all the qualities of tenderness and loving kindness that enabled her to forget self and shower her love and affection on the dear ones of her family. Funeral services were conducted >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the home Thursday afternoon by C. H. Roe of Somerton Burial made in the Atlas cemetery. Source: Newspaper clipping date April 26, 1923.
 
Marriage
Carpenter--VanMeter
Source--News Clipping
Published--1950
                  Carpenter, Grace O, daughter ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Carpenter, Grace O, daughter >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Carpenter of Summerfield, Route 2 was united in marriage with William T. VanMeter of Quaker City, Route, at one forty-five o'clock Saturday afternoon, February 1950. Minister J.V.A. Traylor performed the ceremony at his home on Eastern Avenue, Woodsfield.                 
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
The bride was attired in a grey suit with navy blue accessories. Her corsage was of red rosebuds and white carnations. She carried a white Bible. The tradition of something old, something new, something borrowed and something blue, and a penny in her shoe was carried out.
Viola Carpenter, sister of the bride, was the only attendant.
Miss Thelma Carpenter, of Zanesville, sister of the bride, also witnessed the ceremony.
A wedding dinner was served on Sunday to members of the immediate families at the home of the bride's parents.
The new Mrs. VanMeter is a graduate of the Lewisville High School and was formerly employed at the Firestone Rubber Company in Akron.
Mr. VanMeter is a graduate of Beaver Rural High School and is employed by the Goodyear Rubber Company in Akron. He also served two years in the United States Navy during World War II.
The newlyweds will make their home at 1345 South High Street, Akron, Ohio

            >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Woodsfield, Ohio - Hailie Jo Carpenter, the infant newborn daughter of Douglas Edward Carpenter and Marie Dawn Omasta of Woodsfield, went to be with the angels on Friday (August 13, 2004). QUAKER  CITY--Hazel S. Carpenter, 87, of Batesville, died at 10:30 Tuesday, June 24, 1986 at Guernsey  Memorial
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> CITY--Hazel S. Carpenter, 87, of Batesville, died at 10:30 Tuesday, June 24, 1986 at Guernsey Memorial >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Hospital. She was born January 13,1899, in Monroe County, daughter of the late James and Marjorie Stevens Taylor.
Mrs. Carpenter was a Methodist by faith.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Forrest T. Carpenter, and by two sons, three brothers and three sisters.
She leaves her daughter, Mrs. Richard Irene Neuhart of Batesville; two sons, V.A. Carpenter of Smithfield and B.O. Carpenter of Lewisville; a brother, Floyd L. Taylor of California; two sisters, Celia Hunt of Barnesville and Melinda Hutchinson of Caldwell; nine grandchildren; six great-grandchildren and several nieces and nephews.
Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. at Thorn-Eberle Funeral Home in Quaker City, where services will be held at 1 p.m. Friday with the Reverend Ron Miller officiating. Burial will be in Calais Cemetery.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

The celebration of love will be Saturday, the fourth of November nineteen hundred and seventy-eight at two o'clock in the afternoon at the United Methodist Church, Quaker City, Ohio. Published Thursday November 19, 1953
   On Saturday ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On Saturday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 morning, October seventeenth, at half after nine o'clock, Miss Helen D. Carpenter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Denver Carpenter, of Lewisville, Route one, became the bride of Lawrence J. Weisend, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Weisend, also of Lewisville, Route one. Rev. Joseph Finan read the single ring ceremony in St. Joseph's Rectory at Burkhart.
   Miss ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Carpenter chose a dress of navy blue crepe with light blue accessories. Her corsage was a pink and white variegated carnations. She carried out the old tradition of something old, something new, something borrowed and something blue with a penny in her shoe.
   Miss Rose Ann ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Rose Ann >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Kuhn, a friend of the bride, was bridesmaid. She was attired in a blue suit with red accessories. Her corsage was of pink carnations.
   James ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> James >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Weisend, cousin of the groom, was best man. They both wore light blue suits with white carnations in their lapel.
   A dinner was served at the bride's parents for several close relatives and friends.
  They are at home to their many friends on the groom;s farm on Lewisville, Route one.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A dinner was served at the bride's parents for several close relatives and friends.
They are at home to their many friends on the groom;s farm on Lewisville, Route one.
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Carpenter, Helen D. Weisend
Helen D. Weisend, 77, of Township Road 636, Lewisville, Ohio, died Monday, March 14, 2004 at her home.
She was born near Summerfield, Ohio on Feb. 27, 1928, a daughter of the late Elijah D. and Pauline Opal Carpenter.
 
She was a homemaker and attended the Calais Church at Calais, Ohio.
 
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Lawrence J. Weisend.
 
Surviving are several cousins and many friends. Friends will be received at the Watters Funeral Home, 37501 State Route 78, West, Woodsfield, Ohio from 11 a.m. until time of services at 1 p.m., Wednesday with Pastor Matt Zurowski officiating. Burial will follow in the Calais Cemetery, Calais, Ohio. Source: Marietta Times, Tuesday, March 15, 2005

Carpenter, John

Carpenter, John S.
Died: July 14, 1917, residence: Calais
 
Carpenter, John Wellington
John Carpenter, 10 years old, son of Mr. and Mrs. Anthony Carpenter of =
 
Calais, was crushed to death Sunday morning when the automobile driven =
 
by Hobert Bunting, also of Calais, turned over on him. The Carpenter =
 
youth was riding on the fender of the machine and when Bunting made a =
 
quick turn, the car upset, causing the tragic death of the boy. Bunting =
 
and another passenger were not hurt, but a third, Edward Starr, was =
 
brought to the Community Hospital for treatment of cuts and bruises.
 
Coroner Turner of Monroe County made investigation on Monday with a =
 
verdict of accidental death. Thursday 8 Sept. 1938 Whetstone.

Died: December 10, 1928

Carpenter, Josie Grace Childress, nee Carpenter
NEWPORT - Josie Grace Childress, daughter of Will and Katy Carpenter Childress of Newport, died Wednesday (March 31, 2004) at St. Joseph's Hospital in Parkersburg as the result of injuries received in an automobile accident north of St. Marys, W.Va.
She was born Aug. 2, 2002, in Marietta.
In addition to her parents, she is survived by her maternal grandparents, Steve and Sandra Carpenter of Caldwell; paternal grandparents, Tom and Mary Childress of Marietta; maternal great-grandparents, Dorothy Carpenter, and James and Marilyn Warner of Summerfield; paternal great-grandparents, William and Peggy Bishop of Atlanta, Ga.; paternal great-great-grandmother, Thelma Lanham of North Carolina; maternal aunts, Angela (Robert) Fogle of Cumberland, Ohio, Brieann (Eric) Reiter of Caldwell, and Heather (Mike) Lemke of Pedricktown, N.J.; paternal aunt and uncles, Mac Childress of Columbus, Lawrence Brown of Newport and Elizabeth Petrie of Belpre; and several great-aunts, great-uncles and cousins.
She was preceded in death by her paternal grandmother, Deborah Childress; and her great-grandfather, Noah Carpenter.
Graveside services are at 2 p.m. Saturday at Newport Cemetery in Newport with the Rev. Loren Dace officiating. There will be no visitation. Ingram Funeral Home in St. Marys, W.Va., is in charge of arrangements.

Carpenter, Laura Grace and Mr. C. O. Stephen
CALAIS--- On Monday evening December 28, Mr. C. O. Stephen, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. W. Stephen, and Miss Laura Grace Carpenter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Cookson Carpenter, were united in marriage at the home of the bride, S. O. Hannahs, officiating. After the ceremony being preformed and congratulations extended the relatives and friends and friends present partook of a bountiful supper prepared for the occasion. Squire Hannahs claimed to have had supper before leave home, but we would just like to see him eat once after doing without dinner. Next followed one of the old fashioned serenade by friends of the young people. Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Start upon their married life <<<<<<< HEAD with the best wishes of many friends.  ======= with the best wishes of many friends. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Thursday, January 14, 1909

Carpenter, Leater Duff
BARNESVILLE---Lester Duff Carpenter, 69, Canton, former resident of Barnesville, died at Molly Stark Hospital, Canton, Thursday evening (August 1, 1968) following a long illness.
  Born at Calais, he was a son of Oliver H. and Mary Sears Carpenter.  He had been an employee of the Canton public school system for 27 years, retiring in May 1968.  He was a member of Loyal Order of Moose and Fraternal Order of Eagles.
  His wife, Norma McLeish Carpenter died in December 1945.
  Mr. Carpenter leaves a daughter, Mrs. Mildred Pauline Hein, Canton;  two grandchildren, Mrs. James (Linda) Howiler, Canton and Karen Sue Hein of the home;  ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Born at Calais, he was a son of Oliver H. and Mary Sears Carpenter. He had been an employee of the Canton public school system for 27 years, retiring in May 1968. He was a member of Loyal Order of Moose and Fraternal Order of Eagles.
His wife, Norma McLeish Carpenter died in December 1945.
Mr. Carpenter leaves a daughter, Mrs. Mildred Pauline Hein, Canton; two grandchildren, Mrs. James (Linda) Howiler, Canton and Karen Sue Hein of the home; >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 one sister, Mrs. Loren Mayberry, Barnesville; and two brothers, Wayne A. of Akron and Asher V., Thousand Oaks, Calif.
  Calling hours at Campbell Funeral Home here 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 P.M. Sunday.
  Funeral services will be held at 1 P.M. Monday at the funeral home with the Rev. William Walters officiating.  Burial will be in Crestview Cemetery, Barnesville.

Carpenter,  Miss ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Carpenter, Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lila Carpenter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Earl J. Carpenter, of Summerfield R.D. 2, became the bride of Sylvan C. Wise, son of Mr. and Mrs. John S. Wise also of Summerfield R. D. 2, on Monday afternoon January 5 at 1:15 Minster J. V. A. Traylor read the double ring ceremony at his home in Woodsfield.
 For her wedding ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> For her wedding >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the bride wore a navy blue suit with black and White accessories with a corsage of pink cArnations. She carried a White Bible and followed the tradition of something old, something new, something borrowed and a a penny in her shoe.
 Mrs. Sara ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Sara >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Synder of Summerfield, was matron-of-honor and wore a blue suit with a corsage of yellow cArnations. Bradley Carpenter also of Summerfield, brother of the bride was best man.
 Following the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Following the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 ceremony, a wedding dinner was served at the home of the bride's parents. A four tiered wedding cake with a miniature bride and groom centered the table. Thursday 8 January 1953 Quaker City Home Towner.

Carpenter,  Stephens, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Carpenter, Stephens, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mae, nee Carpenter
Obituary - Barnesville Enterprise: Mae Stephens, 83, of 2213 Central Ave., Cambridge, formerly of Barnesville, died Tuesday, March 23, 1983 in Barnesville Hospital. She was born May 21, 1899, in Calais, a daughter of the late Albert and Ella Morris Carpenter. She was a Methodist and was preceded in death by her husband, Joseph Stephens in 1960, a son, four brothers and two sisters. Surviving are two daughters, Helen Albaugh, Cambridge, and Mary Mahoney of Canton; two sons, Roy of Cambridge, and Carl of Barnesville; a stepson, Kenneth Stephens of Navarre; 13 grandchildren; 19 great-grandchildren; and four step-grandchildren. Services were conducted Friday at 1 p.m. with Evangelist James Gallagher officiating at the Campbell-Plumly Funeral Home. Burial followed in the Crestview Cemetery.
 
Carpenter, Margaret A. (Maggie)
            We are informed that Mrs. Maggie ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> We are informed that Mrs. Maggie >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Carpenter, wife of Len Carpenter of Kuhn, met tragic death Friday, November 23, 1917. Deceased had been in ill health for some time and grew despondent. She secured a rifle gun from its hiding place in the barn with which she ended her life. She is survived by her husband and three children.
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Thursday, November 29, 1917.

Carpenter, Mary Louise
CALDWELL---Mary Louise Carpenter, 85, formerly of Stafford and a resident of the Arbors Nursing Home, Marietta, died Tuesday (June 24, 1997) at the nursing home.
 She was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 December 18, 1911, near Stafford, daughter of the late Ulysses O. and Lillie Willis Carpenter.
 Ms. Carpenter ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Ms. Carpenter >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a vocational home economics teacher and business education teacher at Stafford, Barlett, East Savanna, Danville and Summerfield high schools. She also taught vocational home economics at Hayesville, Ontario, Kenton and Ashland high schools. She ended her career as a vocational home economics teacher for 14 years at Shenandoah High School. She retired in 1877.
 She was a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 member of SutHerland Methodist Church, past matron of Order of Eastern Star, Summerfield, and a member of Masterson Chapter 584. She was a 50 year member of Huffman Grange 2513, member of Stafford Grange, Franklin Homemakers and Business and Professional Women.
 She was preceded in by a brother, Forest Carpenter.
 She leaves her ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was preceded in by a brother, Forest Carpenter.
She leaves her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 first cousins, Evelyn Upchurch of Akron and Ruth Crooks of Indio, Calif.; second cousins, Stanley Carpenter of Lewisville, Betty Ogden of Woodsfield, William McElfresh of Blacksburg, Va., Mary Blanche Dunfee of Belmont, Roy Christy of Phoenix, Ariz., Carl Miracle of Barberton, Nina Miracle Wilson of Youngstown and Jean Walsh of Chagrin Falls.
 Friends may ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends may >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 P.M. Thursday at McVay-Perkins Funeral Home, Caldwell, where Eastern Star services will be 7:30 P.M. and Grange services will be 8 P.M.
 Services will be 11 A.M. Friday at the funeral home with Pastor Gary Fitzgerald officiating. Burial will be in SutHerland Cemetery.  ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services will be 11 A.M. Carpenter, Morrie Carpenter
December 23, 1918
Calais
Morrie Carpenter [Source: Monroe County records and The Spirit of Democracy Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs. January 9, 1919]
  Morrie ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Morrie >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Carpenter, the six-year-old son of Oliver and Civilla Carpenter of Calais, Ohio, died December 23, 1918, after a short illness from pneumonia. Morrie was an exceptionally bright little boy and enjoyed the love of all who knew him whether old or young. The of this child is a severe blow to the parents and the brother and sister that are left. The writer can sympathize with the parents, having passed through the same sad affliction and would cite them to Him who <<<<<<< HEAD said Suffer little children, and forbid them not, to come unto me; for of such is the kingdom of heaven, for consolation.

Carpenter, Oather
 Oather Carpenter, 42, well-known Beaver Township farmer, south of Quaker =
 City, died in Barnesville General Hospital Saturday morning at 3:20 A.M. =
 seven hours after sustaining a self-in--inflicted gunshot wound.
 
 Noble County Sheriff Clayton McKee reported that Mr. Carpenter shot =
 himself with a .22 calibre rifle in a room of his farm home, at 8:25 =
 P.M. Friday evening. Despondency caused by poor health was given as the =
 cause for suicide. He was a highly respected in the community and his =
 came as a shock to local residents.
 
 A son of Richard and the late Molly Carpenter, he was born near Calais =
 on April 3, 1909. In addition to his father, he leaves his wife, =
 Catherine Morris Carpenter; two children, Jean and Donald of the home; =
 two brothers, Otto of Summerfield and Elza of Salesville route; four =
 sisters, Miss Ellen Carpenter of Quaker City route, Mrs. Bertha Jackson =
 of Cambridge, Mrs. Emma Thomas of Long Island, N.Y. and Mrs. Elizabeth =
 Dollison of Quaker City Route 1.
 
 Funeral services were conducted Monday at 1 o'clock P.M. at the Eberle =
 Funeral Home in Quaker City with Rev. Clair Gray officiating. Burial was =
 made in Friends ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Oather Carpenter, 42, well-known Beaver Township farmer, south of Quaker =
City, died in Barnesville General Hospital Saturday morning at 3:20 A.M. =
seven hours after sustaining a self-in--inflicted gunshot wound.
Noble County Sheriff Clayton McKee reported that Mr. Carpenter shot =
himself with a .22 calibre rifle in a room of his farm home, at 8:25 =
P.M. Friday evening. Despondency caused by poor health was given as the =
cause for suicide. He was a highly respected in the community and his =
came as a shock to local residents.
A son of Richard and the late Molly Carpenter, he was born near Calais =
on April 3, 1909. In addition to his father, he leaves his wife, =
Catherine Morris Carpenter; two children, Jean and Donald of the home; =
two brothers, Otto of Summerfield and Elza of Salesville route; four =
sisters, Miss Ellen Carpenter of Quaker City route, Mrs. Bertha Jackson =
of Cambridge, Mrs. Emma Thomas of Long Island, N.Y. and Mrs. Elizabeth =
Dollison of Quaker City Route 1.
Funeral services were conducted Monday at 1 o'clock P.M. at the Eberle =
Funeral Home in Quaker City with Rev. Clair Gray officiating. Burial was =
made in Friends >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Cemetery. Friday 18 April 1952 Home Towner

Carpenter, Opal Beatrice (nee Long)
Source:The Times Recorder, Zanesville, OH, dated Wednesday, December 31, 2003
CALDWELL -- Opal B. Carpenter, 93, formerly of Summerfield, died Tuesday morning, December 30, 2003, at the Summit Acres Nursing Home, Caldwell.
She is survived by one daughter, Georgianna Carpenter; one son, D.K. (Patsy) Carpenter; four grandchildren, Dan (Debbie) Carpenter, Darwin (Angie) Carpenter, Dustin (LaDawn) Carpenter, Darcie (Eric) Anderson; nine great-grandchildren; three nieces and two nephews.
 
Calling hours are 5 to 8 p.m. Thursday at McVay-Perkins Funeral Home, where services will be held at 11 a.m. Friday, January 2, 2004, with the Rev. William Pickenpaugh officiating. Interment will be in Eastern Cemetery, Summerfield. Online condolences may be sent to www.mcvay-perkins.com.

            Sardis ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Sardis >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 - Paul E. Carpenter, 72, of 42165 W. Union Road, Antioch community, died at 11:18 a.m. Sunday (June 2, 2002) at Marietta Memorial Hospital in Marietta.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born May 10, 1930, in Ozark, Ohio, to Leona Claus Carpenter Skaggs and John Edwin Carpenter. He was serving as a council member for the Village of Antioch.

Carpenter, Raymond E.
Obituary: Monday 11 October 1965 Times Recorder, Zanesville, Ohio
Calais - Raymond E. Carpenter, 56, was found hanged in a machinery shed at the rear of his home about five miles west of here Sunday morning (October 10) Sheriff Francis (Tinker) Sulsberger said a coroner's ruling is expected. Carpenter had been in ill health much of the time since he lost a leg in a logging accident five years ago, Sulsberger said.
Salsberger said a son, Wallace Carpenter who lives on an adjoining farm found the body shortly before noon. He and other members of the family searched for Carpenter after they went to his home following church services.
Sulsberger said Carpenter was hanging from a chain which was fastened to a rafter. He apparantly stood on a gate at the entrance to the shed which is about 100 yards from his home.
Carpenter, a farmer, was born in Monroe County, October 18, 1908, son of Ross H. and Rachael Hayes Carpenter.
Surviving are his widow, Martha; two sons, Byron of Mount Vernon and Wallace; two daughters, Mrs. Ruth Earley of Orlando, Fla., and Mrs. Anna Lee Piatt of Whipple; six grandchildren; three brothers, Roger Carpenter of Caldwell, Maywood of Woodsfield and Burdette of Summerfield Route 2, four sisters, Mrs, Ildrith Coultas and Miss Eleanor Carpenter, both of Summerfield. Mrs. Margaret DeLong of near Summerfield, and Miss Malissa Carpenter of Paris, Ky.
Services will be held at 1 p.m. (EST) Tuesday in Lewisville Methodist church with Rev. Starling M. Perkins officiating. Burial will be in Calais Cemetery.
Friends may call at Brubach Funeral Home in Summerfield 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today
 
Carpenter, Reason
Born: June 25, 1848
Died: November 2, 1918, residence: Calais

Carpenter, Name: Robert C. Carpenter  From: Mount Vernon, OH  Birth Date: 07 / 09 / 1931  Death Date: 07 / 21 / 2002  Calling Hours: 07 / 25 / 2002 from 5:00-8:00 P.M.   at Flowers-Snyder Funeral Home, Mt. Vernon, OH  Funeral: 07 / 26 / 2002 at 11:00 A.M.   at Flowers-Snyder Funeral Home, Mt. Vernon, OH  Burial: Mt. Vernon Memorial Gardens, Mt. Vernon, OH   
    Robert C. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> From: Mount Vernon, OH Birth Date: 07 / 09 / 1931 Death Date: 07 / 21 / 2002 Calling Hours: 07 / 25 / 2002 from 5:00-8:00 P.M. at Flowers-Snyder Funeral Home, Mt. Vernon, OH Funeral: 07 / 26 / 2002 at 11:00 A.M. at Flowers-Snyder Funeral Home, Mt. Vernon, OH Burial: Mt. Vernon Memorial Gardens, Mt. Vernon, OH
Robert C. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Carpenter, age 71, of Mount Vernon died Sunday July 21, 2002 at Wawing Lake Resort in Ontario, Canada of an apparent heart attack. Robert was born July 9, 1931 in Malaga, Ohio to Clifford E. and Pearl (Stephen) Carpenter and had spent most of his lifetime in the Mount Vernon area. He served in the U S Army 82nd Airborne Division. Robert had been employed as a journeyman machinist for Cooper Industries in Mount Vernon, Ohio Brass Company in Mansfield, Mount Vernon Machine Tool and retired from Hydraulic Press Manufacturing in Mount Gilead. He was an avid sportsman and loved the Cleveland Indians and Cleveland Browns.
    Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are his wife Nora (Coon) Carpenter whom he married February 19, 1954; five sons Cliff (Amy) Carpenter, David (Jeanette) Carpenter, and Chad (Sara Hess) Carpenter all of Mount Vernon, Rob (Deb) Carpenter of HoWard and Josh (Staci) Carpenter of Orrville; two daughters Lynne (Russ) Edgar of Edgar Springs, Missouri and Jill Carpenter of Mount Vernon; 8 grandchildren; 3 great granddaughters; 3 brothers Elmer (Gerry) Carpenter and Neil (Barbara) Carpenter both of Mount Vernon and Irvin (Mary) Carpenter of North Liberty; and 2 sisters Evelyn McCleary and Judy Clevenger both of Mount Vernon. Besides his parents he was preceded in death by 4 sisters Viola Robinson, Mary Ann Davis, Betty Carpenter and Joan Carpenter and 4 brothers Harold Stephen, Edward Carpenter, Francis Carpenter and Virgil Carpenter.
    Friends may ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends may >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 call Thursday from 5 to 8 PM at the Flowers-Snyder Funeral Home in Mount Vernon where funeral Services will be Friday at 11 AM with Rev. Brian Durbin officiating. Burial with Military honors by the Knox County Joint Veterans Council will be in Mount Vernon Memorial Gardens.
    Memorial ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Memorial >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 contributions can be made to the Salvation Army, 206 East Ohio Ave. Mount Vernon, Ohio 43050 or to the charity of your choice
Ruby D. Carpenter nee Leasure
Source:The Marietta Times, Marietta, Ohio, dated, Friday, March 12, 2004
CALDWELL - Ruby D. Carpenter, 79, of the Summit Acres Nursing Home in Caldwell, formerly of Lewisville, Ohio, died at 3 a.m. Thursday (March 11, 2004) at the nursing home. She was born November 4, 1924, near Carlisle, Ohio, to Dick and Altha Rossiter Leasure. She was a homemaker. She was a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ and the Ladies Auxiliary of American Legion Post 87 in Woodsfield.
 
She was preceded in by her husband, Lee Edison Carpenter, on February 17, 1994; her parents; and three sisters, Nellie Leasure, Easter McElfresh and Viola Calland.
 
She is survived by one son, Max Carpenter and his wife, Terri, of Little Hocking; two grandsons, Scott Carpenter of Lewisville and Brent Carpenter and his wife, Trish, of Newport; and several nieces and nephews.
 
Services are at 1 p.m. today at Watters Funeral Home, 37501 State Route 78 West, Woodsfield, with Sam Bartrug officiating. Burial is in Friendship Cemetery at Lewisville. Friends will be received from 11 a.m. today until time for the services.

Carpenter, Robert E. "Bobby"
Source: The Daily Jeffersonian, Cambridge, Ohio
Published-- December 3, 1998
           BARNESVILLE---Services will be 1 P.M. Friday at Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, Barnesville, for Robert E. "Bobby" Carpenter, 71, who died Tuesday, December, 1, 1998 at his home.  The Reverend Gene Miller will officiate.  Burial will be in Crestview Cemetery, Barnesville. Friends may call from 3 to 5 and 5 to 7 P.M. today at the funeral home.  He was born April 20, 1927, in Barnesville, son of the late Bernard and Hazel Bunting Carpenter. Mr. Carpenter was a retired livestock buyer for Ritterger Brothers in Zanesville.  He also retired from Halls IGA of Barnesville.  He was a Methodist by faith and a U.S. Army veteran of World War II. He was preceded in death by a son, Scott;  three brothers, Jackie, Gary and Don Carpenter.  He leaves his wife, Donna J. Roby Carpenter;  two sons, Larry Carpenter of Canal Winchester, Jeff Carpenter of Barnesville;  two brothers, Kenneth Carpenter of Marango,  Richard Carpenter of Barnesville;  three sisters,  Mrs. Sam (Ruth) Allar of Barnesville,  Mrs. Robert (Jeanette) Hall of Barnesville, Sue Boulet of Barnesville;  six ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> BARNESVILLE---Services will be 1 P.M. Friday at Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, Barnesville, for Robert E. "Bobby" Carpenter, 71, who died Tuesday, December, 1, 1998 at his home. The Reverend Gene Miller will officiate. Burial will be in Crestview Cemetery, Barnesville. Friends may call from 3 to 5 and 5 to 7 P.M. today at the funeral home. He was born April 20, 1927, in Barnesville, son of the late Bernard and Hazel Bunting Carpenter. Mr. Carpenter was a retired livestock buyer for Ritterger Brothers in Zanesville. He also retired from Halls IGA of Barnesville. He was a Methodist by faith and a U.S. Army veteran of World War II. He was preceded in death by a son, Scott; three brothers, Jackie, Gary and Don Carpenter. He leaves his wife, Donna J. Roby Carpenter; two sons, Larry Carpenter of Canal Winchester, Jeff Carpenter of Barnesville; two brothers, Kenneth Carpenter of Marango, Richard Carpenter of Barnesville; three sisters, Mrs. Sam (Ruth) Allar of Barnesville, Mrs. Robert (Jeanette) Hall of Barnesville, Sue Boulet of Barnesville; six >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 grandchildren and five great-grandchildren.

for some time.

Carpenter, Sylvia Leona Foraker
 QUAKER CITY----Sylvia Leona Foraker, nee Carpenter, 89. of Quaker City, died Monday =
 (July 16, 2001) at The Beckett House, New Concord.
 She was born June 23, 1912, in Summerfield, daughter of the late =
 Clifford and Julia Ann (Wise) Carpenter.
 
 Mrs. Foraker was a former employee of Barnesville Manufacturing, where =
 she served as an inspector.
 
 She was a member of Central Christian Church, Quaker City, and a former =
 member of Quaker City Rebekah Lodge.
 
 She was preceded in death by her first husband, William B. Leach, in =
 1943; her second husband, Elmo C. Yaw, in 1976; her third husband, =
 Vernon E. Foraker, in 1997; a son, William A. Leach; and a daughter, =
 Leona "Jackie" Yansoik.
 
 She leaves two sons, Robert B. (Lequiat) Leach of Dell City, Okla., and =
 James E. (Rachel) Leach of Cambridge; a daughter, Leola "Dick" Giesy of =

Carpenter, Vernon

August 28, 1952

ARMED SERVICES

Source: Monroe County Beacon

   Pvt. Vernon Carpenter, son of Mr. ======= JA'> Pvt. Vernon Carpenter, son of Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Mrs. Odie Carpenter of Quaker City, Route 4, is serving with the 461st Ordnance Ammunition Company in Korea. He received his basic training in Aberdeen, Maryland. He also took a sixteen weeks training course in an Ordnance school.

   Private Carpenter observed his ======= JA'> Private Carpenter observed his >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 24th birthday July 28th. He would enjoy hearing from any of his friends. His address is Pvt. Vernon Carpenter, U. S. 52-165-153, 461st Ordnance Amm. Co., APO 301, Care Postmaster, San Francisco, California.

 
Carpenter, Victor
 Private First ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Private First >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Class Victor Carpenter, who died Dec. 18, 1944 in the Battle of the Bulge escorted by T-4 Stanley F. Emory was brought to the Campbell Funeral Home Saturday evening for funeral and burial.
  Young ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Young >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Carpenter, the son of Clement and Elsie Goodhart Carpenter was born Feb. 26, 1911 at Calais and entered the service Dec. 9, 1942.
  Besides the parents, he is survived by three sisters and one brother;  Mrs. John Flood, Quaker City;  Mrs. Hort Wehr, Jerusalem rural;  Mrs. George Drake,  Sherman Carpenter, Barnesville;  two great-aunts, Mrs. Mollie Carpenter, Newark and Mrs. Lavina Carpenter, Barnesville.
  Funeral services was held in the Campbell parlors Sunday afternoon, Rev. Virgil C. Jump officiating and Barnesville American Legion Post 168 accorded him full military honors at the grave at Calais, where burial was made.  Thursday 4 Dec. 1947 Barnesville Whetstone.

Carpenter, Virgil E.
Wounded in Action
Published---1944
    Mr. and Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. and Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Clifford Carpenter received word March 27th from The War Department that their son, Sgt. Virgil E. Carpenter, had been wounded in action on February 27th, and was confined to a hospital in Italy. The extent of his injuries was not made known.
    In a letter ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In a letter >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 received later from Virgil, he said he had several wounds but not to worry; he was in a good hospital and had plenty to eat. He was also receiving good medical care.
    Virgil ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Virgil >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 enlisted in the army January 16, 1943, and received his training as a paratrooper at Helena, Montana. After serving in the Aleutian Islands and Kiska, he got to return to the states, and spent a short furlough with his parents. In October he was sent to Africa.
   His brother ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> His brother >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Pvt. Edward Carpenter, is also somewhere in Italy. Another brother, Sgt. Elmer C. Carpenter, is stationed at Camp Stewart, Georgia.
 
 
 Carpenter, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Carpenter, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Virgil

January 5, 1989

WEDDING ANNIVERSARY

Carpenter, Wallace and Judy parks Carpenter

Source: Monroe County Beacon

     Mr. and Mrs. Wallace Carpenter ======= JA'> Mr. and Mrs. Wallace Carpenter >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Lewisville will celebrate their 25th wedding anniversary January 8.

     They were united in marriage ======= JA'> They were united in marriage >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 January 5, 1964, by the Reverend Starling Perkins at the Lebanon United Methodist Church.

     Wallace is the son of Mr. and ======= JA'> Wallace is the son of Mr. and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Wesley Weber and the late Raymond Carpenter. Judy is the daughter of Ida Parks and the late Orvil Parks.

     Wallace is employed at Ormet and ======= JA'> Wallace is employed at Ormet and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Judy is employed at Summit Acres Nursing Home.

     They are the parents of four ======= JA'> They are the parents of four >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 children, Mrs. Carson (Teresa) Spence, Tammy, Timmy and Travis Carpenter.

     An open house for the couple will be held January 8 from 2-4 p.m. at the Calais Church. They extend a welcome to all family and friends and request no gifts.

Carpenter, Wilbert
            Summerfield, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Summerfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio-Funeral services for Wilbert Carpenter, 93, Summerfield R.D. 1 will be at 1 P.M. Saturday at Brubach Funeral Home, with Evan. McKinley Bates officiating. Burial will be in Friends Cemetery, Quaker City.
 Friends may call at the funeral home from 7 to 9 P.M. today.
 A retired farmer, he died at 8:15 A.M. Thursday (November 16, 1972) at a Cambridge Hospital.  He was born September 30, 1879 in Monroe County, the son of David and Amelia Snyder Carpenter.
 Mr. Carpenter leaves two grandchildren,  Mrs. Velma Lee ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends may call at the funeral home from 7 to 9 P.M. today.
A retired farmer, he died at 8:15 A.M. Thursday (November 16, 1972) at a Cambridge Hospital. He was born September 30, 1879 in Monroe County, the son of David and Amelia Snyder Carpenter.
Mr. Carpenter leaves two grandchildren, Mrs. Velma Lee >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Bishop, Cambridge and Donald of Sacramento, Calif.; eight great-grandchildren; and one brother, Grover of Old Washington. His wife, Maude B. died in 1958 and one son is also deceased. Source: The Daily Jeffersonian, Friday, November 17, 1972
 
Carpenter, William
            Calais, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Calais, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio-On Friday July 31, William Carpenter, an aged and respected farmer living about three miles north of Calais died. Carpenter, Willie

Carpenter, Willis Erwin
Born: June 1883, Monroe County, died: October 20, 1960
Willis Erwin Carpenter, 60, of Macksburg, died at the Veterans Hospital, =
 Dayton on Friday afternoon at 2:30 o'clock, where he had been a patient =
 for some time. He was a veteran of World War I and a member of the =
 Dexter City American Legion Post.
 
 He was born the son of Aaron (book has Artius) and Sarah Morris =
 Carpenter but resided the greater part of his life in Washington County.
 
 Surviving are his wife, Minnie, two step-daughters, Mrs. Eileen Jeffers =
 of Marietta; Mrs. Melba Schenderman of Lowell and one step-grandchild, =
 Janet Lois Schenderman; brothers William Carpenter of Lower Salem route, =
 Ingram Carpenter of Waterford, James Carpenter of West Mansfield and the =
 following sisters, Mrs Charles Thomas and Mrs. Kenneth Adair of =
 Cambridge and Mrs. Olive Mull of Whipple.
 
 Funeral services were held at the Macksburg Methodist Church at 2 =
 o'clock with Rev. Walter Brown officiating. Interment was made in the =
 Newport Cemetery by the McVay-Schilling Funeral Home. Thursday 26 October. =
 1960 Noble ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Dayton on Friday afternoon at 2:30 o'clock, where he had been a patient =
for some time. He was a veteran of World War I and a member of the =
Dexter City American Legion Post.
