Carr, Francis
Source: The Morning Journal, Lorain, Ohio, July 16, 1999, page B2:
            Elyria, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Elyria, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio - Francis R. Carr, 61, of Elyria, died Wednesday, July 14, 1999, at his home, following a one-year illness. He was born December 30, 1937, in Frametown, West Virginia., and lived in Elyria since 1955. Carr was a chemical processor at the Englehard Corporation, Elyria, for 30 years, retiring in 1995. He attended First Baptist Church, Elyria, and enjoyed deer hunting and gardening. Survivors include his wife of 36 years, Loreta M. (nee Kerns); sons Kevin, Steven, Jeff, and Jason, all of Elyria; sisters Madaline Garnes of Akron and Geraldine Burns of Elyria; brothers Orval of Elyria, Argene of Wellington and Noel of Bellevue; half-brothers Carl Frymyer of West Virginia and Roger Frymyer of Woodfield, Ohio; and three grandchildren. He was preceded in death by his sister, Gladys James. Friends may call Sunday 2 to 5 p.m. at the Bauer-Laubenthal Funeral Home, Chestnut Ridge Road and State Route 57, Elyria, where services will be Monday at 11 a.m. The Reverend Junior Kerns will officiate. Burial will be in Resthaven Memory Garden, Avon. Contributions may <<<<<<< HEAD be made to the American Cancer Society,   43099 North Ridge Road,   Elyria ======= be made to the American Cancer Society, 43099 North Ridge Road, Elyria >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 44035.

Carr, Pauline >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Gallagher, age 89, of Ravenswood, West Virginia, died January
16, 2002, at Ravenswood Village Center, Ravenswood. She was born on March 4,
1912 in Monroe County, Ohio, a daughter of Gilmore and Louise Carpenter Stephens.
She was a homemaker and a member of the Kaiser and Douglas Church of Christ,
Ravenswood.
  She is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by a son, Clayton Gallagher and his wife Kathy, of Rand, West Virginia;
daughter-in-law, Patricia Crow Gallagher, Vienna, West Virginia; grandson, Alan Gallagher
and his wife Debbie, Yorktown, Virginia; granddaughter, Jill Fury, Vienna, West Virginia;
great grandsons, Andrew and Jonathan Gallagher, Yorktown, Virginia; and Cody Powers,
Vienna, West Virginia; and sister, Bessie McCoy, Ohio
  She was preceded in death by her husband Virgil Gallagher, and a son Samuel Gallagher.
  Services were ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was preceded in death by her husband Virgil Gallagher, and a son Samuel Gallagher.
Services were >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 held on Friday, January 18, 2002, at 12:00 noon at Roush Funeral Home,
Ravenswood, with Evangelist Eugene Conger officiating. Burial followed in Ravenswood Cemetery.
Visitation was held on Thursday, January 18, from 10:00 a.m. until 12:00, time of service.

May 22, 1914
 
Carr, Sarah Ellen
            Sarah ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Sarah >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ellen Carr, 83, of Fly, died Sunday evening, April 23, at the home of her daughter, Mrs. Eva Ritchie, after a lengthy illness. She was born May 17, 1878, at Benwood, the daughter of Joseph and Sarah Stewart Huffman. Preceding her in were her husband Henry and a son. She was member of the West Union Church of Christ since the age of 16. Surviving are two daughters, Mrs. Eva Ritchie, Fly, and Mrs. Anna Edinger, New Matamoras, one son Ralph Carr, Fly, seven grandchildren, four great-grandchildren and a host of friends and relatives. Funeral services were held Wednesday, April 26, at Locust Grove EUB Church with the Rev. Samuel Huffman and the Rev. Clarence Hubbard officiating. Graveside rites were conducted by the Rev. Ernest Howell. Burial was in the church cemetery. [Calculated year of = 1961]

Carson, Miss Freda Irene and Mr. Lawrence Adams         
            Miss Freda Irene Carson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel D. Carson, 612 Front Street, Marietta, Ohio, became the bride of Mr. Lawrence Adams, son of Mr. and Mrs. George T. Adams, of Rinard Mills, Ohio, on Sunday afternoon, July sixth, when vows were exchanged at half after two oclock.
            Reading ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'>
Miss Freda Irene Carson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel D. Carson, 612 Front Street, Marietta, Ohio, became the bride of Mr. Lawrence Adams, son of Mr. and Mrs. George T. Adams, of Rinard Mills, Ohio, on Sunday afternoon, July sixth, when vows were exchanged at half after two o clock.
Reading >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the double-ring ceremony in the presence of the two families and guests was the Reverend Virgil E. Myers, performing the solemnization of vows in the First Congregational Church, Marietta, Ohio.
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, August 11, 1947

Cass, David Thurlow
Source--Snyder Funeral Homes      On Line Obituaries
Published--December  ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> On Line Obituaries
Published--December >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 2004
Name: David Thurlow Cass
From: Mount Gilead, Ohio
Birth Date: January 26, 1915
Death Date: December 08, 2004
Calling Hours: Friday, December 10, 2004 from 2:00-4:00 P.M.and 6:00-8:00 P.M.
  at Snyder ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> at Snyder >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Funeral Home, Mount Gilead, Ohio
Funeral: Saturday, December 11, 2004 at 1:00 P.M.
  at Snyder ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> at Snyder >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Funeral Home, Mount Gilead, Ohio
Burial: Oak Grove Memorial Park, Lexington, Ohio
        David Thurlow Cass, 89, of Mt. Gilead, died Wednesday December 8, 2004 at his residence.      
        He was born in Iberia, Ohio on January 26, 1915, the son of the late Ward and Laura Christman Cass. He was a graduate of the Iberia H.S. Class of 1933, and had been a farmer his entire life       
        He served in the Army National Guard Reserves.      
        He was a member of the Pleasant Grove Church of Christ, the Ohio Waggoneers, Ohio Wagon Train, United Wagon Train, Ohio Horsemens Council, Morrow Co. Conservation Club, Morrow Co. Farm Bureau, a past president of the Johnsville School Board, and a 4H advisor. He also attended the Lexington Senior Center.      
        His wife, the former Naomi R. Lepp Cass, whom he married on October 30, 1935, preceded him in death on December 26, 1989       
        He is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> David Thurlow Cass, 89, of Mt. Gilead, died Wednesday December 8, 2004 at his residence.
He was born in Iberia, Ohio on January 26, 1915, the son of the late Ward and Laura Christman Cass. He was a graduate of the Iberia H.S. Class of 1933, and had been a farmer his entire life
He served in the Army National Guard Reserves.
He was a member of the Pleasant Grove Church of Christ, the Ohio Waggoneers, Ohio Wagon Train, United Wagon Train, Ohio Horsemen s Council, Morrow Co. Conservation Club, Morrow Co. Farm Bureau, a past president of the Johnsville School Board, and a 4H advisor. He also attended the Lexington Senior Center.
His wife, the former Naomi R. Lepp Cass, whom he married on October 30, 1935, preceded him in death on December 26, 1989
He is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by his son and daughter-in-law James & Nonna Cass of Havre, MT.; his four daughters and sons-in-law Nancy & Don Jesson of Johnsville, Frances & David Cover of Edison, Dayle & Harold Lambert of Johnsville, and Janet & John Johnson of Johnsville; brother Paul Cass of Ekalaka, MT; 15 grandchildren and 30 great-grandchildren, 3 great-great grandchildren, and <<<<<<< HEAD numerous step great-grand children.      
        In addition to his parents and his wife, he was preceded in death by a grandson Eric Jesson, his three brothers Gill, Burton & Chester and his two sisters Nellie Flowers and Eudene Reed.      
        Friends may call at the Snyder Funeral Home, Mt Gilead on Friday December 10th from 2-4 and 6-8 p.m. Ray Linn will hold services there on Saturday at 1 p.m. with grandsons Traber Cass and Andrew Jesson assisting. Burial will follow in Oak Grove Memorial Park, Lexington       
        ======= numerous step great-grand children.
In addition to his parents and his wife, he was preceded in death by a grandson Eric Jesson, his three brothers Gill, Burton & Chester and his two sisters Nellie Flowers and Eudene Reed.
Friends may call at the Snyder Funeral Home, Mt Gilead on Friday December 10th from 2-4 and 6-8 p.m. Ray Linn will hold services there on Saturday at 1 p.m. with grandsons Traber Cass and Andrew Jesson assisting. Burial will follow in Oak Grove Memorial Park, Lexington

Cassidy, Edward J.
Died: April 1, 1914
 
Castelli, Sebastian J.
Born: November 12, 1920, died: June 27, 2001, residence: Woodsfield
Casteli, Sebastian J. "Tony"
Source:Marietta Times, Marietta Ohio . . June 2001
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
            Woodsfield ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 -- Sebastian J. "Tony" Castelli, 80, of 417 Eastern Ave., died at 8:25 a.m. Wednesday (June 27, 2001) at his home.
He was born November 12, 1920, in Brooklyn, N.Y., to Cerino and Rosaria TerraNovembera Castelli. He was a former self-employed entrepreneur in various ventures, a former distributor for Xypex Waterproofing Compound in Arizona and Ohio and was a retired insurance agent. He was a U.S. Navy veteran of World War II. He was a member of St. Sylvester Catholic Church at Woodsfield and Knights of Columbus at Barnesville. Upon his retirement, he was a therapeutic foster parent and an avid gardener.
            He is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by his wife, Dorothy "Dottie" Hambrick Castelli, whom he married October 10, 1990; three sons, Sebastian Joseph Castelli Jr. at home, Anthony Castelli of Pine, Colo., and Richard Castelli of Cary, S.C.; two daughters, Charlotte Del Fiacco of Illinois and Patricia Georgiev of Fort Huachuca, Ariz.; one stepdaughter, Christine Sanborn of Jerusalem; one stepson, Benjamin Sanborn of Lakewood; three sisters, Rose Gollen of Renton, Wash., Lucy White of Phoenix, Ariz., and Ann Rogers of Lakewood; two brothers, Albert Castelli and Frank Castelli, both of Middleburg Heights; 15 grandchildren; and several great-grandchildren.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by his parents and two brothers, Roland Castelli and James Castelli.
            Mass ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mass >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Christian burial is at 10 a.m. Saturday at St. Sylvester Catholic Church in Woodsfield with the Rev. David Gaydosik as the celebrant. Burial is in St. Sylvester Catholic Cemetery in Woodsfield with full military graveside services conducted by Belmont Veterans Council. Vigil services are at 8 p.m. Friday at the funeral home. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Friday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield.

Cecil, Curtis R.
Source--Wetzel Message Board      West Virginia
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> West Virginia >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published-- 1969
            Curtis R. Cecil, 63, a resident of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Curtis R. Cecil, 63, a resident of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the Burlington section of New Martinsville, died Monday January 27, 1969, at 12:15 p.m. at his home. Born March 12, 1905 he was the son of Friend R.. and the late Dora Wright Cecil. He was a member of the proctor Christian Church and a retired employee of PPG Industries. Besides his father, his widow, Goldie Goddard Cecil; four sons, Friend L., Russell and Melvin all of New Martinsville and Robert at home survive him. Five daughters, Mrs. Celia Johnson of Proctor, Shirley, Eleanor, Bernice and Cathy all at home; two brothers John of Silver Hill and Tom of Wileyville; four sisters Mrs. Austa Bland of Reader, Mrs., Florence Wade of Clarington, Ohio, Martha Shepherd of New Cumberland and Lavine Richmond of New Martinsville. 14 grandchildren. Services were held at the Iams Funeral Home Wednesday at 2 p.m. with W. J. Sliter officiating. Burial following in Northview Cemetery.

Chambers, Ivan "Ike"
Published--August, 2004
 
    Chambers, Ivan Ike E., age 89 of First Street, Moundsville died Saturday July 31, 2004 in Wheeling Hospital.
    He was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Chambers, Ivan Ike E., age 89 of First Street, Moundsville died Saturday July 31, 2004 in Wheeling Hospital.
He was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 January 28, 1915 in Moundsville, Wva, the son of the late Samuel A. and Goldie Jane Slonaker Chambers.
    He was a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 retired maintenance supervisor from Allied Chemical, a US Army Air Corp. veteran of WWII, a member of Calvary Untied Methodist Church and Earl Francis Post #3 American Legion.
    In addition ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In addition >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to his parents, he was preceded in death his wife Grace Richmond Chambers in 1991, and a sister Connie Adkins.
Survivors include a son David I. (Cyndi) Chambers of Powhatan Point, two daughters Donna Lynn (Robert) Clayton of Moundsville, Becky (Douglas) Lineberger of Springfield, Ohio, two brothers C. William (Jane) Chambers, Donald J. (Thelma) Chambers, a sister Helen Grisell all of Moundsville, six grandchildren, and seven great-grandchildren.
Family will receive friends on Sunday from 5-8pm at Grisell Funeral Home & Crematory, 400 Jefferson Avenue, Moundsville where funeral services will be held Monday at 1pm with Rev. Patricia Chambers officiating. Interment in Riverview Cemetery, Moundsville where the Moundsville Honor Guard will conduct Military Graveside services.
    Memorial contributions may be made to Calvary United Methodist Church, 1601 First St., Moundsville, WV 26041 or a charity of donors choice. Source--Grisell Funeral Home     Obituaries on Line
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Memorial contributions may be made to Calvary United Methodist Church, 1601 First St., Moundsville, WV 26041 or a charity of donor s choice. Source--Grisell Funeral Home Obituaries on Line >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Chaplin, Brady

Charnetzky, John Edward
Source:The Monroe County Beacon Woodsfield, Ohio, January 1951
            John Edward Charnetzky, of near ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> John Edward Charnetzky, of near >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lewisville, son of Charles and Olive Charnetzky, was born June 4, 1929, and departed this life January 2, 1951, being at the time of his 21 years, 7 months and 2 days.
            He leaves to mourn his departure his ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He leaves to mourn his departure his >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 father, Charles Charnetzky; four brothers and one sister, Frank, of Canton, Ohio; Donald, who is serving with the Armed Forces some where in Korea; Richard and Francis, of Waynesburg, Ohio and Mrs. William Burwell, of Waynesburg and a host of other relatives and friends. He was preceded in by his mother Mrs. Olive (Feiber) Charnetzky on July 24, 1944.
            John having been an invalid for the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> John having been an invalid for the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 past ten years, was confined to a wheel chair. He was very cheerful and patient during his illness and always had a smile for everyone. He will be greatly missed by Mr. and Mrs. George Stimpert and family where he had made his home for the past three and on-half years.
            Funeral services were held Friday ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral services were held Friday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 afternoon, January 5, in the Lewisville Methodist Church, Lewisville, Ohio with the Reverend Roxie Ritchie, of the Woodsfield Nazarene Church, and the Reverend Fontella Linn, of the Lewisville Methodist Church, officiating. Burial was made in the Friendship cemetery near Lewisville with the Gardner funeral home in charge.
 
Christman, A. B.

Christman, Alva L.

Death

Monday, April 7, 1997

The Journal-Leader, Caldwell, Ohio

Alva L. Christman

     Alva L. Christman, 86, of 59458 ======= JA'> Alva L. Christman, 86, of 59458 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Eldon Road, Quaker City, and Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center, died Saturday, April 5, 1997, at Barnesville Hospital.

     Born Aug. 9, 1910, in Monroe County, he was a retired farmer, retired bartender at the  American Legion Post 578 Batesville, and a ======= JA'> Born Aug. 9, 1910, in Monroe County, he was a retired farmer, retired bartender at the American Legion Post 578 Batesville, and a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 member of the Trinity United Church of Christ in Lewisville.

     Surviving are three sons, ======= JA'> Surviving are three sons, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Emerson Christman of Byesville, Gerald Christman of Lafferty, and Ellis Christman of Quaker City; four daughters, Mrs. Richard (Eloise) Eschbaugh of Byesville, Mrs. Dale (Shirley) Stephens of Quaker City, Mrs. Richard (Diana) Sams of Marietta and Mrs. Carl (Evelyn) Hartley of Marietta; two brothers, Raymond Christman of Barnesville and Irvin Christman of El Paso, Texas; 19 grandchildren; 24 great-grandchildren; and five great-great-grandchildren.

     He was preceded in death by his ======= JA'> He was preceded in death by his >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 parents, Fred and Anna Claus Christman; his wife, Pauline Kahrig Christman in April 1989; and one son, Alva Christman Jr.

     Friends will be received from 3 ======= JA'> Friends will be received from 3 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to 8 p.m. Monday, April 7, 1997 at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 1000 S. Paul St. Woodsfield.

Christman, Bertha Neuhardt

November 1, 1973

Source: Monroe County Beacon

   She was born in Monroe County, ======= JA'> She was born in Monroe County, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 December 19, 1894, a daughter of the late Jacob J. and Rachel Matz Christman.

   Mrs. Neuhardt was a member of ======= JA'> Mrs. Neuhardt was a member of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Trinity United Church of Christ of Lewisville.

   Surviving are three daughters, ======= JA'> Surviving are three daughters, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. EdWard (Marie) Green of Reynoldsburg; Mrs. Charles (Nadine) Knowlton of Wooster, and Mrs. Max (Delys) Bodenhausen, of Bellvue, Nebraska; two sons, Vernon Nuehardt of Wooster, and Richard Neuhardt of the home; four sisters, Mrs. Edna Young of Woodsfield Route 3; Mrs. Ruby Mann of Jerusalem Route 1; Mrs. Gladys Reich of Lewisville Route 1, and Mrs. Oneida Ludwig of Woodsfield; one brother Elmer Christman of Apple C reek, Ohio, and eleven grandchildren.

Marshall Cook, of Trinity United Church of Christ officiating. Burial was in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.

 
Christman, Brett and Chang UnChin
Brett Christman and Chang UnChin were united in marriage May 27, 1988, in Seoul, Korea.
UnChin is from Kwangju, Republic of Korea. Brett is the son of Sam and Nina Christman of Woodsfield, Ohio.
Brett and UnChin now live in Yakota, Japan where Brett is stationed with the United States Air Force as a cable and antenna systems installations maintenance specialist.
Source: Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, November 3, 1988.

Elmer Christman married Carrie Hendershot and children were Dorotha marie, Jean Elizabeth and Harold.

October 18, 1973

DEATH

Carrie Bernice Christman

Source: Monroe County Beacon

   Mrs. Carrie Bernice Christman, 73, ======= JA'> Mrs. Carrie Bernice Christman, 73, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Ozark, died Monday, October 15, 1973, at Akron City Hospital.

   She was born in Monroe County, ======= JA'> She was born in Monroe County, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 February 23, 1900, a daughter of the late Samuel and Myrtle Perkins Hendershot.

   Mrs. Christman was a member of the ======= JA'> Mrs. Christman was a member of the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ozark Church of Christ.

   Surviving are her husband, Elmer ======= JA'> Surviving are her husband, Elmer >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 W. Christman; one son, Harold E. Christman, of Universal City, Texas; two daughters, Mrs. Dorothy M. Scothorn of Menasha, Wisconsin, and Mrs. Gene E. Pugh of Akron; six grandchildren; seven great grandchildren; seven sisters, Mrs. Leona Rakin and Mrs. Fonda Menges of Sebring; Mrs. Olive Kirby of Salem; Mrs. Velma Miller of Burbank, California; Mrs. Della Ault of Glendale, California; Mrs. Hazel Heiser of Mansfield, and Mrs. Monad Williams of Wilmington, Ohio and three brothers, Willard Hendershot of Baltimore, Maryland; Paul Hendershot of Glen Dale, West Virginia and Samuel Hendrershot, Jr., of Sebring.

Christman, Casper
               Casper Christman, aged 17 years, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Casper Christman, aged 17 years, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew G. Christman, died at Grand Junction, Colorado, March 30, 1904, from typhoid fever. Mr. Christman was an energetic young man and had gone west some time ago believing he could do better. He was a member of the Presbyterian Church and was living a Christian life. His was a shock to his parents and friends here. While they knew he was sick, they were of the opinion that he would soon recover. His sister, Miss Celestia Christman and cousin, Mr. William Bertram left Thursday noon for Grand Junction to attend the funeral. The Interment will be in the Orchard Mesa cemetery, Mesa, Colorado.
Source:    The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Thurs., April 7, 1904
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
 
Christman, Catherine (nee Bauman)
Born: October 16, 1836, died: February 3, 1926, <<<<<<< HEAD burial: St. Johns Middle Church Cemetery, Lewisville, Ohio. Source:Monore ======= burial: St. John s Middle Church Cemetery, Lewisville, Ohio. Source:Monore >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 County death records
 
Christman, Celista A. Christman
August 7, 1918
Woodsfield
Celestia A. Christman [The Spirit of Democracy Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs. August 15, 1918]
  Miss Celestia ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Celestia >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 A. Christman, aged 35 years, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew G. Christman, died at the home of her parents on Sycamore Street in Woodsfield, August 7, 1918. She was stricken with typhoid fever several weeks ago and before she recovered from the fever other afflictions of a serious nature set in and rendered her so weak that she was unable to take sufficient nourishment to regain her strength and finally yielded to . Miss Christman was a young lady of marked intelligence and was well liked by her many acquaintances. Before her illness she had been in the employ of the McFadden store in Wheeling, West Virginia and had a host of friends in that city and also in Bellaire, Ohio. The funeral services were held Friday and interment made in Oaklawn cemetery. Reverend Philip D. Lascelles, pastor of the Presbyterian Church, conducted the services. Deceased leaves father and mother and one brother and a number of other relatives. She had been a faithful member of the Presbyterian Church for many years. Those noticed from a distance in attendance at the funeral were Dr. E. E. Sulsberger of Bellaire, Mrs. Guss Norteman of Wheeling, Mrs. Dr. William Grimes of East Liverpool, and Miss Dora Boyer of Bellaire.
 
 
Christman, Charles E.
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, Monday, January 24, 1955
            Charles E. Christman, 80, the son of Godfrey and Katherine Bauman Christman, was born on October 7, 1874, on his parents farm near Wills Creek, West of Monroefield, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Charles E. Christman, 80, the son of Godfrey and Katherine Bauman Christman, was born on October 7, 1874, on his parents farm near Wills Creek, West of Monroefield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio. He departed this life January 5, 1955, at the age of eighty years and three months. Born into a large family he was the second youngest of ten children, which included three girls and seven boys.
            His parents who were among the first settlers of this community, were from Germany with a background of strong Christian faith. He received the sacrament of Baptism at St. Johns Evangelical Church and later received the vows of Church membership himself by the rite of Confirmation at the age of fifteen. From that time forWard he remained a faithful and loyal member of St. Johns Evangelical ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> His parents who were among the first settlers of this community, were from Germany with a background of strong Christian faith. He received the sacrament of Baptism at St. John s Evangelical Church and later received the vows of Church membership himself by the rite of Confirmation at the age of fifteen. From that time forWard he remained a faithful and loyal member of St. John s Evangelical >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Reformed Church throughout his lifetime. In his Church he found the strength and guidance he needed by regular attendance and participation in the sacrament of Holy Communion. He received his last Holy Communion ten days before God called him to his heavenly home.
            On ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 October 15, 1898, he was united in marriage to Miss Laura Melinda Baker. To this happy union were born five sons. Laura died December 5, 1919, from typhoid fever, aged 45 years. Three sons, Harley, Herbert, and Clesson Christman were taken early in life. Harley died September 6, 1904, and; Herbert died February 4, 1903 and Clesson died in 1934.
            The two living sons are Freeman Christman, of Monroefield and Harvey Christman of Woodsfield. The last two weeks of Mrs. Christmans life were spent at the home ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The two living sons are Freeman Christman, of Monroefield and Harvey Christman of Woodsfield. The last two weeks of Mrs. Christman s life were spent at the home >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of his son, Freeman where with his wife, brother Harvey, the grandchildren and neighbors, he was given tender and loving care day and night.
            After ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> After >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the untimely of his first wife, he was united in marriage to Emma Black on November 26, 1924. She too preceded him in on June 19, 1946, aged 83 years, leaving one stepson, Stephen Black, now living in Zanesville, Ohio.
            Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christman has three grandchildren, Eldon and Ruth Christman, of Lewisville, Rural Route, and Richard Christman, of Columbus, Ohio. Also there are five great grandchildren who have brought much additional joy to him in these past years. Having a host of relatives, he is honored with having one of the largest relationships in this country, all descendants of the first
pioneer settlers.
            These ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> These >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 early settlers built up their homes near springs where Mr. Christman built his home. Here on his beautiful farm located west of Barnhart Ridge Road he lived alone during these past years. On his farm he found much joy in tending the cattle and chickens, watching the crops grow and be harvested by his son and grandsons.
            Burial was made in the St. Johns Middle Church cemetery, near Lewisville.
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Burial was made in the St. John s Middle Church cemetery, near Lewisville. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Christman, Mrs. Clara (nee Ackerman)
Mrs. Clara Christman
   ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Woodsfield-Mrs. Clara Christman, 90, of Quaker City Route 4 died Monday (January 10) in Barnesville Hospital where she was admitted January 2. She was born in Monroe County, December 12, 1874, daughter of Herman and Mary Meiz Ackerman, and spent her entire lifetime inthe Monroefield and Calais communities. Her husband, John, is deceased.
   Mrs. Christman was a member of the Methodist church.
   Surviving are ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Christman was a member of the Methodist church.
Surviving are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 four sons: Gilbert of Fly; HoWard of near Lewisville; Herbert of near Summerfield and Lee of near Quaker City Route 4; four daughters, Mrs. Esta Burkhart of Cambridge; Mrs. Helen Darr of near Summerfield; Mrs. Helen Hayes of near Quaker City; and Mrs. Cleo Carpenter of near Kent; 29 grandchildren and 20 great grandchildren; and one sister, Mrs. Matilda Sebaugh of Stewart, Fla.
   Friends may ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends may >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 call at Gardner Funeral Home here until noon today when the body will taken to the family home near Calais where services will be held at 1 p.m. Thursday. McKinley Bates will officiate with burial at Calais Cemetery.
[Source: The Times Recorder, Zanesville, Ohio, Wednesday, January 12, 1966 p. 6B] provided by Becky Stephenson
 
Christman, Clara Elizabeth
 [Source:The Spirit of Democracy Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., February 15, 1900]
  The angel of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> [Source:The Spirit of Democracy Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., February 15, 1900]
The angel of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 has called away one of our beloved little maidens Miss Clara Elizabeth Christman, aged 11 years and 28 days, daughter of Henry and Ella Christman. She was born January 9, 1889, and baptized May 12, 1889. January 20th she was at school and came home well and did her work as usual. At supper she said she was sick. Her sickness was appendicitis. She was patient through all her sickness and took everything calm. She wanted her father and mother to stay by her bed and not leave. She was laid to rest at Ozark Church cemetery to rest until the great resurrection day. Reverend W. Brucker conducted the funeral services. She leaves a father, mother, one brother eight years old, and a host of friends to <<<<<<< HEAD mourn her departure.                                              - AN UNCLE
======= mourn her departure. - AN UNCLE >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

                        ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 At eleven o'clock Saturday morning, June sixth, Miss Eva Pearl Christman and Mr. Marvin Kennon exchanged their marriage vows. The double ring ceremony was read by Minister J.V.A. Traylor at his home in Woodsfield.
 
                        ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 The bride, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter F. Christman, of Woodsfield, Route 3, was beautifully attired in a ballerina length gown of turquoise blue, featuring a lace bodice and peplum over a full net skirt. She wore white accessories and a corsage of red roses. She carried out the tradition of something old,new, borrowed and blue.
 
                        ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Their only attendants were Mr. and Mrs. Clyde W. Christman of Barnesville, Route 2, brother of the bride and sister of the groom.
 
                        ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Christman wore a petal pink ballerina length gown with white accessories. Her corsage was of white roses.
 
                        ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 The new Mrs. Kennon is a graduate of Summerfield High School, class of 1950. She is employed at Campus Shirt Company in Barnesville.
 
                        ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 The groom, only son of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald W. Kennon of Barnesville, Route 2, was graduated from Barnesville High School in 1945. He served two years in the United States Army, one year of which he spent in Korea. He is employed with the Western Electric Company in Columbus.
 
                        ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 After a short wedding trip, the young couple is now home to their friends in Barnesville.
 
Christman, Edna Marie

March 4, 1985

The Daily Jeffersonian, Cambridge, Ohio

Christman, Edna M. Young

     Woodsfield-Edna Marie Young, 82, ======= JA'> Woodsfield-Edna Marie Young, 82, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Westview Drive, Woodsfield, died Sunday (March 3, 1985) at her home following a long illness.

     Born Feb. 16, 1903, in ======= JA'> Born Feb. 16, 1903, in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lewisville, Monroe County, she was the daughter of Jacob and Rachel Matz Christman.

     Mrs. Young was a member of the Trinity United Church of Christ, Lewisville, where she and her husband helped build the church and she was also a member of the Womans Guild.

     Preceding her in death was her ======= JA'> Mrs. Young was a member of the Trinity United Church of Christ, Lewisville, where she and her husband helped build the church and she was also a member of the Woman s Guild.

Preceding her in death was her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 husband, Harold Kenneth Young, on Dec. 24, 1965.

     She leaves three daughters, ======= JA'> She leaves three daughters, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mavis Wilson of Woodsfield, Joy Young of Evergreen, Colo. and Kay Young of Venice, Calif.; a son, Kenneth Young of Pataskala; 11 grandchildren; seven great-grandchildren; a brother, Elmer Christman of Apple Creek; and three sisters, Oneda Ludwig of Woodsfield, Ruby Mann of Jerusalem and Mrs. Vernon <<<<<<< HEAD (Gladys) Reich of Lewisville. 

     Friends may call 7 to 9 this ======= (Gladys) Reich of Lewisville.

Birth
Willis Lee Christman
Woodsfield- A son was born Wednesday to Mr. and Mrs. Thurman Christman, of the Woodsfield-Malaga road. He has been named Willis Lee. Grandparents are Mr. and Mrs. L.E. Christman and Mrs. Minnie Geldmacher, all of Lewisville.
[Source:The Zanesville Signal, Zanesville, Ohio, Thursday, June 20, 1940]
 
Willis Lee Christman 1958 grad,Beallsville, OhioHigh School
 
Willis Lee Christman Military: March 6, 1962 entered Marine Corps, 4 years; time in Viet Nam and Cuban Crises; VFW Post No. 8004
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
MARRIAGE of Lorna Lou Christman, to Mr. Harold William Good
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, dated January 8, 1945
 
Mr. and Mrs. R. E. Christman of Maple Avenue, are announcing the marriage of their youngest daughter Lorna Lou, to Mr. Harold William Good, of New Lebanon, Ohio.
 
The wedding was an event of Saturday afternoon, December 23, at Covington, Kentucky, with the Rev. E. C. Rose performing the ceremony.
 
Mrs. Good is a member of the 1944 graduating class of the Woodsfield High School.
 
The happy young couple are both employed at the Dayton Rubber Company and are making their home in Dayton. They have the best wishes of their many friends.

Christman, J. W. and Clara Ackerman
               J. W. Christman; age 30 years on ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> J. W. Christman; age 30 years on >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the 7th day of September 1902; birthplace, Calais, Monroe County, Ohio; occupation, farmer; father, John Christman; mother, Eva Pfalzgraf; license was issued on February 25, 1903, and married March 4, 1903, to Clara Ackerman; age 27; birthplace, Lewisville, Monroe County; housekeeper; father, Herman Ackerman; mother, Mary Neisz; married by Otto ALBRECHT, Evangelist pastor.
Source:    Monroe County marriage records
 
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Monroe County marriage records
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Claus, Leona Skaggs
Leona Skaggs
 
Leona E. Skaggs, 95, of the Monroe County Care Center, Woodsfield, Ohio, died Wednesday, Feb. 2, 2005 at the Barnesville Hospital, Barnesville, Ohio.
She was born near Miltonsburg, Ohio, April 7, 1909, a daughter of the late William and Laura Neisz Claus.
 
She was a homemaker and a member of the East Richland Friends Church, St. Clairsville, Ohio.
 
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her first husband, John Edwin Carpenter; her second husband, Earl N. Skaggs; one daughter died in infancy; two sons, Wilbert and Paul E. Carpenter, one sister, Mildred Eaton; three brothers, Lawrence, Paul and Lewis Claus and two grandchildren, Christy and Mark Carpenter.
 
Surviving are one daughter, Mrs. Don (Laura) Bertschy of Woodsfield, Ohio; two sons, Clayton Carpenter of Applecreek, Ohio, Clifford Carpenter and wife Connie of Houston, Texas; one stepson, William Skaggs of Bethesda, Ohio; 13 grandchildren; several great grandchildren and several great great grandchildren.
 
Friends will be received at the Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, Ohio from 2 to 9 p.m. Friday, where funeral services will be held at 1 p.m., Saturday with Sam Bartrug and Keith Jones officiating. Burial will follow in the Ozark Cemetery, Ozark, Ohio.
Source: The Times Leader, Thursday, February 3, 2005.
 
Claus, Virginia Claus and Mr. Roscoe Wilhelm
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, dated, June 1949
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
On Saturday evening, June 18, 1949 Reverend Elmer A. Gradwohl read the single ring ceremony at St. Paul's Evangelical and Reformed Church in Woodsfield which united in marriage Miss Virginia Claus, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gilbert Claus of Route 1, Lewisville, Ohio and Mr. Roscoe Wilhelm, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Wilhelm of route 2, Lewisville.
For her wedding, the bride wore a street length dress of pink with White accessories.
The only attendants at the wedding were the bride's parents and sister, Miss Vivian Claus, and Mrs. Gradwohl.
Mr. and Mrs. Wilhelm are residing at the home of the groom's parents on Lewisville, Route 2.
The following day, Sunday, June 19th, a wedding dinner was served at the home of the bride's grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. George L. Christman, on route 1, Lewisville.
This was a double celebration, it also being the forty-ninth wedding anniversary of Mr. and Mrs. Christman. Mrs. Christman is the former Miss Lena Matz. They have always resided in this community.
Guests were: Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Christman, Mr. and Mrs. Carl Buss of Apple Creek; Mr. and Mrs. Gilbert Claus, children, Alvin and Vivian; Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Kahrig, children, Marion, Lena, Lewis and Marlene; Miss Elma Christman; Mr. and Mrs. George Kahrig and children, Wayne, Letha, Viola, Lillian, Meredith, Wilford and Edilene; Mr. and Mrs. Wilbert Claus, son Roger, and the honored guests, Mr. and Mrs. George L. Christman and Mr. and Mrs. Roscoe Wilhelm. Two of the Christman sons were unable to be present.
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Harold William Ensign - Irma Jean Highman  marriage
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Harold William Ensign - Irma Jean Highman marriage >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, dated, Thursday, August 24, 1950
 
In a double ring ceremony performed on Saturday afternoon, June seventeenth, at one o'clock, Miss Irma Jean Highman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Allen Highman, of Litchfield, Ohio, became the bride of Mr. Harold William Ensign, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clyde Ensign, of Spencer, Ohio, in a lovely lawn wedding at the home of the bride, with Rev. Walter T. Hinzmann officiating.
 
Preceding the ceremony, Miss Wilma Stocker sang "Because" and "I Love You Truly." She was accompanied by Miss Glenna Ayrock.
 
Given in marriage by her father, the bride was attired in a princess style gown of White slipper satin. The high, round neckline yolk was of Chantilly lace with a bertha collar effect. Slipper satin, like that of the collar, formed a Juliet cap to which her fingertip veil of Chantilly lace was attached. She carried a bouquet of White Shasta daisies and mock orange blossoms with a White cArnation corsage in the center. She carried out the tradition of "something old, something new, something borrowed and something blue."
 
Miss Betty Foraker, cousin of the bride, was maid of honor. Her short sleeved gown was of yellow marquisette and featured the bertha collar. Bridesmaids were Miss Jo Ann Highman, sister of the bride, and Miss Ruth Curtiss, cousin of the bride. They wore short sleeved gowns of blue satin with overskirts of blue net. They carried blue and yellow Shasta daisies.
 
Mr. Charles Ensign served his brother as best man. Both he and the groom were dressed in light blue suits and wore a White cArnation in their lapel.
 
The bride's mother wore a gray bemberg dress with blue accessories and a pink cArnation corsage. The mother of the groom wore a powder blue dress with White accessories and a yellow cArnation corsage.
 
Immediately following the ceremony a reception was held at the home of the bride, with one hundred guests attending.
 
After the reception the newlyweds left on a short wedding trip. For traveling the bride chose a blue nylon dress with blue accessories and a White cArnation corsage.
 
The newlyweds are now residing in Litchfield.
 
Out-of-town guests were present from Pittsburg, Pa.; Woodsfield, Canton, Columbus, Sycamore Valley, Rinard Mills, Massillion, Chatham, Spencer and Lodi.
 
 
Clara L. Christman, nee Claus
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, dated, February, 1966
Collection of Mary Eva Betts Christman
 
Mrs. Clara L. Christman, daughter of Fred and Caroline Haffner Claus, was born February 17, 1898, near Lewisville, Ohio, and departed from this life February 12, 1966, at DOctoberors Hospital, Massillon, Ohio, being 67 years, 11 months and 26 days of age.
She was united in marriage with Elmer G. Christman on April 29, 1924. To this union three sons and one daughter was born.
 
Surviving are her husband, Elmer Christman, of Apple Creek, Ohio; two sons, Melvin Christman, of Apple Creek, and LaVern Christman, of Columbus, Ohio; one daughter, Carolyn, of Apple Creek; one sister, Mrs. Anna Christman, of Barnesville, Ohio; two brothers, Edwin Claus, of Smithland, Iowa, and Gilbert Claus, of Lewisville, Ohio, and one uncle, John Haffner, of Harrietsville, Ohio.
 
An infant son, her parents, four brothers and one sister preceded her in .
 
Mrs. Christman was confirmed at an early age in the United Church of Christ (Middle Church). She spent most of her life in Lewisville vicinity, moving to Apple Creek, Ohio in 1950 where she remained until her . The last two years she was a semi-invalid but always had a smile and a kind word for everyone.
 
The body lay in state on Sunday, February 13 at McIntire's Funeral Home, Wooster, Ohio, being transferred on Monday to Brubach's Funeral Home, at Summerfield, Ohio. Services were conducted by the Reverend Donald Stump, on Tuesday, February 15, at the Fellowship Hall, Lewisville, with burial in the St. John's Middle Church cemetery, near Lewisville.
 
 
"Sunset and evening Star,
And one clear call for me,
And may there be no moaning of the bar,
When I put out to sea."

Christman, Clyde

Christman, Dale E.
 
2004
Bucyrus, Telepraph Forum, Saturday, April 10, 2004
April 3, 1948-April 8, 2004
Dale E. Christman, 56, died Thursday at his home following a long illness.
 
Dale was born in Bucyrus and lived in the area all of his life. He was the son of the late Lawrence H. and Margaret L. Campbell Christman.
 
Dale was employed for 17 years with Producers Livestock and most recently employed with The House Doctor. He farmed for 30 years.
 
Dale was a member of Galion Alliance Church, served as an elder, deacon and Sunday school teacher, was former president of Tri County Child Evangelism Fellowship and was past president of Church Association of Bible Instruction in the Colonel Crawford and Buckeye Central school systems.
 
In addition to his parents, Dale was preceded in death by his father-in-law Bob Nigh and is survived by his wife, Cindy (Nigh) Christman; sons and daughters-in-law Rob and Sharon Christman of Hilliard and Jamie and Monica Christman of Galion; daughter and son-in-law Heidi and Eric Boothe of Galloway; grandchildren Tyler, Caleb, Nicholas and Allison; sisters and brother-in-law Jeanette Harris, Carol and Tom Creger; sister-in-law Becky (Dave) Young; and several nieces and nephews.
 
Services celebrating Dale's life will be at 10:30 a.m. Tuesday at Galion Alliance Church, 430 Portland Way North, with Pastor Rick Maddox officiating. Burial will be at Crawford County Memory Gardens. Friends may call 2-4 and 6-8 p.m. Monday at the church.
 
Memorial contributions may be made to Galion Alliance Deacons Fund, 430 Portland Way North Galion, Ohio 44833; Home Care Matters Hospice, 352 South St., Galion, Ohio 44833; or to CABI, P.O. Box 561, Bucyrus, Ohio 44820.
 
Finefrock-Williams Funeral Home is assisting the family with arrangements. Finefrockwilliamsfuneralhome.com.
 
Christman, Dan and Chris

Christman, David Neal and Lloyd Arnold

Arnold, of Route 1, Powhatan, who recently enlisted in The U.S. Navy, are now undergoing basic training at The U,S. Naval Training Center, Great Lakes, Illinois. After ten weeks of basic training they will be granted fourteen days leave before reporting to their next duty station.

He was born May 23, 1919, in Monroe County, a son of the late Lewis E. Christman and Anna K. Claus Christman.
     He farmed ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He farmed >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 until 1970 and then worked for the County Highway Department retiring in 1989. He moved to this area in 1948.

Christman, Denise
Christman--Kapps
Source--Monroe County Beacon  Woodsfield, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--August 7, 1986
Christman , Miss Denise Suzette , of Columbus and Mr. Robert Stephen Kapps, also of Columbus, were wed in a double-ring ceremony July 12 at Fellowship Lutheran Church in Worthington. Pastor Douglas Campbell officiated.
Parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. Vernon Christman of Ashland and Mr. and Mrs. Robert F. Kapps of Columbus.
Serving Miss Christman as matron of honor was her cousin, Brenda Baughman. Bridesmaids were Sandi Christman, the bride's sister-in-law and Kris Kapps, sister of the bridegroom.
Best man was Jerry Vanden, Eynden, a friend of the bridegroom. Ushers were Joe Kapps, brother of the bridegroom, and Joe Bumbach.
Ringbearer was Laine Christman, the bride's nephew. Flower girl was Marissa Christman, niece of the bride. Attending the guest book was Judy Kellum, friend of the bride.
The bride graduated from Ashland High School and received her master's degree from Ohio State University. She is a school Psychologist for Marysville City School System.
Mr. Kapps graduated from DeSales High School in Columbus. He attended Ohio State University and is an executive in operations for F.R. Lazarus Company in Columbus.
The rehearsal dinner was held at Milano's in Columbus and was hosted by the bridegroom's parents.
A buffet reception following the wedding was held at Da Vinci Restaurant in Columbus.
Following a wedding trip to Cancun, Mexico, the couple will reside in Columbus.

Don F. Christman
Source:Daily Jeffersonian dated - Sept 5, 2001
  SUMMERFIELD  ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> SUMMERFIELD >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Services will be 11 a.m. Saturday at Wesleyan Bible Holiness Church, Summerfield, for Don F. Christman, 56, of Summerfield, who died Tuesday (September 4, 2001) at Grant Medical Center, Columbus. Pastor Cameron Hayes and the Rev. Dorothy Bane will officiate. Burial will be in Eastern Cemetery, Summerfield. Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Friday at Brubach-Watters Funeral Home, Summerfield, and from 10 to 11 a.m. Saturday. He was born July 16, 1945, in Calais, son of the late Walter and Lulu (Wehr) Christman. Mr. Christman was a compresser station operator for Texas Eastern, formerly Duke Energy Corp., at the Berne Station in Lewisville, for 31 years. He attended Wesleyan Bible Holiness Church, Summerfield. He was an avid outdoorsman with a love for horses and farming.
  He was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 preceded in by two brothers, Clyde Christman and Ralph Christman; and four sisters, Neva Christman, Januaryice Powell, Florence Wells and Doris Green.
  He leaves his ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He leaves his >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 wife, Carolyn (Guiler) Christman, whom he married December 21, 1963; two daughters, Mrs. Lee (Rhonda) Shreve of Summerfield and Mrs. Tim (Rochelle) Dunn of Columbus; two sons, Ricky (Cheri) Christman of Jackson and
Randy (Marsha) Christman of Troy, Mo.; three sisters, Kathryn Miller of Cuyahoga Falls, Eva Pearl Kennon and Mrs. Charles (Peggy) McLaughlin of Barnesville; nine grandchildren, Ricky Christman, Jr., Julia Christman, Andrew Christman, Luke Christman, Cole Christman, Austin Christman, Trista Shreve, Macey Shreve and Jamie Shreve; and several nieces and nephews.

Clara Elizabeth Christman [Source:The Spirit of Democracy Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., February 15, 1900]
  The angel of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The angel of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 has called away one of our beloved little maidens Miss Clara Elizabeth Christman, aged 11 years and 28 days, daughter of Henry and Ella Christman. She was born January 9, 1889, and baptized May 12, 1889. January 20th she was at school and came home well and did her work as usual. At supper she said she was sick. Her sickness was appendicitis. She was patient through all her sickness and took everything calm. She wanted her father and mother to stay by her bed and not leave. She was laid to rest at Ozark Church cemetery to rest until the great resurrection day. Reverend W. BRucker conducted the funeral services. She leaves a father, mother, one brother eight years old, and a host of friends to <<<<<<< HEAD mourn her departure.                                        - AN UNCLE
======= mourn her departure. - AN UNCLE >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

Christman, Earl Roy
               The senior class of Triway High ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The senior class of Triway High >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 school announces its Commencement Exercises Sunday evening, May thirtieth nineteen hundred seventy-one at eight-thirty o'clock in the Triway auditorium. Source: Announcement
 
2004
The following obituary appeared in the Fort Worth Star Telegram, Fort Worth, Texas, Thursday, January 29, 2004.
Edna Christman Stovall, nee Christman 98, a retired schoolteacher, died Sunday, Jan. 25, 2004, at a Fort Worth hospice.
 
FUNERAL: 11 a.m. Saturday in Blessing Colonial Chapel. Burial: Parkdale Cemetery, Arlington, Texas. Visitation: 6 to 8 p.m. Friday at Blessing Funeral Home.
 
MEMORIALS: If so desired, the family appreciates any donations to a charity of choice in Edna's name.
 
Edna was born in Woodsfield, Ohio, on April 22, 1905, the daughter of Charles and Christina Christman and the middle child of six sisters and one brother. The family moved to Arlington in 1916. She graduated from Arlington High School in 1923 and went on to receive an associate degree at NTAC, bachelor of science from Texas Tech and master's from Colorado State College. She taught for 40 years in public school systems in Colorado and Texas.
 
SURVIVORS: Sister, Mabel Decker of Keene; nieces, Linda Rhinehart of Austin, Helen McKoewn and Mary Jane Ransom of Boulder, Colo., and Judy Sanderson of Burleson; nephews, Gilbert "Chris" Christman of San Antonio, Rod Wilson of Alvarado and David Wilson of Arlington; 23 great-nieces and nephews; 28 great-great nieces and nephews; and several great-great-great-nieces and nephens.
Blessing Funeral Home, Mansfield, TX 817-473-1555
A picture was also included in the obituary. If anyone is interested in the complete obituary, please contact me at WallyCgap@aol.com and I will send the jpeg file.
Ruth Jones Goodman
Arlington, Texas
 
Christman, Edna P. (nee Baker)

Christman, Edna M. Young

     Woodsfield-Edna Marie Young, 82, ======= JA'> Woodsfield-Edna Marie Young, 82, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Westview Drive, Woodsfield, died Sunday (March 3, 1985) at her home following a long illness.

     Born Feb. 16, 1903, in ======= JA'> Born Feb. 16, 1903, in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lewisville, Monroe County, she was the daughter of Jacob and Rachel Matz Christman.

Christman, Edward Fred

1967

   Edward F. Christman, 87, died ======= JA'> Edward F. Christman, 87, died >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 unexpectedly at his home on Route 1, Duncan, Oklahoma, on Monday evening, August 14, 1967 at 7:30 o'clock.

   He was born November 16, 1879, at ======= JA'> He was born November 16, 1879, at >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Woodsfield, Ohio.

   Mr. Christman came to Duncan from ======= JA'> Mr. Christman came to Duncan from >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Drumright, Oklahoma, in 1922 and was a retired employee of Mobil Oil Company. He formerly taught school in Monroe County.

   He married Lillie McFarland ======= JA'> He married Lillie McFarland >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 September 23, 1924, at Comanche, Oklahoma. He was a member of the Eastside Church of Christ.

   Survivors is the wife of the home; ======= JA'> Survivors is the wife of the home; >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 one daughter, Mrs. May Wainscott, 1903 Birch, Duncan; one son, Fred Christman, of Oklahoma City; and a brother, John H, Christman, of Kersey, Colorado.

   Funeral services were held ======= JA'> Funeral services were held >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Thursday, August 17, at the Eastside Church of Christ. Lee Peters, minister at Broken Bow, Oklahoma, officiated.

   Burial was in the Duncan Cemetery ======= JA'> Burial was in the Duncan Cemetery >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 under the direction of Brooks Funeral Home. Bearers were Homer Fuller, Joe M. Johnson, Everett Meeker, J.C. Walls, Dee Jarrett and V. K. McMasters.

   Honorary bearers were Dr. John ======= JA'> Honorary bearers were Dr. John >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Jennings, L. L. Humphreys, Russell Light, Jess Pollock and former employees of Mobil Oil Company, Duncan.

 
Christman, Elizabeth
               Elizabeth Christman, aged 66 years, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Elizabeth Christman, aged 66 years, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 died June 28, 1910. She was the wife of Frederick Christman of near Woodsfield.
Source:    The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio,Thursday, June 30, 1910
 
Source: The Marietta Times, dated Wednesday, June 18, 2003X
Ella Viola Christman Kahrig
LEWISVILLE - Ella Viola Christman Kahrig, 97, of Skin Creek Road died Tuesday (June 17, 2003) at the Monroe County Care Center in Woodsfield.
She was born Feb. 23, 1906, in Lewisville, Seneca Township, to Jacob and Mary Ackerman Christman. She was an avid homemaker and gardener and enjoyed working with flowers. She was a member of Woodsfield Church of Christ.
 
She is survived by eight sons, Herman Kahrig of Barnesville, Lester Kahrig of Pataskala, Virgil Kahrig of Marshallville, Ohio, Rodney Kahrig of Woodsfield, Francis Kahrig of Canton, Kenneth Kahrig of Jerusalem, Lloyd Kahrig of New Pittsburgh, Ohio, and William Kahrig of Lewisville; five daughters, Martha Uppole of Lewisville, Dortha Matz of Dalton, Ohio, Vera Crock of Massillon, Leora Cruise of Oklahoma and Doris Kahrig of Rittman; 32 grandchildren; 52 great-grandchildren; and nine great-great-grandchildren.
 
She was preceded in death by her husband, Lawrence Kahrig, whom she married on Oct. 9, 1924; one son, Roger Kahrig; three grandchildren; one granddaughter by marriage; six great-grandchildren; four brothers, Homer, Herman, Harry and Henry "Clem" Christman; one sister, Freda Renker; and one daughter-in-law.
 
Services are at 1 p.m. Friday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Minister Harry Summers officiating. Burial is in Friendship Cemetery in Lewisville. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 6 to 9 p.m. Thursday at the funeral home.
 
Memorial contributions may be made to Woodsfield Church of Christ, 860 Lewisville Road, Woodsfield, Ohio 43793; or the Lewisville Fire Department in care of Bob Blackstone, 46089 Ohio 145, Lewisville, Ohio 43754.
 
Christman, Ellis Phillip and Beatrice Elaine Simeral
Mr. and Mrs. Donald R. Simeral request the honour of your presence at the marriage of their daughter Beatrice Elaine Simeral to Mr. Ellis Phillip Christman on Friday, the first of August, nineteen hundred and sixty-nine at seven o'clock at the Church of Christ, Quaker City, Ohio. Source: Wedding invitation.
 
Christman, Elmer G.

  Born May 5, 1900, at Lewisville, Ohio, son of Jacob and Rachel Matz Christman.
  He moved to ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Born May 5, 1900, at Lewisville, Ohio, son of Jacob and Rachel Matz Christman.
He moved to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Wayne County in 1949 and retired in 1965 after 16 years as a food truck driver for Apple Creek Developmental Center.
  Mr. Christman was a member of St. Johns Evangelical and Reformed Church at Lewisville and Killbuck Valley Sportsman Club at Holmesville, Ohio.
  His wife, Clara Claus Christman died in 1966.

Christman, Evelyn C. (nee Blake)

Christman, 75, of Caldwell died Monday evening (February 23, 2004) at Summit Acres Nursing Home in Caldwell. She was born December 8, 1928, in Noble County to Harley and Matilda Arnold Blake. She had owned and operated Evelyn's Beauty Shop in Caldwell for many years and was a member of St. Stephen Catholic Church.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is survived by one son, Thomas A. Davis of Caldwell; one daughter, Sandi K. (Robert) Stapleton of Huffman, Texas; one stepson, Gerald Christman of Woodsfield; four grandchildren; and three great-grandchildren.

Christman, Forrest William
               Forrest William Christman was ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Forrest William Christman was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 born in Woodsfield, Ohio, February 25, 1885; he died April 30, 1907, at Grand Junction, Colorado. At his bedside was his brother, Glen Christman, and his sister, Celestia Christman, with Colorado friends, who watched the departing, and with sorrow, not without hope, wept over broken ties. Forrest was a consistent member of the Grand Junction Presbyterian Church having made profession of salvation soon after reaching Colorado. He was a member of the Bible class and <<<<<<< HEAD also of the Christian Endeavor Society. He was a member of the Woodmen of the World, and also the Women of Woodcraft or Circle, and also the Carpenters Union. Flowers were sent by those societies and orders and also by other ======= also of the Christian Endeavor Society. He was a member of the Woodmen of the World, and also the Women of Woodcraft or Circle, and also the Carpenter s Union. Flowers were sent by those societies and orders and also by other >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 friends of the deceased from his Colorado home.
               The funeral service was conducted from the home of his parents Sunday afternoon May 5th, at 2 oclock. The Reverend W. Loveridge OLIVER of the Presbyterian Church officiated. The songs used were the special favorites of the deceased - Ill Go Where You Want Me to Go, Saved by Grace, and Face to Face. The funeral text was from 1st. Corinthians, 15, 57, But thanks be to God who givith us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ. The body was carried to its resting ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The funeral service was conducted from the home of his parents Sunday afternoon May 5th, at 2 o clock. The Reverend W. Loveridge OLIVER of the Presbyterian Church officiated. The songs used were the special favorites of the deceased - I ll Go Where You Want Me to Go, Saved by Grace, and Face to Face. The funeral text was from 1st. Corinthians, 15, 57, But thanks be to God who givith us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ. The body was carried to its resting >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 place by twelve of his young friends - six of his girl friends carried flowers and preceded the casket in the funeral procession which was one of the largest Woodsfield has ever seen. The open grave was surrounded by nearly in not fully a thousand persons, whose sympathy for the living, and honor of the dead was thus demonstrated.
               Words ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Words >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 come from Colorado that are more comforting than legal appraisals of large inheritances - What a man is he takes with him. What he has he leaves behind him and yet a paradox is here, for what he takes is more to those behind than what he leaves.
               The Daily Sentinel of April 30 says: At an early hour this morning Forrest Christman, aged 22 years, a well known young carpenter of this city, died at 535 Grand Avenue where he has been boarding, after several weeks illness of ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The Daily Sentinel of April 30 says: At an early hour this morning Forrest Christman, aged 22 years, a well known young carpenter of this city, died at 535 Grand Avenue where he has been boarding, after several weeks illness of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 typhoid fever. With him when he died were his sister, Miss Celestia Christman and brother Glen Christman, both of Woodsfield, Ohio. This evening on Rio Grande No. 5, the remains will be shipped to the old home at Woodsfield where the interment will take place. The brother and sister accompanying the remains east.
               The Daily Sentinel of May 1, says: The remains of Forrest Christman were shipped to the old home in Ohio last night over Rio Grande No. 6. A large number of friends viewed the remains yesterday afternoon at the Rediker home. Thirty members of Book Cliff camp, Woodmen of the World, and 20 members of the loyal Carpenters Union escorted the remains from the residence to the union station.
               The Church news, in Colorado, of May 4th says; Not only the members of our church ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The Daily Sentinel of May 1, says: The remains of Forrest Christman were shipped to the old home in Ohio last night over Rio Grande No. 6. A large number of friends viewed the remains yesterday afternoon at the Rediker home. Thirty members of Book Cliff camp, Woodmen of the World, and 20 members of the loyal Carpenter s Union escorted the remains from the residence to the union station.
The Church news, in Colorado, of May 4th says; Not only the members of our church >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 but many others have sustained a sad loss in the of Forrest Christman who departed this life on last Tuesday morning at the home of Mrs. REDIKER on Grand Avenue. Mr. Christman was a carpenter by trade and an excellent Workman. He was a splendid young man in very particular. He became a Christian several years ago and united with the church under the present pastorate. His brother Casper Christman died in this city just a little more than three years ago of typhoid <<<<<<< HEAD fever. Forrests brother Glen Christman and sister Celestia Christman left with the body last Tuesday evening for Woodsfield, Ohio, the home of their parents, where the body will rest beside that of the brother. The parents, brother, and sister have the sincere sympathy of our people.
                The Bible class in Grand Junction, Colorado, April 30, 1907. To the Christman family: Since God in his divine providence ======= fever. Forrest s brother Glen Christman and sister Celestia Christman left with the body last Tuesday evening for Woodsfield, Ohio, the home of their parents, where the body will rest beside that of the brother. The parents, brother, and sister have the sincere sympathy of our people.
The Bible class in Grand Junction, Colorado, April 30, 1907. To the Christman family: Since God in his divine providence >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 has seen fit to call from our midst our loved fellow laborer, Forrest Christman, we bow in humble submission to His holy will, and wish thus to endeavor in a weak way to express our heartfelt sympathy to you in this sad hour of bereavement.
               In ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> In >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Forrest, we found a faithful Sabbath school attendant and an excellent Christian young man, whose influence was for the help of the cause of his Savior. In this deep sorrow, that must come to all it is most comforting to us to realize that someday we shall clasp glad hands in the heavenly land to be <<<<<<< HEAD forever with Jesus. May Gods spirit dwell richly in your hearts to comfort you and heal the wounds of this affliction in the prayer of the young mens Bible ======= forever with Jesus. May God s spirit dwell richly in your hearts to comfort you and heal the wounds of this affliction in the prayer of the young men s Bible >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 class of the Presbyterian Sabbath school of Grand Junction, of which Forrest was a member. Signed, C. J. Barnet, teacher; George White; Arthur Allen; Bliss Baker; Luther White; Walter Bechet; Walter Leclere and Rodney Robinson.
               It is sad to die - to break the tie that binds and watch our plans blown from our weary fingers, no more seen unless they are the blue prints of Gods ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> It is sad to die - to break the tie that binds and watch our plans blown from our weary fingers, no more seen unless they are the blue prints of God s >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 plans for future building.
               Solemn to die! - but when Christian carpenter goes on to consult with the carpenter Christian - when the apprentice passes on to higher plans and the Workman is promoted to the side of the foreman, who shall complain then and say that Romans 8, 28 is fiction?  W. L. Oliver.
Source:    The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Solemn to die! - but when Christian carpenter goes on to consult with the carpenter Christian - when the apprentice passes on to higher plans and the Workman is promoted to the side of the foreman, who shall complain then and say that Romans 8, 28 is fiction? W. L. Oliver.

Christman, Frederica (nee Pfalzgraf)
[Source:The Spirit of Democracy Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., June 6, 1901]
  Mrs. Frederica Christman, aged 60 years, wife ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Frederica Christman, aged 60 years, wife >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Jacob Christman of near Lewisville, Ohio, died May 29, 1901.
  Deceased was a daughter of Michael Pfalzgraf and ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Deceased was a daughter of Michael Pfalzgraf and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Elizabeth Diehl Pfalzgraf . She was a niece of Peter Diehl and a cousin of F. Diehl of Woodsfield.
  She was married to Jacob Christman in 1863, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> She was married to Jacob Christman in 1863, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and was a mother of eleven children -- seven girls and four boys: Barbara Frederica, Rose Ann, Mary, Jacob John, Lewis Philip, Louisa Christina; Anna Catherine; George Henry, David Samuel, Emma Matilda, and Minnie Saloma Christman.
  The remains were laid to rest in the ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The remains were laid to rest in the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lewisville cemetery May 30th. The funeral was largely attended.
  Mrs. Christman was a good Christian woman, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Christman was a good Christian woman, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 generous to all and a good provider for the family. She never allowed any one to go away from her door hungry.
  She leaves a husband and all of her children ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> She leaves a husband and all of her children >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to mourn the loss of a good wife and a kind mother.
 
 
Christman, Frederick
               Frederick Christman, son of Mr. ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Frederick Christman, son of Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Mrs. Henry Christman, born in Lower Steinbach, France, August 23, 1820, died March 18, 1911, aged 90 years, 6 months and 25 days. He emigrated to this country at the age of 11 years. The family settled at Pittsburg, Pennsylvania, and at the age of 17, he moved with the family to the farm now owned by Mr. Orlan HANKE, south of Mowrystown. He was baptized in the Lutheran Church in infancy. After moving to this country, he united with the Evangelical Lutheran Church at Arnheim, where he remained an active member until March 28, 1891, when he united with the Presbyterian Church at Mowrystown. He was married to Eva DIEHL, April 10, 1853, and to this union there were born ten children; six girls and four boys. He leaves a wife, seven children, twenty-three grandchildren, and six great grandchildren. He became afflicted 15 years ago which prevented him from attending divine services, but through all this sickness, he was quiet, patient and subservient to the will of his Maker. He became <<<<<<< HEAD suddenly worse on Friday evening and continued to grow worse until 2 oclock on Saturday morning when relieved him of all his earthly trials and sufferings. His last words were I am going. Mr. Christman was an honest, upright citizen, who valued his word as his bond and whenever he made an agreement he fulfilled it regardless of what his loss might be. Funeral service were held at the Mowrystown Presbyterian Church March 20, 1911, at 2 oclock in the afternoon. ======= suddenly worse on Friday evening and continued to grow worse until 2 o clock on Saturday morning when relieved him of all his earthly trials and sufferings. His last words were I am going. Mr. Christman was an honest, upright citizen, who valued his word as his bond and whenever he made an agreement he fulfilled it regardless of what his loss might be. Funeral service were held at the Mowrystown Presbyterian Church March 20, 1911, at 2 o clock in the afternoon. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Deceased was a brother-in-law of Mr. Fred DIEHL and had a large connection of other relatives in Monroe County.
Source:    The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Thursday, April 20, 1911
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
 
 
Christman, George H.
December 28, 1961
DEATH
George H. Christman
Source: Monroe County Beacon
   George H. Christman, age 84, a retired ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> George H. Christman, age 84, a retired >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 farmer, died early Tuesday morning, December 26th, at his home in Woodsfield.
   A son of the late Jacob and Fredericka ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> A son of the late Jacob and Fredericka >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Pfalzgraf Christman, he was born July 2, 1877, near Lewisville. His wife, Edna Baker Christman died November 25, 1958.
   Surviving are two daughters, Mrs. Dorothy ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Surviving are two daughters, Mrs. Dorothy >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Fischer of Grosse Pointe Woods, Michigan, and Mrs. Helen Christy, of Marion; two sons Wilfred Christman of Ann Arbor, Michigan and Edward Christman, of Southgate, Michigan; seven grandchildren and two great grandchildren; also four sisters, Miss Tillie Christman, Miss Louise Christman, Mrs. Anna Weber and Mrs. Minnie Heft, all of Lewisville.

Christman, Gertrude Elizabeth Kahrig

Gertrude E. Kahrig, nee Christman

     Woodsfield  Gertrude E. Kahrig, 84, of 33181 Main St., Lewisville, died at 1 a.m. Friday, Jan. 27, 1995, at the Monroe County Care Center, Woodsfield. 

     ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield Gertrude E. Kahrig, 84, of 33181 Main St., Lewisville, died at 1 a.m. Friday, Jan. 27, 1995, at the Monroe County Care Center, Woodsfield.

>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 She was born Jan. 7, 1911 at Lewisville, a daughter of the late George L. and Magdalena Matz Christman.

     She was a retired store clerk at the former Reichs Market in Barnesville and was a member of Trinity United Church of Christ near Lewisville, where she was a former Sunday School teacher and a member of the Womens Guild.

     ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was a retired store clerk at the former Reich s Market in Barnesville and was a member of Trinity United Church of Christ near Lewisville, where she was a former Sunday School teacher and a member of the Women s Guild.

>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Alfred W. Kahrig on Jan. 30, 1993; three sons, Marion Kahrig, Raymond Kahrig and Melvin Kahrig; one infant daughter; one sister, Esther Claus; two brothers, Arthur Christman and Clarence Christman.

     ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Surviving are one son, Lewis W. Kahrig and his wife, Teresa of Woodsfield, Ohio; three daughters, Mrs. Thomas E. (Lena) Pettit) of Columbus, Mrs. Charles E. (Marlene) Caldwell of Pataskala and Mrs. Larry (Myrna) Gardner of Graysville; one brother, Paul Christman of Cambridge; three sisters, Elman Burkhurt, Laura Kahrig and Beryl Claus of Lewisville; 15 grandchildren, 11 great grandchildren and on great-great granddaughter.

     Friends will be received at the Watters Funeral Home, 37501 Oho 78 West, Woodsfield, from 2 to 9 p.m. Saturday.  Rev. Richard Wilson officiates the funeral at the funeral home at 2 p.m. Sunday.  Burial follows in the Middle Church Cemetery near Lewisville.

>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Memorial contributions may be made to the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center, car of Activity Center, 37390 Airport Road, Woodsfield.

Christman, Gladys Reich
                Gladys Reich celebrated her 90th birthday ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Gladys Reich celebrated her 90th birthday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 anniversary on August 15, 2004. One week earlier, on August 8, all 43 members of her immediate family including children, grandchildren and great-grandchildren shared a lunch and had a group picture taken at Trinity United Church of Christ in Lewisville.
               Gladys was surprised and honored with visits from her nieces, nephews, church family and friends. The afternoon also included a slide show, which included pictures and movie clips from Gladys life.

It continued with the birth, growth, graduation, and marriages of her five children, Janet, Sandra, Larry, Rose and Vernon, 12 grandchildren, Frostie, Matt, Aimee, Mark, Jeff, Mike, Doug, Chris, Craig, Rachel, Nathan and Gregg, and 13 great-grandchildren, Alex, DeAnna, Andrea, Alicia, Jessica, Amelia, April, Megan, Carley, Casey, Ryan, Jason and Mariah.
