Christman, Miss Glenda J. and Mr. Larry E. Reich
1965
Marriage
Names: Mr. Larry E. Reich
and Miss Glenda J. Christman
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, dated, August 1965
 The small country Church, formerly known as ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The small country Church, formerly known as >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Middle Church of the Lewisville Trinity United Church of Christ, was the setting on Saturday, August 28, 1965, for the marriage of Miss Glenda J. Christman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eldon Christman, of Lewisville, Ohio and Larry E. Reich, son of Mr. and Mrs. Vernon Reich, also of Lewisville.
 A former pastor of the young, Reverend George ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> A former pastor of the young, Reverend George >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Varns, now of Edwardsport, Indiana, performed double ring ceremony. He was assisted by the Reverend Donald Stump, present pastor of Lewisville Trinity Church.
 Organ selections by Mrs. Amos DeWitt and vocal ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Organ selections by Mrs. Amos DeWitt and vocal >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 selections by Miss Kay Young preceded the wedding.
 The bride was given in marriage by her father. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The bride was given in marriage by her father. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 She wore a floor-length gown of satin and lace which she designed and made. Her only jewelry was a necklace which had been worn by her Grandmother Christman on her wedding day. She carried a bridal bouquet of white mums and ivy.
 The matron of honor was Mrs. Larry Hamilton, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The matron of honor was Mrs. Larry Hamilton, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Lebanon, Ohio. She wore a floor-length gown of mint green taffeta and carried a bouquet of yellow mums.
 Larry Hamilton served Mr. Reich as best man. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Larry Hamilton served Mr. Reich as best man. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ushers were Ronald Christman and Forest Frank and Vernie Reich was acolyte.
 Over two hundred guests were served at a ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Over two hundred guests were served at a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 reception at Fellowship Hall following the ceremony. Mrs. Freeman Kilburn and Mrs. Forest Frank were co- chairman of the reception. Miss Brenda Waligura, of Adena, and Miss Anne Wells, of Dayton, Ohio, former roommates of the bride, and Shirley Seebach, cousin of the bride, served at the reception table which was centered with a three-tiered wedding cake that had been baked and decorated by <<<<<<< HEAD the brides aunt, Mrs. Bill Seebach. Connie Seebach and Roselyn Reich greeted ======= the bride s aunt, Mrs. Bill Seebach. Connie Seebach and Roselyn Reich greeted >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and seated the guests. Mrs. Dale Yontz presided at the guest book.
 The brides mother wore a black and Brown eyelet embroidered sheath dress with black accessories and a corsage of yellow miniature mums. The bridegrooms mother wore a blue crepe two-piece dress with ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The bride s mother wore a black and Brown eyelet embroidered sheath dress with black accessories and a corsage of yellow miniature mums. The bridegroom s mother wore a blue crepe two-piece dress with >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 black and white miniature mums.
 For going away the bride changed to a toast ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> For going away the bride changed to a toast >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 colored knit dress with black accessories. The couple motored to Athens, Ohio. A welcome home reception planned by Athens friends surprised the couple when they arrived at their newly furnished apartment at 143 1/2 N. Lancaster Street.
 The new Mrs. Reich is a senior at Ohio ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The new Mrs. Reich is a senior at Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 University, majoring in Home Economics and Education. She is a member of Phi Upsilon Omicron, honorary fraternity of Home Economics Majors.
 Mr. Reich recently graduated from Ohio ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mr. Reich recently graduated from Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 University with a major in Science in Education. He is now teaching in the high school at Nelsonville, Ohio.
 On Friday evening, Mr. and Mrs. Vernon Reich ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> On Friday evening, Mr. and Mrs. Vernon Reich >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 were hosts for the rehearsal dinner attended by the wedding party and the immediate families of the couple.

Christman, Grant S.

  Woodsfield - ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield - >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Grant S. Christman, 90, of Miltonsburg-Calais Road died Saturday (Dec. 29, 2001) at his home.

Christman, Harold P.
Source--Dailey Jeffersonian   Cambridge, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Cambridge, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--June 9, 1986
Harold P. Christman, 76, Miltonsburg, died Saturday evening, June 7, 1986 in Barnesville Hospital.
He was born August 10, 1909, in Monroe County to the late Samuel and Maggie Goodballet Christman.
He was a retired school teacher and a member of Seneca Valley Church of Christ. He was a member of the Masonic Lodge of Somerton.
He leaves his wife, Helma Stephen Christman; three sons, Walton B., New Martinsville, West Virginia; W. Gene, Dundalk, Maryland and Gordon, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; seven grandchildren; three sisters, Agnes Lawson, Woodsfield; Mrs. Eva Brownfield, Bethesda and Edna Long, Quaker City; three brothers, Grant and Frank, both of Woodsfield, Rural Delivery 3 and <<<<<<< HEAD Vernon,of  Ashland.
======= Vernon,of Ashland. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Friends may call from 2:30 to 9 p.m. Tuesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield where services will be at 1 p.m. Wednesday with minister's James Gallagher and Michael Davis officiating. Burial will be in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.
 
Anniversary:
Christman, Harry Jacob and Goldia Grace Slack Christman
Please join our family on this joyous occasion when our parents, Mr. and Mrs. Harry Christman, celebrate sixty years of marriage at a reception in their honor on Sunday, the thirtieth of March, nineteen hundred and eighty-six from two until four in the afternoon in the Saint John's Hall, Miltonsburg, Ohio. Source: Anniversary invitation.

Christman, Helma G. Christman, born: April 7, 1911 , died: March 1, 2003
residence: Miltonsburg
Helma G. Christman nee Stephen
 
Source:The Marietta Times, Monday, March 3, 2003
   Woodsfield - ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield - >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Helma G. Stephen Christman, 91, of Ohio 145, Miltonsburg community, Woodsfield, died Saturday (March 1, 2003) at Barnesville Hospital. She was born April 7, 1911, in Monroe County to Wilbert and Anna Hannahs Stephen. She attended Seneca Valley Church of Christ and Bush Church of Christ in later years. She taught school for 31 years, Starting at the Miltonsburg two-room school. When it was closed, she went to Woodsfield Elementary, where she taught third grade. She was a quilter and her attention to detail and her skill making small stitches combined to produce several one-of-a-kind masterpiece quilts. She was the oldest living resident of Miltonsburg and was recognized as such by the Cleveland Plain Dealer in 2001.
   She was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 preceded in by her husband, Harold P. Christman; two sisters, Opal Johnson and Maxine Christman; and one brother, Clesson Stephen.
   She is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by three sons, Walt Christman and his wife, Nancy, of New Martinsville, W.Va., Gene Christman and his wife, Danna, of Baltimore, Md.,
and Gordon Christman and his wife, Sharon, of Houston, Texas; one sister, Neva Gray of Columbus; seven grandchildren; and 11 great-grandchildren.
   Services are ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at 11 a.m. Wednesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield.
 
Christman, Henrietta M.
Died: October 22, 1921
 
Christman, Herbert G.
Herbert G. Christman, 94, of Summerfield, died Friday, Nov. 26, 2004, in Good Samaritan Hospital in Zanesville, Ohio.
He was born Feb. 7, 1910, in Calais, Ohio, a son of the late John and Clara Ackerman Christman.
He was a graduate of Batesville High School and a farmer all his life.
In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by three brothers, Gilbert, Lee and an infant brother; one sister, Esta Burkhart; and an infant son.
 
Surviving are his wife, Eleanor Stephen Christman, whom he married Dec. 25, 1937; two sons, Loren (Mona) Christman of Charlestown, Ind., and Brian (Judy Lewis) Christman of Zanesville; three daughters, Lila (Vernon) Kirkbride of West Chester, Ohio, Lena Christman of Alexandria, Va., and Carol (Lanny) Butler of Zanesville; one brother, Howard Christman of Lewisville; three sisters, Helen Starr of Gahanna, Ohio, Mary Hayes of Quaker City and Cleo Carpenter of Lewisville; eight grandchildren, Kevin (Christy) Christman, Mark (Tonya) Christman, Darin (Treva) Kirkbride, Tana (Amit Gupta) Kirkbride, Kona Kirkbride, Laura Everly, Seth Everly and Mariah Butler; one stepgrandchild; four great-grandchildren and three stepgreat-grandchildren.
 
Visitation will be Sunday from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. at Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, 319 N. Chestnut St., Barnesville, where services will be on Monday at 11 a.m. Burial will follow in Calais Cemetery.
Source: The Times Leader, Martins Ferry, Ohio. Saturday, November 27, 2004
 
Christman, Herman V.

Christman, Jacob

Age 75 years, 4 months, and 9 days, widowed and a farmer. He was born April 16, 1837, in Monroe County, Ohio being a White male. His parents were George Jacob Christman and Eva ULLMAN; spouse was Christina Pfalzgraf; Undertaker was Bauer, Woodsfield, and burial was at Lewisville, Ohio. Cause of was paralysis of the heart.

Christman, Jacob John Christman
 
 June 5, 1867 ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> June 5, 1867 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Summit
 
Apr. 6, 1929
Lewisville
Jacob John Christman
The Spirit of Democracy Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, Wed., April 24, 1929
John Christman was born June 5, 1867, and departed from this life April 6, 1929, at the age of 61 years, 10 moths, and 1 day. He <<<<<<< HEAD was at St. Peters Evangelical Church, Lewisville, Ohio, in early youth. Later his membership was transferred to St. Johns Evangelical Church of Summit ======= was at St. Peter s Evangelical Church, Lewisville, Ohio, in early youth. Later his membership was transferred to St. John s Evangelical Church of Summit >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 township, where he was a member until . He was the son of Jacob and Fredrica Pfalzgraf Christman.
  He was united ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was united >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in marriage March 13, 1894, to Rachel Matz and to this union were born eight children: Mrs. Bertha Christman Neuhardt, Mrs. Edna Christman Young and Elmer Christman, of near Lewisville; Mrs. Oneida Christman Ludwig of Woodsfield; Mrs. Ruby Mann, Zelda and Gladys Christman of the home; one son preceded him in infancy.
  He had been in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He had been in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 failing health for several months but an attack of influenza caused complications which could not be overcome. Mr. Christman was a prosperous farmer, good neighbor, a devoted husband and father and not only will his loss be keenly felt in the home but in the entire community as well.
  The funeral services were conducted Tuesday morning at St. Johns Evangelical Church of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The funeral services were conducted Tuesday morning at St. John s Evangelical Church of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Summit township by his pastor, the Reverend Chester Guam in the presence of a large number of friends and relatives. The remains were laid to rest in the beautiful cemetery there. At the grave the services were conducted by the Barnhart Grange No. 1850 of which he had been a member for many years.
  Many beautiful floral offerings attested the sympathy of friends and relatives.
  He leaves to ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Many beautiful floral offerings attested the sympathy of friends and relatives.
He leaves to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 mourn his departure besides his faithful wife and children, ten grandchildren, and ten brothers, and sisters as follows: Mrs. Barbara Jackson, Mrs. William Ackerman, Louis Christman, of Woodsfield; Mrs. George Weber, Mrs. Fred Weber, Mrs. Louis Heft, Misses Tillie and Louise Christman, George and David Christman all of the vicinity of Lewisville.
  God moves in a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> God moves in a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 way that is very mysterious to us and so often we cannot understand but if we only trust Him, His grace will ever be sufficient for us. The family has the heartfelt sympathy of the entire community and we pray that God may send his comforter to those who mourn. V. L. F.
 
Christman, Miss Jean and Ernest Eugene Pugh
Miss Jean Christman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Elmer Christman, became the
bride of Ernest Eugene Pugh, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Pugh of Ellet, O.,
November 17. Rev. R. C. Rhody of Sullivan, Ind. officiated the exchange of
vows at the Barnesville Church of Christ. Several friends and relatives
witnessed the ceremony.
[Source:The Zanesville Recorder, Zanesville, Ohio, Thurday, November 18,
1941, p. 15]
 
Christman, Jeffery Alan and Rania Jo Hamilton

February 16, 1989

Source: Monroe County Beacon.

     Mr. and Mrs. Jerry E. Hamilton ======= JA'> Mr. and Mrs. Jerry E. Hamilton >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of 54235 New Castle Road, Beallsville are pleased to announce the engagement of their youngest daughter Rania Jo to Jeff A. Christman son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank A. Christman, Jr. of Route 1, Lewisville.

     The bride elect is a 1985 ======= JA'> The bride elect is a 1985 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 graduate of Beallsville High School and Swiss Hills Vocational School in and a 1987 graduate of Belmont Technical College, with an associate degree in accounting. Christman, Jennie  ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Christman, Jennie >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 [Source:The Spirit of Democracy Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., April 7, 1898 Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig]
 
  Died, near ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Died, near >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Calais, Ohio, March 26, 1898, Jennie Christman, age 27 years, wife of George Christman. Mrs. Christman was born in Summit township, Monroe County, Ohio, January 23, 1871, and married October 5, 1893. She was laid to rest in St. John=s Middle Church cemetery near Lewisville, Ohio on Monday, March 28. The funeral services were conducted by the Reverend Weise of Miltonsburg, Ohio. She leaves to mourn, a bereaved husband, George J. Christman and a little daughter of three summers, besides many near relatives and dear friends. A little son, Lonzo E. Christman, ten months old preceded her to the Heavenly home last October 1897. Jennie lived a Christian life. She believed in her God and Savior Jesus Christ and the great Hereafter. She believed on her bed that she was saved and that she would meet her dear relatives and friends in that Heavenly kingdom above. Her last words were: AI must leave you now. Good Bye.@ Dear Jennie she left us, but we hope not forever. Peace be to her soul.

Graduation:
Christman, Jerrod Walter, son of Myron and Joyce Johnson Christman, grandson of Clarence and Florence Dietz Christman

Funeral Service:
Christman, Kathleen, nee Alleman, spouse of Edward Miller Christman
Funeral service for Mrs. Edward (Kathleen) Christman
June 9, 1979, at Saint Paul Lutheran Church, Bolivar, Ohio at 2 p.m.. Pastor: George E. Hautala. Organist: Mrs. Adrian Helwick. Opening hymn: "O God, Our Help in Ages past." The invocation: In the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen. The service of the word: The Lord be with you. The Psalm: Psalm 27. The Lessons: roman 5:1-11 and John 5:24-30. The Responsory: I know that my Redeemer livith, and that he shall stand at the last day upon the earth; and in my flesh shall I see God. Whom I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another. The sermon: "The Unquenchable Light" Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace; according to thy word. For mine eyes have seen they salvation; which thou hast prepared before the face of all people. A light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of thy people Israel. glory be to the Father and to the Son and to the Holy Spirit, as it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end. Amen. The Prayer: O god, the Father in heaven, have mercy upon us. O God, the Son, Redeemer of he world, have mercy upon us. O God, the Holy Spirit, the Comforter, Grant us thy peace. The Benediction: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Love of god, and the Communion of the Holy spirit, be with you all. Amen.
 
Christman, Kathryn L., nee Herbert
LEWISVILLE, Ohio - Kathryn L. Christman, 89, of 48176 State Route 145, Lewisville, died Monday (July 19, 2004) in the Wetzel County Hospital in New Martinsville, W.Va.
She was born August 8, 1914, near Miltonsburg, Ohio, a daughter of the late John W. and Lillie Keil Herbert. She was a homemaker and a member of Trinity United Church of Christ near Lewisville.
Surviving are two sons, Philip W. Christman of Middletown, Ohio, and Jerry I. Christman of Staten Island, N.Y.; one grandson, Erik Christman; and two great-grandchildren, Jackson Robert Christman and Kaitlyn Judith Christman.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in by her husband, Philip M. "Bus" Christman, on July 5, 1987; and a brother in infancy.
Services are at 11 a.m. Monday at Watters Funeral Home, 37501 State Route 78 West, Woodsfield, with the Rev. Karen Binford officiating. Burial will follow in the Middle Church Cemetery near Lewisville. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Sunday at the funeral home.
Source--Marietta Times    Marietta, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Marietta, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published---July 22, 2004

Christman, Laura Melinda (nee Baker )
September 20, 1874
December 5, 1919, residence: Lewisville
Laura Melinda Christman, (nee Baker) [The Monroe County Beacon Woodsfield, Ohio, December 1919]
  Laura Melinda ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Laura Melinda >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Marx Baker, was born September 20, 1874, near Lewisville, Ohio. As an infant she received the sacrament of holy baptism according to the rites of the Evangelical Church. Later she renewed these baptismal vows in her confirmation.
   On October ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On October >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 15, 1898, she was united in holy wedlock with Mr. Charles E. Christman, of near Lewisville, Ohio. What cannot be said with honesty of many professing Christians, can be said of her, the devoted wife and loving mother, as all her acquaintances knew her to be.
  For two weeks the deceased was suffering from typhoid fever. It finally pleased our Heavenly Father to call her from this world of care and to translate her into her eternal home. She was prepared to meet her Savior and glad of His advent. It was 1:10 oclock last Friday morning, December 5, 1919, that she gave up the spirit, without a struggle.
  The deceased ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> For two weeks the deceased was suffering from typhoid fever. It finally pleased our Heavenly Father to call her from this world of care and to translate her into her eternal home. She was prepared to meet her Savior and glad of His advent. It was 1:10 o clock last Friday morning, December 5, 1919, that she gave up the spirit, without a struggle.

  May our ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> May our >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Heavenly Father strengthen the bereaved in this their hour of sadness. That is the prayer of all their friends.
  Funeral services were conducted last Sunday at the home and at St. Johns Evangelical Church of Summit township. The remains were laid to rest in the St. Johns ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral services were conducted last Sunday at the home and at St. John s Evangelical Church of Summit township. The Reverend Otto Muecke, of Miltonsburg, conducted the services.
  The deceased ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The deceased >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 had reached the age of 45 years, 2 months and 2 weeks. Thus are we called to our heavenly home in the midst of life. She died in her home near Lewisville, Ohio.
  May God, the great comforter, strengthen those who are left behind.    Memento Mori!

Lawrence H. Christman
 
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, September 1990 From the Collection of Beryl Christman Claus
 
Lawrence H. Christman, 87, Bucyrus, died September 13, 1990, in Heartland of Bucyrus, Ohio. The son of Jacob and Anna Claus Christman, he was born August 6, 1903, in Monroe County, Ohio. He married Martha (Campbell) Christman June 1, 1935. She survives. Also surviving are three children: Mrs. Thomas (Carol) Creger and Mrs. Gerald (Jeanette) Harris, Bucyrus, and Dale Christman, Galion, Ohio; five half-brothers; Thurman Christman, Jerusalem, Ohio; Delmar Christman, Nevada; Wilbur Christman, Caledonia; Edward Christman, Bolivar; and Robert Christman, Bucyrus, Ohio; a half sister, Louise Bowers, Bucyrus; 13 grandchildren and two great-grandchildren.
 
Preceding him in were a brother, Ernest Christman, and a sister, Celesta Welty.
 
A member of Zion Chapel United Methodist Church, Lawrence moved to Crawford County in 1925. He was employed by the Elger Pfleiderer family for seven years and then bred and raised Angus cattle on his farm. Funeral services were held in the Wise Funeral Home with the Reverend Jack Hay officiating. Burial was in Union Cemetery, Sulphur Springs.
 
 
Lee H. Christman
 
Source:The Marietta Times, dated Tuesday, July 22, 2003
Quaker City - Lee H. Christman, 91, of 52173 Ohio 379, Quaker City, died at 12:45 a.m. today (July 22, 2003) at Barnesville Hospital in Barnesville. He was born March 19, 1912, in Calais to John W. and Clara Ackerman Christman. He was a retired farmer and was a member of Seneca Valley Church of Christ at Calais. He enjoyed doing needlepoint pictures as a hobby.
 
He is survived by his wife, Margaret Earley Christman, whom he married on May 19, 1934; three sons, Dale Christman and his wife, Joan, of Lewisville, Ralph Christman and his wife, Karen, of St. Joseph, Mich., and Roger Christman and his wife, Janet, of Baltimore, Ohio; two brothers, HoWard Christman of Lewisville and Herbert Christman of Summerfield; three sisters, Helen Starr of Gahanna, Mary Hayes of Quaker City and Cleo Carpenter of Lewisville; eight grandchildren; eight great-grandchildren; and several nieces and nephews.
 
He was preceded in by his parents; two brothers, Gilbert and Lester Christman; one sister, Esta Burkhart; and one daughter in infancy.
 
Services are at 2 p.m. Friday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Frank Love officiating. Burial is in Calais Cemetery in Calais. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday at the funeral home.

 April 3, 1918

June 11, 1918
Calais
Lester Vearl Christman [Source:Newspaper article June, 1918]
  Once more we ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Once more we >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are called upon to part with a dear little baby. Lester Vearl Christman son of Mr. and Mrs. John Christman, of Calais, Ohio, was born April 3, 1918, and departed his life on June 11, 1918, being at the age of his ten short weeks. He leaves to mourn his departure his grieving parents, four brothers, Gilbert, HoWard, Herbert, and Lee; three sisters, Esta, Helen, and Mary, all of the home and a host of relatives and friends. Only a few days had been with them but it takes only a few moments to leArn to love a baby. It is hard to part with the <<<<<<< HEAD little ones, but we should remember the words of our Savior, Suffer the little children to come unto me, for of such is the kingdom of heaven.
  On June 13, many relatives and friends gathered at the home to comfort his grieving parents. His body was laid to rest in the Calais cemetery, Calais, Ohio just a few steps from his mothers door.
======= little ones, but we should remember the words of our Savior, Suffer the little children to come unto me, for of such is the kingdom of heaven.

Death

Tuesday, November 20, 2001

Christman, LInda Lee Logsdon

Logsdon, Linda Lee (Christman)

     Linda Lee (Christman) Logsdon, age 48, died Thursday, November 15, 2001, at Kobacker House.  Graduate of Upper Arlington High School, Class of 71, she attended O.S.U. and Columbus State.  She was Administrative Associate for Clinical Cancer Genetics at the James Cancer Hospital and Solove Research Center at O.S.U. Medical Center.  Member of Women ======= JA'> Linda Lee (Christman) Logsdon, age 48, died Thursday, November 15, 2001, at Kobacker House. Graduate of Upper Arlington High School, Class of 71, she attended O.S.U. and Columbus State. She was Administrative Associate for Clinical Cancer Genetics at the James Cancer Hospital and Solove Research Center at O.S.U. Medical Center. Member of Women >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in Music-Columbus, she was an accomplished violinist. Survived by husband, Russell W.; parents, Richard L. and Mary Anne Christman, all of Columbus; brothers, Mark (Ann) Christman of Georgetown, Ky., David (Kelly) Christman of Saratoga, Wyom.; nieces, Jody Blair, Kendall, Taylor, Katie and Emily Christman; nephew, Justin Christman; great-nieces, Lauren and Danielle Blair. A memorial service will be held 2 p.m. Tuesday, November 27 at Boulevard <<<<<<< HEAD Presbyterian Church, 1235 Northwest Blvd.  In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the Kobacker House, 3595 Olentangy River Rd., Columbus, Oh. 43214.  ======= Presbyterian Church, 1235 Northwest Blvd. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the Kobacker House, 3595 Olentangy River Rd., Columbus, Oh. 43214. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Arrangements by Cook & Sons-Pallay Funeral Home.

 

 
Christman, Lorna Lou
MARRIAGE of Lorna Lou Christman, to Mr. Harold William Good
Source: The Monroe county Beacon, dated Jan. 8, 1945
 
Mr. and Mrs. R. E. Christman of Maple Avenue, are announcing the marriage of their youngest daughter Lorna Lou, to Mr. Harold William Good, of New Lebanon, Ohio.
 
The wedding was an event of Saturday afternoon, December 23, at Covington, Kentucky, with the Rev. E. C. Rose performing the ceremony.
 
Mrs. Good is a member of the 1944 graduating class of the Woodsfield High School.
 
The happy young couple are both employed at the Dayton Rubber Company and are making their home in Dayton. They have the best wishes of their many friends.

Mr. Christman had been a resident of Center township, Monroe County, Ohio for many years and was well and favorably known. He leaves nine children. He was born in Germany and came to America when 14 years of age. The surviving children are Jacob Christman of Greeley, Colorado; Louis Christman of Lewisville, Ohio; Henry Christman of Barnesville, Ohio; Mrs. Barbara DIEHL of Clinton; Samuel, William, and Andrew G. Christman, and Mrs. William RICER and Mrs. Fred Schneider of Woodsfield. The funeral took place Wednesday.

Christman, Lucinda Rosan
 [The Monroe Gazette Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> [The Monroe Gazette Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 February 23, 1893]
 In Memory of the of Miss Lucinda Rosan ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> In Memory of the of Miss Lucinda Rosan >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christman.
  Jesus said unto them: Give place for the maid is not dead but sleepeth. Matthew II, 24. The Angel of has again called ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Jesus said unto them: Give place for the maid is not dead but sleepeth. Matthew II, 24. The Angel of has again called >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 away one of our beloved maidens Miss Lucinda Rosan Christman, daughter of Godfred and Catherine Bauman Christman, at the early age of 25 years, 10 months, and 11 days. She was born March 31, 1867, was taken in Covenant of God when an infant child, by baptism, and taken into the Church of Christ when a young lady of 14 years by Confirmation. The vow she made unto her savior on Confirmation Day she faithfully kept and led a Christian life until the day of her .
   Somewhat more than a year ago she began to fail and ever since she has been wasting away until Sunday, February 12th, 1893 when her spirit departed this world and ascended to the Promised land of eternity. Tuesday the 14th her body was laid in the St. Johns Middle Church ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Somewhat more than a year ago she began to fail and ever since she has been wasting away until Sunday, February 12th, 1893 when her spirit departed this world and ascended to the Promised land of eternity. Tuesday the 14th her body was laid in the St. John s Middle Church >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Cemetery to rest until the great resurrection day.
   One sister died in 1871, and a brother, Ludwig J. Christman, died February 18, 1889. She leaves a father, mother, six brothers, and one sister to mourn her departure. often comes unexpected and often we see it coming gradually. Often sickness precedes and very often a broken heart precedes . will come sooner or later for each and everyone. Although  is not swallowed up in victory there is no loss, but again for calleth to rest. Sleep on, beloved sleep and take thy rest, lay down thy head upon the Saviors breast. We love thee well, but Jesus loves thee best. Good night.
    Reverend J. R. Mueller of Miltonsburg ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> One sister died in 1871, and a brother, Ludwig J. Christman, died February 18, 1889. She leaves a father, mother, six brothers, and one sister to mourn her departure. often comes unexpected and often we see it coming gradually. Often sickness precedes and very often a broken heart precedes . will come sooner or later for each and everyone. Although is not swallowed up in victory there is no loss, but again for calleth to rest. Sleep on, beloved sleep and take thy rest, lay down thy head upon the Savior s breast. We love thee well, but Jesus loves thee best. Good night.
Reverend J. R. Mueller of Miltonsburg >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 conducted the funeral services.
 
Christman, Magdalena (Lena) Ackerman  X
             Woodsfield - Mrs. Lena Christman Ackerman, 85, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> X
Woodsfield - Mrs. Lena Christman Ackerman, 85, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 died Monday at her home on Lewisville Rt. 1, after an illness of several years.
             Funeral services will be held Friday morning ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral services will be held Friday morning >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at 10 o'clock at the home in charge of Rev. Walter Togler, pastor of the Evangelical and Reformed Church, Woodsfield.
             Burial will be at the cemetery of St. John's Church, Summit township.
            Mrs. Ackerman was born in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Burial will be at the cemetery of St. John's Church, Summit township.
Mrs. Ackerman was born in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Monroefield, the daughter of Philip and Rosina Pfalzgraf Christman. Surviving are her husband, John A. Ackerman, and two step children, Ben Ackerman, Lewisville Route 1, and Mrs. Chester Schwartz of Bucyrus and seven grandchildren.
             Also surviving are one brother, George L. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Also surviving are one brother, George L. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christman of Lewisville Route 1, two sisters, Mrs. Barbara Morris of Salesville, and Mrs. Mary Miller of Quaker City. She was one of a family of 12 children. Two brothers and six sisters preceded her.
Source: The Zanesville Signal, Zanesville, Ohio, Wednesday, August 25, 1943
 
Christman, <<<<<<< HEAD Magdalena Lena Ackerman
======= Magdalena Lena Ackerman >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published---1958, typed by betty Lendon Matson
   In loving memory of our wife and mother, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> In loving memory of our wife and mother, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Lena S. Christman, who passed away one year ago , April 2, 1957.
   Just a thought of sweet remembrance,
   Just a memory fond and true,
   Just a token of affection
   And a heartache still for you.
 
   We loved her, as no one can tell
   How much we loved her and how well;
   God loved her ,too, and thought it best
   To take her home with Him to rest.
 Sadly missed by the family.

To take her home with Him to rest.

Christman, Mrs. Mary (nee Shell)
               Mrs. Mary Christman, nee Schell, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. Mary Christman, nee Schell, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 aged 72 years, 6 months, and 3 days, wife of Louis Christman, died at her home near Woodsfield, May 9, 1904. She was married to Louis Christman February 25, 1851. To this union were born 12 children, 9 of whom are still living. The funeral took place Tuesday and was conducted by the Reverend Theodore HAFELE with the interment in the Woodsfield cemetery. After the service at the grave, services were held at the Lutheran church. Mrs. Christman was a good woman.
Source:    The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Thurs., May 12, 1904
 

1959

Christman, Mary Miller

Sunday is Mothers Day

======= JA'>Sunday is Mother s Day

>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

By Nola R. LeVrange

     Jerusalem-Sunday is Mothers Day  all over the United States, mothers will receive recognition. Even though they may be honored on other occasions during this year  this is different. ======= JA'> Jerusalem-Sunday is Mother s Day all over the United States, mothers will receive recognition. Even though they may be honored on other occasions during this year this is different. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 This is their day!

     A typical mother to be remembered this week is Mrs. Mary Christman Miller of Jerusalem.  She is like the mother pictured in a poem ======= JA'> A typical mother to be remembered this week is Mrs. Mary Christman Miller of Jerusalem. She is like the mother pictured in a poem >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 once written by Mary Dow Brine:

 

            The ======= JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 woman was old and ragged and gray

            And bent with the chill of the winters day.

            The street was wet with a ======= JA'> And bent with the chill of the winter s day.

The street was wet with a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 recent snow

            And the womans feet were aged and slow-.

======= JA'> And the woman s feet were aged and slow-.

>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

 

     The poem tells the story of a lad who paused to help the aged lady across the street and his comment to his companions was: Shes somebodys mother, boys, you know, For all shes aged and poor and slow.

     Mrs. Mary Christman Miller is somebodys mother.  She differs from the poem in the respect that she is not ragged and poor, and her 88 years have ======= JA'> The poem tells the story of a lad who paused to help the aged lady across the street and his comment to his companions was: She s somebody s mother, boys, you know, For all she s aged and poor and slow.

Mrs. Mary Christman Miller is somebody s mother. She differs from the poem in the respect that she is not ragged and poor, and her 88 years have >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 not dimmed her countenance nor her spirit.

     A true mother, this kindly old lady lived alone in a neat little cottage.  And her time is not idly spent.  With deft fingers, she still pieces and quilts bed covers for her grandchildren and great-grandchildren.  ======= JA'> A true mother, this kindly old lady lived alone in a neat little cottage. And her time is not idly spent. With deft fingers, she still pieces and quilts bed covers for her grandchildren and great-grandchildren. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 She had done some for each of her own children.

     Of Dutch descent, Mrs. Miller has spent her young womanhood and reared her six children in southeastern Ohio.  The wife of a hard-working farmer, ======= JA'> Of Dutch descent, Mrs. Miller has spent her young womanhood and reared her six children in southeastern Ohio. The wife of a hard-working farmer, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 she never shirked her share of the work-she never hired a baby-sitter for her children-she never employed the modern conveniences that help a mother today.

     It is exemplary of her mother ======= JA'> It is exemplary of her mother >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 heart to show her concern about her loved ones. She has a keen memory and can name each of her 19 grandchildren, tell where they are and what they are doing, and name her 11 great-grandchildren.

     Although her advanced age and ======= JA'> Although her advanced age and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 years of hard work have left her slightly stooped, she does her quilting without the aid of glasses, and hears very well.

     Each year she has her garden and does her own housework.  Her home ======= JA'> Each year she has her garden and does her own housework. Her home >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 reflects the manner in which she has lived her life, clean and orderly.

     This Sunday there will possibly be many Mrs. Millers honored, there will be many aged mothers honored.  But few will be more deserving than this Mrs. Miller whose mother-love is reflected in her countenance and her eyes as she talks of her own children.  Toil has ======= JA'> This Sunday there will possibly be many Mrs. Millers honored, there will be many aged mothers honored. But few will be more deserving than this Mrs. Miller whose mother-love is reflected in her countenance and her eyes as she talks of her own children. Toil has >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 knarled the fingers but with a labor of love she stitches each quilt, and these will be cherished for many years by those who receive them.

 

 

 
Christman, Mary Judith Kilburn

November 3, 1988

4-H SERVICE

Judy Kilburn

Source: Monroe County Beacon

 

     Judy Kilburn, advisor for the Blue Jean Guys and Gals 4-H Club was honored at the recent 4-H Advisor's Banquet for her  30 years of service as a ======= JA'> Judy Kilburn, advisor for the Blue Jean Guys and Gals 4-H Club was honored at the recent 4-H Advisor's Banquet for her 30 years of service as a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 4-H advisor. In recognition of those 30 years of service, Judy was also presented with a ruby 4-H Advisor's Recognition Luncheon.

     Judy started her career as a 4-H ======= JA'> Judy started her career as a 4-H >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 advisor in 1955 when she started the Hilltop Stock Club. Several of her current 4-H members are grandchildren to the children she advised 30 years ago. Through all these years she has remained a dedicated and devoted advisor. Parents and fellow advisors will quickly comment that Judy is "always willing to share her time and take her time with the children, they love her for it."

(Judy is the daughter of Howard and Hazel Christman, granddaughter of John <<<<<<< HEAD and Clara Christman, Great granddaughter of  ======= and Clara Christman, Great granddaughter of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Eva Christman)

Engagement
Christman, Mary and Stanley Stephens
Source--Monroe County Beacon    Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--August  1954   
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--August 1954
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Mr. and Mrs. Harry Christman, of Lewisville, are announcing the engagement of their eldest daughter, Mary Margaret to Stanley Edward Stephens, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clarence Stephens, of Jerusalem. No date has been set for the wedding as of yet.
 
Christman, Matthew

Honor

January 18, 1996

The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio

Christman Promoted

     Matthew Christman, son of Harry ======= JA'> Matthew Christman, son of Harry >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Connie Christman, of SR 800, was recently promoted to Coordinator of Public Relations for Goodwill Rehabilitation Center in Columbus.

     A 1990 graduate of River High ======= JA'> A 1990 graduate of River High >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 School and a 1994 graduate of Marietta College, Christman began working for the rehabilitation center in Sept. of 1994.

     In his first year of professional employment, he was awarded a 1995 Prism Award from the Public Relations Society of America for producing an outstanding internal newsletter for a non-profit agency.  In August, he was appointed to the International Association of Business Communicators ======= JA'> In his first year of professional employment, he was awarded a 1995 Prism Award from the Public Relations Society of America for producing an outstanding internal newsletter for a non-profit agency. In August, he was appointed to the International Association of Business Communicator s >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 (Columbus Chapter) Board as newsletter editor.

     Goodwill Rehabilitation Center is a division of Goodwill Industries International and works to habilitate and rehabilitate persons with physical and mental disabilities.  The Center focuses on providing vocational ======= JA'> Goodwill Rehabilitation Center is a division of Goodwill Industries International and works to habilitate and rehabilitate persons with physical and mental disabilities. The Center focuses on providing vocational >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 training, employment coaching and job placement to more than 1,600 Ohioans each year.

 
Christman, Maxine E. Christman, nee Stephens
Source:The Daily Jeffersonian, Cambridge, OH, November 2, 2000
  Maxine E. Christman, 87, of Woodsfield, died ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Maxine E. Christman, 87, of Woodsfield, died >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Tuesday (October 31, 2000) at her home.
  She was born April 17, 1913, in Calais, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> She was born April 17, 1913, in Calais, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughter of the late Wilbert and Anna (Hannahs) Stephen.
  Mrs. Christman was a member of the Seneca ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Christman was a member of the Seneca >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Valley Church of Christ.
  She was preceded in by a sister, Opal ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> She was preceded in by a sister, Opal >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Johnson, and a daughter-in-law, Wanda Christman.
  She leaves her husband, Grant Christman of ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> She leaves her husband, Grant Christman of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Woodsfield; a son, Lamont Christman of Columbus; a brother, Clesson Stephen of Clairton, Pa.; two sisters, Helma Christman of Miltonsburg and Neva Gray of Columbus; two grandsons, Lyndon (Marianne) Christman of Galion and Eric (Brenda) Christman of Dublin; eight great-grandchildren. Friends may call from 2 to 5 p.m. Friday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services will be 1 p.m. Saturday with Vernon Sorg officiating. Burial will be in Calais Cemetery.
 
Christman, Melissa Ann and Samuel Ervin Wilson

Source: Monroe County Beacon

     Miss Melissa Ann Christman, ======= JA'> Miss Melissa Ann Christman, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles E. Christman and granddaughter of Mr. and Mrs. Roy Christman, and Samuel Ervin Wilson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Willard "Bill" Wilson of Woodsfield, were united in marriage June 4 at 1:59 p.m. at St. Paul's United Church of Christ in Woodsfield.  Pastor Richard Wright officiated at the ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Pastor Richard Wright officiated at the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 double ring ceremony.

     Decorations of the church ======= JA'> Decorations of the church >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 consisted of two, seven branch candelabra decorated with two large bouquets of ivy, fern, daisies and baby carnations, dyed to match the wedding colors.

     The altar consisted on two white ======= JA'> The altar consisted on two white >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 candles on each side. The centerpiece for the altar was a large bouquet of white roses, pink and burgundy tea roses, ivy and ribbon accents, placed in the middle of the arrangement was a large white prayer candle.

     Mrs. Jane Kamp played several ======= JA'> Mrs. Jane Kamp played several >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 organ selection before the procession. The traditional "Wedding March' was played. Miss Nicki Christman and Mrs. Susan Dick, cousins of the bride sang "The Rose" and "Through the Eyes of Love" before the ceremony. Mrs. Susan Dick and "The Lord's Prayer" during the ceremony.

     Before the procession, the ======= JA'> Before the procession, the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bridegroom's father lit the candelabra, the altar candles and the prayer candles for the bride and bridegroom.

     The bride was escorted to the ======= JA'> The bride was escorted to the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 altar by her father and was given in marriage by their parents.

     The bride chose a silk ======= JA'> The bride chose a silk >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Southernbelle wedding gown. The dress featured a scalloped, low cut neckline accented with seed pearls and lace, the puffed bishop sleeves were worn off the shoulders.

     They featured lace and pearl ======= JA'> They featured lace and pearl >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 accents. The natural waistline extended to form and circular skirt which extended into the cathedral length train edged with tiers of silk ruffles and lace accents.

     The bride's headpiece consisted ======= JA'> The bride's headpiece consisted >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of a halo of white silk roses, seed pearl sprays and pearl cluster. The halo had a tiered illusion effect in the back with ruffled edges at the end of the veil.

     Her jewelry consisted of single ======= JA'> Her jewelry consisted of single >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 strand of pearls that belonged too her late grandmother, Mildred Thomas, and diamond teardrop earrings, given to her by the bridegroom. She followed the tradition of something old, something new, something borrowed and something blue.

      She carried a large cascading ======= JA'> She carried a large cascading >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bouquet of white roses, pink and burgundy tea roses with ivy and fern accents.

     Kathy Dugan, friend of the bride, served as maid of honor. Other attendants included Marsha Wilson, sister in low of the bridegroom; Amanda Brown, friend of the couple; Krista Petty, cousin of the b ride. Jessica Hartline, cousin of the  bride served as flower girl.

     Erin and Erica Christman ======= JA'> Erin and Erica Christman >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 attended the guest book and distributed the wedding programs.

     Following the ceremony a ======= JA'> Following the ceremony a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 reception was held at the Woodsfield elementary School. A buffet supper was catered and served by Wanda Zonker. The cake was baked and served the Catherine Ault.

The bridegroom is a graduate of Skyvue High School and Swiss Hills Vocational School. He is presently employed at Elby's in New Martinsville, WV.

Freda Reich Landefeld.

Christman, Nora Bruce
 
 May 8, 1895
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> May 8, 1895 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
July 9, 1915
 
Ozark
 
 
Christman, Nora (nee BRUCE)
               Nora BRUCE Christman, daughter of ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Nora BRUCE Christman, daughter of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mr. and Mrs. J. W. BRUCE, was born in Antioch, Monroe County, Ohio May 8, 1895. On May 8, 1913, she was united in marriage to Elmer W. Christman. She was a member of the M. E. Church and a regular attendant at Sunday school and Epworth League, being a member of both organizations. She departed this life July 9, 1915, at the home of her parents in Ozark, Ohio at the age of 20 years, 2 months and 1 day. She leaves to mourn her husband, mother, father, two brothers and six sisters. Her brothers and sisters are: Mr. Edgar BRUCE of Summerfield, Ohio; Mr. John BRUCE of San Gabriel, California; Mrs. John Brown of Seville, Ohio; Mrs. Clark CRAMER of Lowell, Ohio; Mrs. Elon WICKES of Antioch, Ohio; Mrs. Carl Crum of Ozark, Ohio; Mrs. Elmer Crum ofBeallsville, Ohio, Ohio and Freda BRUCE at home.
               The funeral was held at her ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The funeral was held at her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 parents home and she was laid to rest in the Ozark cemetery Sunday afternoon July 11th. Reverend GODDARD of Woodsfield conducted the services. The large attendance marked the esteem and sympathy of hundreds of friends.
Source:    The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Thursday, July 22, 1915
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
 
 
Dr. Novembera A. Christman
Source:Memory card, May 3, 1992

Christman, Paul Chester
   Paul Christman, son of Mr. and Mrs. George ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Paul Christman, son of Mr. and Mrs. George >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 L. Christman of Lewisville Route 1, who was inducted into the U.S. Army, recently is now stationed at Camp Crowder, Missouri. He was graduated from Lewisville High School in 1935, and a Junior in his studies at Ohio University, Athens, majoring in Industrial Arts. He had been engaged in teaching school and was a teacher in the 7th and 8th grades at Franklin School, Wayne County before being inducted.

Christman, Philip H.
 [Source:The Monroe Gazette Woodsfield, Ohio, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> [Source:The Monroe Gazette Woodsfield, Ohio, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Thurs., February 23, 1893]
  Mr. Philip H. Christman an aged and very highly respected citizen of Seneca township, Monroe County died on the 16 day of February 1893, of asthma, aged 66 years. Mr. Christman was born in Oberstainbach, Niederelsass, Germany on the 27th day of March 1827, the son of George Jacob and Eva Ullman Christman. He was one of Seneca townships ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mr. Philip H. Christman an aged and very highly respected citizen of Seneca township, Monroe County died on the 16 day of February 1893, of asthma, aged 66 years. Mr. Christman was born in Oberstainbach, Niederelsass, Germany on the 27th day of March 1827, the son of George Jacob and Eva Ullman Christman. He was one of Seneca township s >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 wealthiest farmers, a good citizen, noted wherever known for his honesty and generosity. A member of the Lutheran Church for many years, he lived a Christian life. He leaves to mourn his a loving wife, 2 sons, 7 daughters and many other relatives and admiring friends. His remains were laid to rest in the St.
Johns Middle ======= mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'>John s Middle >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Church cemetery near Lewisville, Ohio the 19th day of February 1893. The Reverend J. R. Mueller of Miltonsburg conducted the funeral services.
 
Christman, Philip Marion

Philip Christman, 74

     Philip Buss Marion Christman, 74, of Route 1, Lewisville, Ohio, died at 4:15 a.m. Sunday, July 5, 1987 at his home following an apparent heart attack.  He was born in Monroe County, Ohio on June 12, 1913, a son of the late Philip F. and Cora Gutberlet Christman.  Mr. Christman was a 1950 graduate of Wilmington College, Wilmington, Ohio, graduating with a B.S. degree in education.  He was a retired schoolteacher serving 40 years in various Monroe County, Ohio schools.  He was a U.S. Army veteran serving during ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Philip Buss Marion Christman, 74, of Route 1, Lewisville, Ohio, died at 4:15 a.m. Sunday, July 5, 1987 at his home following an apparent heart attack. He was born in Monroe County, Ohio on June 12, 1913, a son of the late Philip F. and Cora Gutberlet Christman. Mr. Christman was a 1950 graduate of Wilmington College, Wilmington, Ohio, graduating with a B.S. degree in education. He was a retired schoolteacher serving 40 years in various Monroe County, Ohio schools. He was a U.S. Army veteran serving during >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 W.W. II, member of Monroe Lodge #189 F. & A.M. Woodsfield, Member of the Ohio State Teachers Association, National Teachers Association, Monroe County Teachers Association and was a lifetime member of the D.A.V. Columbus, Ohio Chapter.

     ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 On January 3, 1942, he married Kathryn Herbert who survives of the home. Also surviving are 2 sons, Philip W. Christman of Middletown, Ohio and Jerry I. Christman or New York City, N.Y.; 1 brother, Benjamin H. Christman of Batesville, Oho; 1 grandson, Erik J. Christman of Middletown, Ohio.  He was preceded in death by 1 sister and 5 ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> He was preceded in death by 1 sister and 5 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 brothers; Florence Neuhart, Irvle, Bernard, Walter, Vernon and Herman Christman.

     Friends were received at the Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, Ohio where funeral services were held Wednesday, July 8, 1987 with Dr. Rev. Gary Wilson of the Trinity United Church of Christ officiating.  Burial followed in the Middle Church Cemetery new Lewisville, Ohio.  Memorial contributions ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends were received at the Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, Ohio where funeral services were held Wednesday, July 8, 1987 with Dr. Rev. Gary Wilson of the Trinity United Church of Christ officiating. Burial followed in the Middle Church Cemetery new Lewisville, Ohio. Memorial contributions >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 may be made to the American Heart Association, 110 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793, Masonic services were held Tuesday, July 7, 1987 a the funeral home.

 
Christman, Philip W. Age 62, of Middletown, passed away Thursday, January 13, 2005 at his residence. He was born in Monroe County, Ohio, September 5, 1942 the son of Philip and Katherine (Herbert) Christman, and had lived in Westerville for a number of years before moving to Middletown. He retired from Middletown Federal. Mr. Christman was a member of the Masonic Lodge and the Shriners of Columbus; was active with Ducks Unlimited; and had served on the Board of Arts in Middletown. He and his wife, Judy had previously Chaired the Charity Ball. He is survived by his son, Erik (wife Holli) of Mason, Ohio; a grandson, Jackson; a granddaughter, Kaitlyn; a brother, Jerry Christman of Staten Island, New York; and a brother-in-law, Jim Fought of Delaware, Ohio. His wife, Judith K. Christman, preceded him in death in 1997. Friends may call from 2-4:00 p.m. Monday, January 17, 2005 at the Breitenbach-McCoy-Leffler Funeral Home. A memorial service will follow at 4:00 p.m. officiated by the Rev. Clyde Martin. A reception will follow services at Vincenzo's Restaurant, 11525 Chester Road, Sharonville, Ohio 45246. The family suggests memorial contributions to either the American Cancer Society, Shriners' Hospitals, or the American Heart Association.
Published in The Middletown Journal on 1/15/2005.

Christman, Richard Paul and Miss Linda Kay

1965

MARRIAGE

   On Saturday, August 28th, Miss ======= JA'> On Saturday, August 28th, Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Linda Kay Mann, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Orrie Mann, of Bethesda, Route one, plighted her troth to Mr. Richard Paul Christman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Christman, of Barnesville.

   Preceding the ceremony a program ======= JA'> Preceding the ceremony a program >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of nuptial music was presented by Mrs. Allen Mann, organist, sister-in-law of the bride. The selections were "Because", "I Love You Truly," and the traditional "Wedding March."

   The double ring ceremony was ======= JA'> The double ring ceremony was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 solemnized at half after three in the afternoon by Evangelist James W. Gallagher at the home of the bride's sister and brother-in-law, Mr. and Mrs. Carl VanFossen, before an improvised altar of beautiful baskets of summer flowers.

   Given in marriage by her father, ======= JA'> Given in marriage by her father, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the bride was lovely in a floor length gown of silk embroidered organza over tulle and taffeta. The fitted bodice was designed with bateau neckline and long sheer fitted sleeves. Her veil of silk illusion was held in place by a pearl and crystal crown adorned with pearlized orange blossoms. She carried a colonial bouquet of white carnations.

   Mrs. Henry Marley, of Woodsfield, ======= JA'> Mrs. Henry Marley, of Woodsfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 sister of the bride was matron of honor. She was attired in a white suit with red accessories and carried a colonial bouquet of red carnations.

   Mr. James Samples friend of the ======= JA'> Mr. James Samples friend of the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bridegroom was best man.

   For her daughter's wedding, Mrs. ======= JA'> For her daughter's wedding, Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mann wore a blue dress with white accessories and the groom's mother, Mrs. Christman, was attired in a dark blue silk dress. Both mothers wore corsages of white carnations.

   The new Mrs. Christman was ======= JA'> The new Mrs. Christman was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 graduated from Union Local High School class of 1965. Her husband is a graduate of Barnesville High School, class of 1962 and is employed as manager of Binns Food Center.

   Mr. and Mrs. Christman are ======= JA'> Mr. and Mrs. Christman are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 residing on Sandy Ridge, Barnesville Route one.

Christman, Ruth O. Seebach
     LEWISVILLE, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> LEWISVILLE, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio - Ruth O. Seebach, 80, of Lewisville died Thursday (November. 11, 2004) at Southeastern Medical Center in Cambridge.

She was a graduate of Lewisville High School and was a homemaker. She enjoyed quilting, yard sales, and her family.

Christman, Samuel
 May 27, 1863
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> May 27, 1863 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
February 16, 1923
Woodsfield
Samuel Christman
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, dated Thursday, February 22, 1923
Samuel Christman, a very highly respected citizen, died of pneumonia at his home on Maple avenue, February 16, 1923, aged 59 years, 8 months and 19 days. He was born near Woodsfield, Ohio on May 27, 1863, the son of Lewis and Mary Christman. He was united in holy bonds of matrimony September 8, 1887, with Miss Maude Montgomery, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Montgomery. To this union four children were born - - Adda, Ronald, William and Paul, who with the mother survive.
Samuel Christman, who was well known as a model citizen, was baptized by Elder W. W. Otey, formerly ofBeallsville, Ohio, Ohio, and became a member of the Church of Christ in August 1893, and lived a faithful christian life until called to the better world.
 
Besides the widow and children, four brothers and two sisters are let to mourn his loss as follows: Andrew, Lewis, Henry and William; Mrs. Barbara Diehl of Clinton, Missouri, and Mrs. Anna Ricer.
 
The funeral, conducted by his former pastor, Elder D. W. Harkins of Columbus, Ohio took place from the Woodsfield Church of Christ last Monday afternoon and was largely attended by relatives and friends. Interment in Oaklawn cemetery. The widow and other relatives have the sincere sympathy of many friends, and the community at large realizes that one of our very best citizens has passed to the great beyond.
 
Christman, Solomon Elmer
            Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services for Solomon E. Chrisman, 76, Quaker City, R. D. 3, will be held at 1:30 p.m. (EST) Wednesday from the Eberle Funeral Home here in Quaker City. The Rev. Milford Carey will officiate and burial will be in Friends Cemetery.
   Mr. Christman ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Christman >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 died Sunday (May 29, 1966) at Guernsey Memorial Hospital where he had been a patient one day.
   Born October ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Born October >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 25, 1889, in Monroe County, he was a son of John and Eva Pfalzgraf Christman. A veteran of World War I, he was a member of the Caldwell American Legion.
   A retired ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A retired >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 farmer, Mr. Christman leaves his wife, Mrs. Viola Bintz Christman; a son, Solomon, Jr., of Quaker City, R. D. 3; a daughter, Mrs. Catherine Yockey, Quaker City, R. D. 3; two grandchildren; a great-grandchild; two brothers, Samuel Christman, Bethesda, R. D., and Lewis Christman, Bucyrys, R. D.. Five brothers and two sisters are deceased. From the collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig

Christman, Susan Rosella

To Tour With Ohio Youth Choir

    Susan Rosella Christman, daughter of Clayton and Margaret Christman of Woodsfield, Rt. 3, has been chosen to tour England, Wales, Netherlands, Belgium, France and Switzerland with the Ohio Youth Choir in June.  She is a senior at Woodsfield High School.  In the school band and mixed chorus.  A 4-H member for six years and with the 4-H Choir.  A Girl Scout for ten years.  A member of St. Pauls United Church of Christ, Youth Fellowship, the Youth Choirs, and the church choir for six years.  Susan will give a beautiful quilt her grandmother made her to the lucky chance. She is also selling Avon for her trip.  Susan is the granddaughter ======= JA'> Susan Rosella Christman, daughter of Clayton and Margaret Christman of Woodsfield, Rt. 3, has been chosen to tour England, Wales, Netherlands, Belgium, France and Switzerland with the Ohio Youth Choir in June. She is a senior at Woodsfield High School. In the school band and mixed chorus. A 4-H member for six years and with the 4-H Choir. A Girl Scout for ten years. A member of St. Paul s United Church of Christ, Youth Fellowship, the Youth Choirs, and the church choir for six years. Susan will give a beautiful quilt her grandmother made her to the lucky chance. She is also selling Avon for her trip. Susan is the granddaughter >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Mrs. Edla Kimpel, the late Carl Kimpel and the late Lewis and Rose Christman.

Christman, Thurman and Wilma

August 29, 1996

The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio

Celebrate 60 Years

      Thurman and Wilma Christman will celebrate their 60th wedding anniversary Sept. 8 at St. Pauls United Church of Christ in Woodsfield.  They ======= JA'> Thurman and Wilma Christman will celebrate their 60th wedding anniversary Sept. 8 at St. Paul s United Church of Christ in Woodsfield. They >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 were married Sept. 9, 1936 at Middle Church in Lewisville.

Christman, Troy D.

Christman, Troy and c. Susan Dixon

Source: Monroe County Beacon, November 17, 1988

     C. Susan Dixon became the bride ======= JA'> C. Susan Dixon became the bride >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Mr. Troy D. Christman during an open church ceremony at 1:30 p.m. September 24 in the First Congregational Church of Marietta. Reverend Steven Sparling, Reverend Robert Patterson, and Reverend Marvin Haught officiated the double ring ceremony.

     The bride is the daughter of ======= JA'> The bride is the daughter of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Naomi Dixon (Lemon) of Parkersburg, WV and Mr. and Mrs. James B. Dixon of Ripley, WV. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Larry S. Christman of Lewisville.

     The church was decorated with ======= JA'> The church was decorated with >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 two large floral arrangements with yoshita hybrid lilies and white carnations. The arrangements were placed on large white columns. Live Boston ferns were placed around the altar arrangements and greenery and baby's breath surrounded the unity candle.

     Wedding selections from ======= JA'> Wedding selections from >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 classical Bach and Handel's "Water Music" were played by Mrs. Anita Will with solos by Tim McKelvy, Carmen Van Camp and Steve Dixon.

     The bride wore an elegant gown ======= JA'> The bride wore an elegant gown >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of satin designed with a Sabrina neckline. The bodice was heavily beaded with seed peals and full flowing satin skirt was adorned with European lace appliques, accented with stringed seed pearls. The cathedral train displayed tiers of bias-cut satin fluted ruffles and appliques. She wore an exquisite matching hat, designed by her mother, adorned by miniature seed peals and appliques. It held a walking veil and blusher.

     She carried a cascade hand ======= JA'> She carried a cascade hand >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bouquet of burgundy and white yoshits lilies, rosaria alstroemeria, white roses, and miniature carnations, leather leaf fern and baby's breath.

     Serving as matron of honor was ======= JA'> Serving as matron of honor was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lisa Long, best friend of the bride. Bridesmaids were Tracey (Christman) Haney, Tonya Christman, and Mrs. Marty Rhodes.

     Best man was Travis Christman, ======= JA'> Best man was Travis Christman, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 brother of the bridegroom and ushers were Richard Smith, Jamie Klei, and Billy Peoples.

     The ring bearer was Joey Dixon, ======= JA'> The ring bearer was Joey Dixon, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and the flower girl was Jana Bartholow, Jessica Sparling was trainbearer.

     Guests were registered by Carol ======= JA'> Guests were registered by Carol >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 (Brooks) Dixon, sister in law to the bride.

     A reception followed at the ======= JA'> A reception followed at the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 church social hall. The three tiered wedding cake was decorated with a floral cake top continuing the theme of the bride's bouquet. Matching flowers were placed around the base of the cake and in between the layers.

     The bride is a graduate of ======= JA'> The bride is a graduate of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Glenville State College and is employed by the First Congregational Church as Director of Christian Education.

     The bridegroom is a graduate of ======= JA'> The bridegroom is a graduate of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Cincinnati College of Mortuary Science and is a licensed funeral director and embalmer as an associate of Cawley and Peoples Funeral Homes.

     After an extended wedding trip ======= JA'> After an extended wedding trip >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to Colonial Williamsburg, VA, the couple will reside in Marietta.

   She was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 November 11, 1891 in Monroe County, daughter of the late George and anna Ackerman Bintz. She was preceded in death by her husband, Solomon E. Chrisman, whom she married March 23, 1923.

Christman, William Thomas
Born: 21 Dec 1872, died: January 29, 1939, residence: Woodsfield
Source:Monore County death records
 
Christman, William T.
Source:The Monroe County Beacon Woodsfield, Ohio, February 1952
            William T. Christman was born in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> William T. Christman was born in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Seneca township, Monroe County, Ohio, on January 24, 1871, the son of Godfrey and Catherine Bauman Christman. He passed away at the Barnesville Hospital on Friday, February 22, 1952, at the age of eighty-one years and 29 days old.
            He was baptized and confirmed in St. Johns Evangelical Church, near Lewisville, Ohio. In the year of 1892 on ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was baptized and confirmed in St. John s Evangelical Church, near Lewisville, Ohio. In the year of 1892 on >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 September 4, he was united in marriage with Emma Bauersock. To this union were born two daughters and one son. One daughter survives from this first marriage, Mrs. Chester Dabbs, of Newport News, Virginia.
            After of his first wife he was married ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> After of his first wife he was married >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 again, this time to Anna Palmer and to this marriage one daughter was born. With his second wife and daughter he has lived on his farm on Egger Ridge, north of Lewisville.
            One daughter and one son preceded him ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> One daughter and one son preceded him >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in . Also preceding him in were four brothers and three sisters. He has two brothers still living, Fred Christman, of Lewisville, Route 1, and Charles Christman, of Lewisville, Route 1.
            During the last year when Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> During the last year when Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christman was unable to go to town for supplies his neighbors and friends helped him out considerably, especially did he depend upon the faithful assistance of Mr. and Mrs. Floyd Weber, his closest neighbor.
            All of those who knew Mr. Christman ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> All of those who knew Mr. Christman >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and visited him remember his patience and faith in all of his conversation. Although he was unable to be an active member of the Church during these past years, he remained a faithful Christian thru his personal devotions and the inspiration from the Bible and radio worship services. This past fall he wrote a request in a strong hand, influenced some by the German script. The request was for the sacrament of communion. After participation in Communion with his wife, he again received the strength of the love and communion with his Master Christ. May God bless all of those who remain faithful unto .
            The family and relatives wish to ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The family and relatives wish to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 express their sincere appreciation and thanks for all of the kindness and expressions of neighborliness that have been shown toward Mr. William Christman and his family.
 
Zelda Christman
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, August 1990
  Zelda ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Zelda >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christman, 82, of 206 Fourth Street, Woodsfield, Ohio died August 1, 1990, at Guernsey Memorial Hospital, Cambridge. She was born July 20, 1908, at Rinard Mills, a daughter of the late Lydia Jane Gardner.
  She was a member of St. Pauls United Church of Christ, Woodsfield.
  She was preceded in by two sisters and one brother.
  Surviving are ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was a member of St. Paul s United Church of Christ, Woodsfield.
She was preceded in by two sisters and one brother.
Surviving are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 one son, of Woodsfield; one granddaughter, Kathy Dimmerling, of Woodsfield and one great-grandson, Bret Dimmerling of Woodsfield; several nieces and nephews.
  Friends were ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends were >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 received at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home where services were held August 4 at 1 p.m. with Reverend Dennis Bewley officiating. Burial in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.

Christman, Miss Zilva
               Zilva ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Zilva >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 C. Christman, was born February 8, 1902, and died March 30, 1905, being 3 years, 1 month, and 21 days old.
               The ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 subject of this sketch was the only daughter of William G. and Emma C. BauerSOCK Christman of near Monroefield. All that medical aid and loving hands could do would not save her life, yet, God in his wisdom doeth all things well. This illustrates to us the uncertainty of life and the necessary of early preparation for eternity. She leaves a father and mother and a large circle of relatives and friends. A large concourse followed her to her last resting place <<<<<<< HEAD in the St. Johns Middle Church cemetery, near Lewisville, Ohio, Sunday morning. The funeral services were conducted by the Reverend F. A. MEUSCH of Miltonsburg.                                          -R. C.  
Source:    The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, ======= in the St. John s Middle Church cemetery, near Lewisville, Ohio, Sunday morning. The funeral services were conducted by the Reverend F. A. MEUSCH of Miltonsburg. -R. C.

Christy, Miss Jessie and Mr. Austin Sloan

Christy, Chancy Leo
     Chancy L. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Chancy L. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christy, 91, Richwood, died March 16, 2004, at Heartland of Marysville following a brief illness. He was born December 27, 1912, in Graysville, son of the late Robert McClennan "Mac" and Isadore Arbell Byers Christy.
 
     He was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 retired from the Urbana Mills after 25 years as a salesman, before that he worked with the Christy Brothers Produce in Woodsfield for 14 years. Following retirement Chancy was manager for the Richwood Community apartments for 10 years.
 
     He was a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 dedicated member of the Richwood First United Methodist church, where he served on various boards and committees through the years and as custodian for many years. He served on the board for the Memorial Hospital in Marysville for 18 years and received his 2000 hour volunteer pin through the hospital. Many of those hours were spent volunteering at the Richwood Civic Center, where he was a member. He also enjoyed coon hunting and deer hunting.
 
     Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are his wife, whom he maried Sept 2, 1939, Elifrede Harman Christy; two sons, Rev. James R. (Sandra) Christy, of Piqua, and Terry K. (Joyce) Christy, of covington; four grandchildren, Laina Makar, Jason "Andy: Christy, Jill R. Arent and Keith M. Christy; tow great-grandchildren.
 
     In addition ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In addition >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to his parents, he was preceded in by four brothers; three sisters.
 
     Friends ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 were received March 18 at Stofcheck Funeral Home, Richwood. Services were held March 19 at the First United Methodist Church, with Rev. Joseph Rhea officiating. Burial was in Claibourne Cemetery. Memorial contributions may be made to the First United Methodist Church, 18 S. Fulton St., Richwood, Ohio 43344.

Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio October 1991
  Freda E. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Freda E. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christy, 92, of 107 East Church Street, Woodsfield, Ohio died at 10:45 p.m. October 6, 1991, in the Barnesville Hospital, Barnesville, Ohio.
  She was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 near Graysville, Ohio on January 19, 1899, a daughter of the late Forrest and Nettie Whitacre Mobberly.
  She was a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 member of the Church of Christ and a devoted wife, mother and grandmother and had assisted her husband in may activities throughout the years.
  She is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by four daughters, Mrs. Fred (Ethel) Dougherty of Woodsfield, Mrs. Emerson (Marjorie) Scott of Willcox, Arizona, Mrs. Glenn (Donna) Baker of New Albany, and Mrs. Cyril (Shirley) Weagle of Chico, California; two sons, Robert R. Christy of Dayton and Tommy Lee Christy of Lewisville; one sister Mrs. Mabel Earley of Wheeling, West Virginia; 12
grandchildren and 17 great-grandchildren.

  Friends were ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was preceded in by her husband Thomas A. Christy on June 13, 1979.

Burial followed in Pleasant Ridge Cemetery, Route 1, Graysville.
