Marriage of Mr. Roscoe Wilhelm and Miss Virginia Claus
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, dated, June 1949
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
On Saturday evening, June 18, 1949 Reverend Elmer A. Gradwohl read the single ring ceremony at St. Paul's Evangelical and Reformed Church in Woodsfield which united in marriage Miss Virginia Claus, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gilbert Claus of Route 1, Lewisville, Ohio and Mr. Roscoe Wilhelm, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Wilhelm of route 2, Lewisville.
For her wedding, the bride wore a street length dress of pink with White accessories.
The only attendants at the wedding were the bride's parents and sister, Miss Vivian Claus, and Mrs. Gradwohl.
Mr. and Mrs. Wilhelm are residing at the home of the groom's parents on Lewisville, Route 2.
The following day, Sunday, June 19th, a wedding dinner was served at the home of the bride's grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. George L. Christman, on route 1, Lewisville.
This was a double celebration, it also being the forty-ninth wedding anniversary of Mr. and Mrs. Christman. Mrs. Christman is the former Miss Lena Matz. They have always resided in this community.
Guests were: Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Christman, Mr. and Mrs. Carl Buss of Apple Creek; Mr. and Mrs. Gilbert Claus, children, Alvin and Vivian; Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Kahrig, children, Marion, Lena, Lewis and Marlene; Miss Elma Christman; Mr. and Mrs. George Kahrig and children, Wayne, Letha, Viola, Lillian, Meredith, Wilford and Edilene; Mr. and Mrs. Wilbert Claus, son Roger, and the honored guests, Mr. and Mrs. George L. Christman and Mr. and Mrs. Roscoe Wilhelm. Two of the Christman sons were unable to be present.
 
 Marriage of Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Marriage of Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Melvin B. Christman and Miss Margaret I. Blowers
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, dated, March 1952
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
Tuesday evening, March fourth, 1952 at six o'clock at his home of Eastern Avenue, Woodsfield, Minister J. V. A. Traylor read the formal double ring ceremony which united in marriage Miss Margaret I. Blowers and Melvin B. Christman.
Miss Blowers is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Manford Blowers, of Barnesville, Ohio, and Mr. Christman is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Elmer G. Christman, of Apple Creek, Ohio.
The bride wore a Brown suit with beige accessories, and her corsage was of pink cArnations.
The groom who entered the United States Armed Forces in September 1950, recently returned from Korea where he had served ten months.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Bonnie Arlene Gatten and Franklin Delano McCaslin marriage
 
McCaslin--Gatten Wedding Solemnized  Christmas
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Christmas >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, dated, Thursday, January 1, 1953
    On Christmas ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On Christmas >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 morning at ten o'clock at his home on Eastern Ave.
Minister J. V. A. Traylor read the single ring ceremony which united in marriage Miss Bonnie Arlene Gatten, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Floyd D. Gatten, of Woodsfield, Route 2, and Franklin Delano McCaslin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edison W. McCaslin, of Woodsfield, Route 4, Ohio.
   The bride ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The bride >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 wore a suit of blue and gray with navy blue accessories and a corsage of yellow Rosebuds.
   A wedding ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A wedding >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 dinner was served at noon at the home of the groom's parents, and in the evening a wedding supper was served at the home of the bride's parents.
   The newlyweds ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The newlyweds >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will make their home in Rittman where Mr. McCaslin has employment.
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Wedding Announcement
 
Shirley Ann Wise and Homer Rex Leach
 
Source:The Monroe County Beacon; 19 November 1953
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
     On Monday ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On Monday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 afternoon, November sixteenth, at two o'clock at this home on Eastern Ave, Minister J.V.A. Traylor read the single ring ceremony which united in marriage Miss Shirley Ann Wise, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John S. Wise of Summerfield Route 2 and Homer Rex Leach, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arch Leach of Quaker City, Route 4.
 
     The bride ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The bride >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 wore a navy blue dress with black accessories.
 
     Miss Lavina ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Lavina >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Wise, of Summerfield, sister of the bride, was bridesmaid. She wore a blue dress with red accessories.
 
     Harold ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Harold >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Carpenter, Summerfield served Mr. Leach as best man.
 
Harold William Ensign - Irma Jean Highman  marriage
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Harold William Ensign - Irma Jean Highman marriage >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, dated, Thursday, August 24, 1950
 
In a double ring ceremony performed on Saturday afternoon, June seventeenth, at one o'clock, Miss Irma Jean Highman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Allen Highman, of Litchfield, Ohio, became the bride of Mr. Harold William Ensign, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clyde Ensign, of Spencer, Ohio, in a lovely lawn wedding at the home of the bride, with Rev. Walter T. Hinzmann officiating.
 
Preceding the ceremony, Miss Wilma Stocker sang "Because" and "I Love You Truly." She was accompanied by Miss Glenna Ayrock.
 
Given in marriage by her father, the bride was attired in a princess style gown of White slipper satin. The high, round neckline yolk was of Chantilly lace with a bertha collar effect. Slipper satin, like that of the collar, formed a Juliet cap to which her fingertip veil of Chantilly lace was attached. She carried a bouquet of White Shasta daisies and mock orange blossoms with a White cArnation corsage in the center. She carried out the tradition of "something old, something new, something borrowed and something blue."
 
Miss Betty Foraker, cousin of the bride, was maid of honor. Her short sleeved gown was of yellow marquisette and featured the bertha collar. Bridesmaids were Miss Jo Ann Highman, sister of the bride, and Miss Ruth Curtiss, cousin of the bride. They wore short sleeved gowns of blue satin with overskirts of blue net. They carried blue and yellow Shasta daisies.
 
Mr. Charles Ensign served his brother as best man. Both he and the groom were dressed in light blue suits and wore a White cArnation in their lapel.
 
The bride's mother wore a gray bemberg dress with blue accessories and a pink cArnation corsage. The mother of the groom wore a powder blue dress with White accessories and a yellow cArnation corsage.
 
Immediately following the ceremony a reception was held at the home of the bride, with one hundred guests attending.
 
After the reception the newlyweds left on a short wedding trip. For traveling the bride chose a blue nylon dress with blue accessories and a White cArnation corsage.
 
The newlyweds are now residing in Litchfield.
 
Out-of-town guests were present from Pittsburg, Pa.; Woodsfield, Canton, Columbus, Sycamore Valley, Rinard Mills, Massillion, Chatham, Spencer and Lodi.
 
 Cline, Linda ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Cline, Linda >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lea and James Thomas Novak
Source--The Monroe County Beacon
Published--August 12, 1972
 
    St. Paul's ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>
St. Paul's >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 United Church of Christ, Woodsfield, was the setting Saturday, August twelfth, at half after two o'clock in the afternoon, for the marriage of Miss Linda Lea Cline, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frederic Cline, 226 Eastern Avenue, Woodsfield, and Mr. James Thomas Novak, son of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley R. Novak, 23416 Royalton Road, Columbia Station, Ohio. The Rev. Charles Price officiated at the double ring, open church ceremony. Mrs. Nile Kamp provided the nuptial music.
    Given in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Given in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 marriage by her father, the bride appeared in a Suzanne original gown of pure
silk organza and Venice lace with molded bodice and bishop sleeves. The neckline and wide waistline were banded with embroidered organza. The full gored skirt was floor-length and was sprinkled with Venice lace appliques, cascading into a full sweep. Her imported pure silk illusion cathedral veil was held in place with a Venice lace cloche. She carried a cascade bouquet of yellow and white daisy pomps, sprinkled with baby's breath, and ending in long yellow streamers.
    Maid of honor was Miss Kathy Elekes, of Zanesville, friend of the bride, and bridesmaid was Miss Valerie Touvelle, of Columbus, cousin of the bride.   James Wycoff, of Athens, served Mr. Novak as ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Maid of honor was Miss Kathy Elekes, of Zanesville, friend of the bride, and bridesmaid was Miss Valerie Touvelle, of Columbus, cousin of the bride. James Wycoff, of Athens, served Mr. Novak as >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 best man. Usher was Mr. Mark Novak, of Columbia Station, brother of the bridegroom. Ring bearer for her sister was Stacy Cline.
    The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bridesmaids appeared in identical gowns of mimosa French voille, featuring a high rise waistline, and molded bodice with wide V ruffle in front and back.The high neckline with ruffle and bodice and long sleeves were banded in mimosa and white daisy braid, ending in a tailored bow with streamers at the back. Their skirts were A-line featuring fullness at the back and worn in a sweep. They carried cascade bouquets of white and yellow daisy pomps and white streamers.
    A reception followed at The Switzerland of Ohio Country Club.
    Mrs. Novak, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A reception followed at The Switzerland of Ohio Country Club.
Mrs. Novak, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a Woodsfield High School graduate, received her Bachelor of Science Degree in Education from Ohio University. She is a mamber of Phi Mu social sorority.
    Her husband, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Her husband, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a graduate of Columbia High School and Ohio University with a Bachelor of Science degree in Education, is a member of Phi Kappa Sigma social fraternity. He is serving with The United States Army at Fort Meade, Maryland.
    The couple will reside at  8813 Hawthorne Court,  Apt. 101,  Briarwood Apts.,  Laurel, Maryland, after a wedding trip to Seven Springs, Pennsylvania.

Cline, Millie
November 16, 1919
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Cline, Minerva
Died: January 3, 1929
 
Claus, Myra jean and Mr. Byron L. Morris and Miss Myra Jean Claus
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, dated, July 15, 1967
Collection of Mary Eva Betts Christman
Miss Myra Jean Claus, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Claus, of Jerusalem, Ohio and Mr. Byron L. Morris, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ermie Morris of Woodsfield, Route 3, were united in marriage on Saturday evening, July fifteenth, 1967. The vows were exchanged at 6:15 p.m. at the home of Minister J. V. A. Traylor who performed the double ring ceremony. Attending the wedding were the couple's parents and the bride's grandmother, Mrs. Laura Claus; also, Mrs. David Lallathin, of Akron, Ohio, sister of the bridegroom, and Mrs. Robert Morris, of Barnesville, Ohio.
 
Mrs. Floyd Crawford, sister of the bride, was matron of honor.
 
Mr. Robert Morris, of Barnesville, served his brother as best man.
 
Following the ceremony a reception was held at theBeallsville, OhioHigh school, with over one hundred friends and relatives attending. Serving as hostesses were the bride's sisters, Mrs. Floyd Crawford and Miss Darlene Claus; and Miss Evelyn Kress, Mrs. Clara Schumacher and Miss Sharon Decker.
 
The bride is a graduate ofBeallsville, OhioHigh School,Beallsville, Ohio, Ohio and the School of Cosmetology at Cambridge, Ohio. She is employed at Akron, Ohio.
 
Mr. Morris is a graduate of Skyvue High school and is employed by the Pepsi Cola Company in Akron. He served two years in the U. S. Army, one year being spent in Korea.
 
Mr. and Mrs. Morris are making their home at 407 East Archwood, Akron, Ohio.

Cline, Robert Woodrow Cline
Source: Monroe County Beacon dated September 28, 2000
   Robert ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Robert >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Woodrow Cline, 83, of 38126 Wolf Pen Rd., Woodsfield, died September 22, 2000, in the Monroe County Care Center, Woodsfield. He was born near Woodsfield, December 12, 1916, a son of the late Alonzo E and Arrena E. Highman Cline.
   He was a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 retired farmer and a member of the Conner Ridge United Methodist Church, near Woodsfield. He was a U.S. Army veteran serving during WWII where he received two bronze Stars, a purple heart, and was a prisoner of war. He was also a life member of the Veterans of Foreign Wars, Post 5303, Woodsfield.
Surviving are his wife, Jean E. Turner Cline, whom he married June 10, 1940; four sisters, Mrs. Herb (Grethel) Shafer, Ashland, Wilma Babcock, Frazeysburg, Jean Ambrus, Newark, Mrs. Roy (Dorothy) Fink, Newark; two brothers, Kenneth D. Cline and his wife Rosalie, Woodsfield, Hilton "Pete" Cline and his wife, Evelyn, Polk; several nieces and nephews.
   In addition ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In addition >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to his parents, he was preceded in by three brothers, Herbert, Denzil and Eddie Cline.
Friends were received at the Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, September 24, where funeral services were held September 25, with Harold B. Kinney, Fr. officiating. Burial followed in the Oakland Cemetery, Woodsfield, with full military graveside services conducted by the Belmont Veterans Council.

Cline, Sarah L. Cline
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
March 21, 1926
 
Source: The Marietta Times, Saturday, July 19, 2003X
Reischman-Cline
 
Carisa Renee Reischman and Shannon Kirk Cline were united in marriage at 3:30 p.m. May 17, 2003, at First Congregational Church in Marietta. The Rev. Linda Steelman officiated for the double ring ceremony.
 
 
The bride is the daughter of Gary and MayAnne Williams of Marietta. She is the granddaughter of Luella Crum of Sarahsville, Ohio.
The bridegroom is the son of Jim and Linda Cline of Marietta.
 
The bride wore a formal sheath style gown of white satin that featured an off-the-shoulder neckline, long tapered sleeves that came to a point on her hands and a cathedral length train. Her dress and train were trimmed with <<<<<<< HEAD Alencon lace appliquÎs beaded with seed pearls and diamond sequins. Her ======= Alencon lace appliqu s beaded with seed pearls and diamond sequins. Her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 headpiece was a pearl and diamond tiara with a fingertip length veil of illusion. The bride carried a French style bouquet of large burgundy roses with pearl spray accents wrapped with burgundy ribbon with gold accent made by the bride.
 
Matron of honor was Carmen Carter of Belpre, the bride's sister. Bridesmaid was Jackie Bradford of Marietta. They wore burgundy floor length sheath style dresses of angel skin satin and carried French style bouquets of large burgundy roses with pearl spray accents wrapped with burgundy ribbon with gold accent made by the bride.
 
Flower girls were Ashley Carter and Paige Williams, the bride's nieces. They wore matching knee length dresses of white lace over white satin with a burgundy rose at the waistline. Their headpieces were rings of burgundy rose ribbon with streamers that were made by the bride. Ashley Carter carried a small white basket filled with silk burgundy rose petals and trimmed with white satin ribbon bows. After the ceremony, the flower girls rang the south tower bell in the church.
 
Best man was Ben Cline of Marietta, the bridegroom's brother. Groomsman was Randy Hart of Marietta.
 
Ringbearer was Benjamin Cline, the bridegroom's nephew.
 
Guests were greeted and registered by Sarah Parsons.
 
A buffet dinner and reception followed at the Marietta Country Club. Reception decorations included burgundy candlelight flower arrangements made by the bride. Music was provided by The Country Choice Band.
 
The bride is a graduate of Ohio University and is employed by Washington/Morgan Counties Community Action as a youth employment and training specialist.
 
The bridegroom is a graduate of Marietta High School and is employed by Glacier Water Service as a service technician. He is also co-owner of Red Door Antiques.
 
After a honeymoon trip to Salt Fork State Park, the couple are residing in Reno.
                
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'>   >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Cline, Shelda Hill                                                                                                       Source--Marietta Times     Marietta, Ohio                                                                              Published--September ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Source--Marietta Times Marietta, Ohio Published--September >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 19, 2004
 
REYNOLDSBURG, Ohio - We celebrate the passing of our beloved mother, grandmother and aunt, Shelda Hill Cline. Shelda made her way back home to be with her Lord and Savior on Wednesday ,September, 15, 2004. She was born August. 27, 1913, in New Matamoras, Ohio, one of five children of Herman and Nettie Kochert Hill. She was predeceased by her parents; her husband, Howard L. Cline; her brothers, Wayne Hill and James "Bill" Hill; her daughter, Marsha Jean Cline; and her sister, Dorothy Parker. Shelda attended Marietta College and spent most of her life in New Matamoras and Marietta before moving to Venice, Florida, in 1985. Shelda has lived in Reynoldsburg, Ohio, since 1992 with her daughter, Carmel (Dennis) Jenkins. She leaves behind a devoted grandson, Jay Jenkins, and his fiance, Chessa; her sister, Opal Yonally; and several nieces and nephews. Graveside services will be held on Sunday September 19 in New Matamoras. Her arrangements are being cared for by the Cotner Funeral Home in Reynoldsburg.

Cline, Vivian C. Cline
LEWISVILLE, Ohio - Vivian C. Cline, 94, of Lewisville died Monday (Jan. 3, 2005).
Calling hours are 6 to 9 p.m. Thursday (Jan. 6) at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, Ohio. Services will be at 11 a.m. Friday (Jan. 7) at Buchanan Presbyterian Church in Lewisville.
Source: Marietta Times, Tuesday, January 4, 2005.
 
Cline, Wilbur Chester
From The Daily Jefferson 11/14/2001 - Obit
            BETHESDA  Wilbur Chester Cline, 85, of Bethesda, died Monday (Nov. 12, 2001) at Barnesville Health Care Center.                        
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> BETHESDA Wilbur Chester Cline, 85, of Bethesda, died Monday (Nov. 12, 2001) at Barnesville Health Care Center.
He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born Sept. 16, 1916, in Monroe County, son of the late Leonard and Daisy (Payne) Cline. Mr. Cline was a retired farmer and meat cutter. He was a member of the Church of Christ. He was a life member of Bethesda American Legion Post 90 and Bethesda VFW Post 9712. He was a U.S. Army veteran, having served in World War II.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by a brother, Francis Cline; and a grandson, Eric Cline. He leaves his wife of 57 years, Dorothy (McCrea) Cline; a son, Leonard M. (Carol) Cline of West Liberty; four daughters, Mrs. Ted (Barbara) Cragulets of Mentor, Mrs. James (Michele) Hatcher of Winterset, Mrs. Toby (Susan) McFarland of Bethesda and Tamara Jeffries of Shadyside; nine grandchildren, Leonard M. Cline Jr., Chasity Stahler, Sarah Gromek, Doug Cragulets, Traci and Stephani Hatcher, Jeff and Aaron McFarland and Jami Jeffries; three great-grandchildren; two brothers, Floyd Cline of Sardis and Gayle Cline of Malvern.
            Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at Kelly-Kemp-Braido Funeral Home, Bethesda, where services will be 11 a.m. Thursday.                      Burial will be in Ebenezer Cemetery, Bethesda. Military graveside services will be conducted by Belmont County Council VFW. Memorial contributions may be made to Hospice of Guernsey Inc., P.O. Box 1165, 9711 East Pike, Cambridge, OH 43725, or the Alzheimers Association.

Cline, Mrs. William F.
Mrs. Cline Dies at Mingo Junction
Source:Spirit of Democracy, dated  September 9, 1943
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> September 9, 1943 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Provided by Lena Kahrig Pettit, typed by Betty Lendon Matson
     Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 William F. Cline, aged 88 years, died at the home of her daughter, Mrs. Emery Edwards at Mingo Junction, on Saturday morning, September 4. The body was brought to her late home at Low Gap and remained there until Tuesday afternoon when funeral services were held at The Christian Union Church. Burial was made in the church cemetery in charge of Galbraith Funeral Home of Woodsfield.
     Mrs. Cline ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Cline >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is survived by four daughters, Mrs. Edwards in whose home she died, Mrs. James Gray of Woodsfield, Mrs. Barnett Williamson of Okmulgee, Okla., and Mrs. Everett Smith of Rinard Mills, and two sons, Luther Cline of Plainview and John Cline of Low Gap. Her husband died seven years ago.

Clutter, Elizabeth Clutter
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
July 1, 1913
 
 MARRIAGE of Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> MARRIAGE of Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Samuel Christman and Miss Maude Montgomery
Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, dated, Tues., September 13, 1887
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
 
Christman - Montgomery: On the morning of the 8th. the residence of Mr. & Mrs. William Montgomery, near Mt. Carrick, was filled with guests to witness the wedding of their daughter, Miss Maude Montgomery, to <<<<<<< HEAD Mr. Samuel Christman. J. N. Agin acted as grooms best man, and Miss Annie Christman as brides maid. The ceremony was performed by the Reverend Henry ======= Mr. Samuel Christman. J. N. Agin acted as groom s best man, and Miss Annie Christman as bride s maid. The ceremony was performed by the Reverend Henry >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lyons, of Antioch.
 
After the ceremony was performed, the bride and groom, followed by the guests, were led to the dining room where the table was laden with every conceivable good thing the appetite might crave. After dinner everybody gathered to the parlor, where some time was spent in social chat, interspersed with vocal music, and a short speech from Honorable H. Lyons.
 
The following is a list of the presents: Mr. and Mrs. David Blatter, bedspread; Hannah S. Griffith, pan of towels; Mrs. Rosa A. Agin, honey dish; Lewis Griffith, fruit dish; Mrs. Rebecca A. Hughs, berry dish; Miss Annie Schneider, pair of vases; Mr. Mahlen Griffith, fruit dish; Mr. George Kindelberger, jelly glass and sugar bowl; Mr. Willie Christman, cake stand; Mr. and Mrs. Fritz Schneider, fruit dish; pitcher, two bread plates and honey dish; Mr. Charley Norris, molasses cruet; Mrs. N. A. Neuhart, 50 cents; Mr. William and Nancy Tracey, $1.50; Miss Katie Fleahman, 25 cents; Mr. Henry Christman, spoon holder and pitcher; Miss Annie Christman, cream pitcher and pair of towels; Mr. Isaac Price, spoon holder, Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Weisend, preserve dish and chair tidy; Mr. John M. Griffith, fruit dish; Mr. William Seamon and Miss Emma Brachtbeller, parlor lamp; Mr. Lewis Christman, pitcher; Mr. Edward Hughs, pitcher and fruit dish; Mr. Lorenzo Truex, towel; Mr. William H. Craig, butter dish; Mr.
Fred Kindleberger, cream pitcher; Mrs. A. J. Griffith, berry bowl; Miss Polly Huber, pair of towels; Miss Hulda Bennet, towel; Miss Annie Kindleberger, pair of towels; Mr. and Mrs. E. S. Taylor, bedspread; Mr. William Montgomery, wash stand; Mr. Jacob Schneider, gold dollar; Mr. J. N. and W. A. Agin, half dozen cabinet photographs of bride and groom.
 
The bride and groom extend their thanks to the many guests, and they in return, wish the young couple a pleasant and prosperous <<<<<<< HEAD journey through life.     A Guest
======= journey through life. A Guest >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
MARRIAGE of William T. Christman and Minnie Smith

William T. Christman, was 26 years of age on December 21, 1898; birthplace, Center Township, Monroe County, Ohio; occupation, bookkeeper; father, L. B. Christman; mother, Polly Schell; spouse, Minnie Smith, was age 18 on June 26, 1899; birthplace, Woodsfield, Ohio; occupation, housekeeper; father, John Smith; mother, Mary Early; license issued, March 28, 1899; married on March 28, 1899, by F. Coffey, William

October 18, 1984

The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio

William Coffey

     William Coffey, 91, of Route 1, Jerusalem, died at 5 a.m. Oct. 11 at the home of his nephew Joe Coffey.  He was ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> William Coffey, 91, of Route 1, Jerusalem, died at 5 a.m. Oct. 11 at the home of his nephew Joe Coffey. He was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 born in Monroe County Jan. 22, 1893, a son of the late William and Eva Huth Coffey.

     ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mr. Coffey was a retired oilfield worker and was a member of St. Sylvester Catholic Church in Woodsfield.

     Surviving are two nephews: Joe Coffey and Fred Coffey, both of Route 1, Jerusalem.  Also surviving are several great-nephews and great-nieces.  He was ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are two nephews: Joe Coffey and Fred Coffey, both of Route 1, Jerusalem. Also surviving are several great-nephews and great-nieces. He was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 preceded in death by two brothers and two sisters; Henry Coffey, Frank Coffey, Maggie Coffey, Lena Coffey.

     ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Friends were received at the Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Mass of Christian Burial at 10 a.m. Saturday in St. Sylvester Catholic Church with Father Vincent Huber officiating. Burial was in the St. Sylvester Catholic Church Cemetery. Rosary devotions were recited at 7 p.m. Friday in the Watters Funeral Home.

  Mr. and Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. and Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mitchell Colvin, of Woodsfield, Route 1, are announcing the engagement and approaching marriage of their daughter, Joyce Ann, to David William Landefeld, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lester Landefeld, of Woodsfield, Route 3.

  An August wedding is being planned.

Published--Thursday, October 21, 2004
            Raymond ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Raymond >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Conger,74, Woodsfield, died October 15, 2004 at Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center. He was born in Woodsfield, November 13 1929, a son of the late Simon W. (Bill) and Nellie B. Lowe Conger.
   He was a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 retired employee of Ormet Corporation, Hannibal, and a member of The Church of the Nazarene, Woodsfield.

Denzil Conger, Canton; two sisters, Betty Dodd, Massillon, Rosemary Jones, Barnesville; 18 grandchildren; several great-grandchildren.

Conley, Dorman Sherman
            Dorman Sherman Conley, 73, custodian of St. Johns Methodist Church, New Martinsville, died Friday afternoon, October 10th, at 2:30 oclock at his home, 734 Maple ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Dorman Sherman Conley, 73, custodian of St. John s Methodist Church, New Martinsville, died Friday afternoon, October 10th, at 2:30 o clock at his home, 734 Maple >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Vanue, New Martinsville. He was born May 6, 1879 in Monroe County, son of the late Jesse and Sarah Mathess Conley and attended the Church of God. Surviving are his wife, Ida Hoskinson Conley, three daughters, Opal Watkins, Mrs. Velma Pittman and Mrs. Virginia Workman, all of New Martinsville, a son, James A. Conley with the Army in Korea, three brothers, George Conley of Fly, Elmer Conley of Shadyside, and Mason Conley of Sardis, and three grandchildren. <<<<<<< HEAD Funeral services were held Tuesday afternoon at two oclock in the ======= Funeral services were held Tuesday afternoon at two o clock in the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Wharton-Ellis funeral home, New Martinsville. The Rev. May Mefford, of the Church of God, officiated. Interment was in Greenwood Cemetery. (1952)
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
George Harvey Conley, 85, of Fly, died at 2:20 a.m., Monday, January 9, at his home. He was the son of the late Jesse and Sarah Mathias Conley and was born in Monroe County on July 8, 1875, and was a farmer. His wife, the former Mary Stewart, died on January 19, 1952. Surviving are one son, Daniel Conley, Seville, two daughters, Mrs. Januaryie Ritchie and Lucille Ritchie, both of Fly, two brothers :Mason Conley, Sardis, and Elmer Conley of Shadyside, 13 grandchildren and 14 great-grandchildren. The body was removed from the Corum funeral home to the home of his daughter, Mrs. Lucille Ritchie. Funeral services were held at 2 p.m. Wednesday at the Mt. Olive United Brethren Church with the Rev. Clarence Hubbard and Cecil Beaver officiating. Burial was in the Mt. Olive Cemetery. [Calculated year of = 1960]

Conley, Mae Waters
Source--News Register      Wheeling, West Virginia
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Wheeling, West Virginia >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--August 23, 2001
            Mae Waters Conley, 75, of Reader, West Virginia., died Monday, August 20, 2001, in Allegheny General Hospital, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. She was a Protestant by faith. She was a former employee of Bissels Turkey Farm, Murraysville, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mae Waters Conley, 75, of Reader, West Virginia., died Monday, August 20, 2001, in Allegheny General Hospital, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. She was a Protestant by faith. She was a former employee of Bissel s Turkey Farm, Murraysville, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Pennsylvania. She was a member of the Veterans of Foreign Wars in Duffy, Ohio, a member of American Legion Auxiliary Post 81 of Pine Grove for 48 years, and was president of the Tuesday Afternoon Bowlers League in New Martinsville for 29 years. She was preceded in death by her parents, Frank and Clara Swauger Yeager; a brother, Earl Yeager; two sisters, Dorothy Yeager and Betty Wilson. Surviving are her husband, Harry A. Conley; a son, Jack Waters of Paden City; two brothers, Robert Yeager of Pine Grove and Howard Yeager of Export, Pennsylvania; a sister, Loma Lloyd of Reader; a granddaughter, Tammy Hudson of Indianapolis, Indiana; several nieces and nephews. Friends will be received 2-9 p.m. Wednesday at the Palmer Funeral Home, Pine Grove, where services will be held at 11 a.m. Thursday. Interment in Garrett Cemetery, near Reader, West Virginia. [Wheeling News-Register, Wheeling, West Virginia, 23 August 2001]

Conley, Mary L. Conley
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
August 28, 1917
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Mary Matilda Conley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Stewart, was born June 2, 1886 and passed away at her home at Fly, Ohio, January 19, 1952, at the age of 85 years, 7 months and 17 days. She was united in Marriage to George Conley December 15, 1900. To this union were born seven children, three girls and four boys. Two sons and one daughter preceded her in . Surviving are her husband George, two daughters, Mrs. Lucille Ritchie and Mrs. Januaryie Ritchie of Fly, Ohio, two sons, Daniel (Bob) Conley of Seville, Ohio, and Odell Conley of New Matamoras, Route ;1. She also leaves 31 grandchildren, two great-grandchildren, two sisters, Mrs. Ella Peterson of Wheeling, West Virginia, and Mrs. Ella Nelson of St. Clairsville, Ohio, three brothers, Clem and Charles Stewart of Sardis and Daniel Stewart of Clarington, Ohio. And a host of other relatives and friends.
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
She was united with Mt. Olive United Brethren Church in 1899 and was a faithful member until . She will be sadly missed in the home where she was always found striving with a loving smile and a kind word, building a happy home for her husband and children. She passed sweetly away to her eternal reWard. All through her affliction, she was found praising God in the highest and looking for His coming when merciful would relieve her suffering, where there is a mansion for her and all those who love His coming.
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Jesus has taken a beautiful bud out of our garden of love,
 
Borne it away to the City of God, home of the angels above.
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Brief funeral services were held January 24 at 12:30 p.m. at the home of her daughter, Mrs. Januaryie Ritchie, followed by services at the Mt. Olive United Brethren Church at 2:00. Rev. Clarence Hubbard officiated, assisted by Rev. Gerald R. Brown of Fly and Rev. Douda of New Matamoras. Interment was made in the church cemetery by the Corum Funeral Home, New Matamoras.

Ruth >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 K. Ault, 79, 501 Woodland Court, Woodsfield, died Sunday, January 18, 1998 at her home. She was born near Laings, May 18, 1918, a daughter of the late Con and Bessie Saffle Conley.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a retired housekeeper and a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ of Woodsfield.
            In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by a son, Ronald Lemoine Dink Ault; two brothers, Manford and Harold Conley.
            Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by a son, Ronald Lemoine Dink Ault; two brothers, Manford and Harold Conley.
Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are four daughters, Janet Haslam, of Clarington, Shirley Pealer of Woodsfield, Judy K. Blackstone of Lewisville and Charlotte Ann Ault of St. Clairsville; a son, Rick Smith of Woodsfield; 12 grandchildren; several great grandchildren.
            Friends ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will be received at the Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, 7 to 9 p.m. today, where services will be held at 2 p.m. Wednesday, with Pastor Fred Ricer, Jr. officiating. Burial follows in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, January 1998.
Provided by Wilda Heft Bartenschlag.
 
Conley, Thomas Franklin (Frank) Conley aged 78, life-Long resident of Monroe County, died Wednesday morning, September 19th at <<<<<<< HEAD six oclock at his home on Sardis, Route 1. He had been ill for two years. A ======= six o clock at his home on Sardis, Route 1. He had been ill for two years. A >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 son of the late Jess and Sarah Conley of Sardis, he was born in Green Township on November 6, 1866. On April 12, 1891 he was united in marriage with Frances Lillie Carr, who preceded him in four years ago. Surviving are two daughters, Mrs. May Stewart of Sterling and Mrs. Sarah Price of Bridgeport; two sons, Oscar Conley of Sardis and Carl Conley of Bridgeport, five brothers, George Conley of Fly, Dorman Conley of New Martinsville, Mason Conley of Sardis, Elmer Conley of Shadyside and Eugene Conley of Wheeling and seven grandchildren. Four sons, Roy Conley of Fly, George Oliver, Walter Clifton and an infant son <<<<<<< HEAD preceded him in . Funeral services were held Sunday afternoon at two oclock at ======= preceded him in . Funeral services were held Sunday afternoon at two o clock at >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the Mt. Olive Church with Rev. George Mendenhall of Marietta officiating. Burial was in Mt. Olive Cemetery.
 
Conley, William Mason Conley, 89, died suddenly Wednesday evening, June 6, 1962, at his home on Sardis RFD. Born October 27, 1872, at Sardis, he was a son of Jesse and Sarah Matthess Conley. His wife Lucy Bobb Conley preceded him in in 1941. Surviving is one daughter, Isadore, of the home, one brother Elmer Conley of Shadyside and several nieces and nephews. Interment was in Sardis cemetery with Arthur Probst officiating.

Published--August >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 2003
Conner , Hazel , age 84, of Steinersville, died Saturday, August 2, 2003 at Country Club Retirement Center, Bellaire. She was born July 20, 1919 daughter of the late Neva Tice.She was a member of Amity United Methodist Church.Surviving are a brother, Arthur Tice of Wheeling; a sister, Gay Stiles of New Martinsville; an uncle, George Conner of Proctor; several nieces and nephews.Friends will be received at Toothman Funeral Home, Jacobsburg on Tuesday from 10 a.m. until time of services at 12 p.m., with Reverend Richard Mehl officiating. Burial will follow at Powhatan Cemetery.

======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Conner, Shawn J.

June 29, 1989

IN SERVICE

Shawn J. Conner

     Seaman Apprentice Shawn J. ======= JA'> Seaman Apprentice Shawn J. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Conner completed his Navy Basic Training at the Orlando Recruit Training Center in Orlando, FL April 14. He is now based there for 17 weeks attending school for electronic nuclear engineering.

     In late August he will have a ======= JA'> In late August he will have a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 two weeks liberty in which time he will be returning home before he goes to the Great Lakes Base in Chicago, Il for 28 more weeks of schooling.

     Shawn was one of the top three ======= JA'> Shawn was one of the top three >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 recruits in his company's academic scoring his job during basic training was Mail Petty Officer.

     Company, Co. 82 (Shawn's ======= JA'> Company, Co. 82 (Shawn's >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Company) was also the top graduating company. They received the highest awards given to a recruit company. The Hall of Fame Award and also the Commanding Officer Award. Since 1968 when the Orlando Recruit Training Center opened, 9,824 companies have graduated from there. Only 54 of those companies have won this award,. It is based on three weeks of competition among all companies with a combination of sports, firearms, intense inspections, academic scores, etc., and the company that gets the highest score ratings in all fields among the past 53 companies received the award.

Shawn has just recently received another promotion of Master at Arms. This is his third promotion since entering the navy in February.

     Before entering the Navy, Shawn ======= JA'> Before entering the Navy, Shawn >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 completed three semesters at Kent State University in Kent.

     Shawn's mother, Linda Conner of ======= JA'> Shawn's mother, Linda Conner of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Canon, attending his graduation of Basic Training and the three days of activities that the Navy put on for the navy families and friends. This company was also granted three days liberty at this time for being the most outstanding company.

     Shawn is the son of Larie J. ======= JA'> Shawn is the son of Larie J. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Connor and brother of Candi in Graysville.

     His address is S. A. Conner, ======= JA'> His address is S. A. Conner, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Shawn J.; U.S.N. 293-82-0904; Building 311; Co. 117 E.T.A.; Service School Command; Orlando, FL 32813.

Cooley, Alex Hissom
            Alex ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Alex >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Hissom Cooley Funeral services were held Friday in Sardis for Alex Hissom Cooley. Mr. Cooley died Tuesday, August 7, at his home in Sardis. A retired oil field worker and a veteran of World War I, he was born July 13, 1893, at Sardis, the son of Daniel and Martha Hissom Cooley. Surviving are his wife, Anna, a sister, Mrs. Neil Pubal of Cleveland and a brother, Ira Cooley of Sardis. Arthur Probst conducted the services from the Rush funeral home in Sardis and burial was in Northview Cemetery in New Martinsville. (8/7/1962)

  Cooper, Robert ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Published--June , 2000
Cooper, Robert >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lee, 74, of Ravenswood, West Virginia, departed this life, June 16, 2000, at
his home following an extended illness.
  He was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 February 8, 1926, at Norway, West Virginia, a son of the late Norman Clay and
Ruth Myrtle (Dennis) Cooper.
  He was a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 United States Army veteran of World War II and the Korean War, and a member of
the VFW Post # 6669, Ravenswood. He was retired from Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical
Corporation with 29 years service and a member of the United Steelworkers Union, Local #5668.
He was a member of the North United Methodist Church where he was a member of the church choir.
  Surviving are ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 his wife of 48 years, Helen ( Wallbrown) Cooper; son, Robert J. (Mia) Cooper of
Charleston; daughter, Debra E. Fairbank of Bedford, Texas; brothers, James Cooper of Hannibal, Ohio;
sister, Bonnie Floyd of Wallace.
  He was also preceded in death by one brother and three sisters.
  Service will ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was also preceded in death by one brother and three sisters.
Service will >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 be Monday, June 19, 2000--1 p.m. at Casto Funeral Home, Ravenswood, West Virginia,
with the Reverend Boyd Purcell and the Reverend Michael Curtis officiating. Burial will follow in the
Ravenswood Cemetery with military honors by VFW Post #6669, Ravenswood. Visitation 5--7 p.m.
Sunday at the funeral home. In lieu of flowers, donations are preferred to Kanawha Hospice Care, Incorporated,
1143 Dunbar Avenue, Dunbar, West Virginia  25064.

February 1983

Mary Louise Copley nee Lambert
 
Source:The Marietta Times, dated Monday, January 4, 2004
 
Woodsfield - Mary Louise Copley, 80, of Woodsfield died Sunday (January 4, 2004) at Good Samaritan Hospital in Zanesville. She was born October 14, 1923, in Attalla, Ala., to Otis and Hettie Orr Lambert. She was a member of the First Baptist Church of Woodsfield.
 
She was preceded in by her husband, Minis Copley, in 1999; and her parents.
 
She is survived by three sons, Charles Copley and his wife, Leisa, of Bethesda, Ohio, David Copley and his wife, Tina, of Quaker City, and Andy Copley and his wife, Rebecca, of Woodsfield; three daughters, Sandy Tomolonis and her husband, Rodney, of Bethesda, Tausha Copley of Woodsfield and M.J. Copley of Woodsfield; three brothers, James Lambert and his wife, Alice, of Huntsville, Ala., Charles Henry Driskell and his wife, Barbara, of Gadsden, Ala., and Thomas Richard Driskell and his wife, Ann, of Gadsden; 12 grandchildren; three great-grandchildren; and several nieces and nephews.
 
Services are at 1 p.m. Wednesday at the First Baptist Church of Woodsfield with Pastor Travis Smalley officiating. Burial is in Calais Cemetery in Calais, Ohio. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Tuesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home at 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, and from noon Wednesday until time for the services at the church.

October 22, 1931
January 4, 1994
Woodsfield
 
Marietta Times, Oct 17, 2002
A. Mansil Coss
BARNESVILLE - A. Mansil Coss, 91, of the Walton Retirement Home in Barnesville, formerly of 36400 Connor Ridge Road, Woodsfield, died at 3 a.m. Wednesday (Oct. 16, 2002) at Barnesville Hospital in Barnesville.
He was born June 14, 1911, near Marr to Arthur Cleveland and Anna B. Hall Coss. He was a retired welder for Republic Steel and L.T.V. Steel in Massillon. He was a U.S. Army veteran of World War II, serving during the Normandy Invasion. He was recently named the oldest Monroe County recipient of the Normandy Medal. He was a member of Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 5303 and American Legion Post 87, both at Woodsfield.
He is survived by one brother, Merle Coss and his wife, Jeannette, of Woodsfield; one niece, Becky Highman and her husband, Paul, of Woodsfield; two great-nieces, Mollie Landefeld and her husband, David Jr., of Woodsfield and Sarah Sawyers and her husband, Rustin, of Dublin; and one great-great-nephew, Dustin Wyatt Landefeld of Woodsfield.
He was preceded in death by his parents.
Services are at 2 p.m. Saturday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Pastor James Porter officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield with full military graveside services conducted by the Belmont Veterans Council. Friends will be received from 3 to 9 p.m. Friday at the funeral home.
 
Coss, Arthur C.

   Miss Gonzales is an employee of Southern Belle Telephone and Telegraph Co., of New Orleans.

Coss, Mary Coss
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
June 6, 1913
 
Coss, Merle 'Pap'
WOODSFIELD - Merle "Pap" Coss, 87, of 36136 Conner Ridge Road died at 6:25 a.m. Wednesday (October. 27, 2004) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center, Woodsfield.
He was born October. 21, 1917, near Rinard Mills, a son of the late Arthur Cleveland and Anna B. Hall Coss.
He was a retired school bus driver for the Switzerland of Ohio School District and owner of Coss's Welding Shop near Woodsfield. He was a Protestant by faith and attended the Conner Ridge Methodist Church for 63 years. He was a member and past master of the Graysville Grange 2681, Graysville; a 50-year member of Stafford Lodge 300, Free & Accepted Masons; Order of Eastern Star 268, Woodsfield; member and past president of the Conner Ridge Cemetery Association; a former Boy Scout leader; and a former 4-H adviser for the Graysville Teamworkers 4-H Club.
In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by one brother, Mansil Coss.
Surviving are his wife, Jeannette Love Coss, whom he married on January. 26, 1946; one daughter, Mrs. Paul (Becky) Highman of Woodsfield; two granddaughters, Mrs. David (Molly) Landefeld Jr. of Woodsfield and Sarah Highman and fiancee, Sean Gillilan, of Columbus; and one great-grandson, Dustin Wyatt Landefeld of Woodsfield.
Services will be held at 1 p.m. Saturday at Watters Funeral Home, 37501 State Route 78 West, Woodsfield, with Frank Love and Hubert Alexander officiating. Burial will follow in Conner Ridge Cemetery near Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. Friday at the funeral home.
Masonic services will be held at 7:30 p.m. Friday followed by Eastern Star services at the funeral home. Source: The Marietta Times, Thursday, October 28, 2004.

Thelma I. Covert nee Cunningham
 
Source:The Marietta Times, dated Tuesday, April 29, 2003
   Woodsfield - ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield - >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Thelma I. Covert, 70, of Roy Watson Road died Sunday (April 27, 2003) at Ruby Memorial Hospital in Morgantown, W.Va. She was born August 29, 1932, in New Matamoras to James and Goldie Moore Cunningham. She was a graduate of Kent State University and was a cosmetology teacher at Wayne County Vocational School. She was also the owner of Covert's Antiques of Woodsfield.
   She is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by her husband, Paul Covert; one son, Paul Michael Covert and his wife, Tracie, of Massillon; one daughter, Linda Sims and her husband, Lewis, of Canton; two brothers, Dean Cunningham of Columbus and James Cunningham of Roanoke, Va.; two sisters, Helen Dennis of Ravenswood, W.Va., and Joan Bradley of West Haven, Conn.; four grandchildren, Amy, Amber and Mathew Lang, and Sarah Covert; and eight great-grandchildren.
   She was preceded in by her parents and one brother, Robert Cunningham.
   Services are ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was preceded in by her parents and one brother, Robert Cunningham.
Services are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at 1 p.m. Thursday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home at 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield. Burial is in Plainview Cemetery near Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Wednesday at the funeral home.

Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
               Friends of L. C. TRUEX and Miss Sophia COVEY both of Woodsfield, Route 2 will be pleased to learn of their marriage which was solemnized on the 26 day of July 1912, by Squire Louis Hoeffler at ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Friends of L. C. TRUEX and Miss Sophia COVEY both of Woodsfield, Route 2 will be pleased to learn of their marriage which was solemnized on the 26 day of July 1912, by Squire Louis Hoeffler at >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 his office. Mr. Truex is a well known and prosperous young farmer and has always been very busy popular among his associates and friends. Miss Covey is an estimable young lady as well as being one of the most popular young ladies in this vicinity. Their many friends extend best wishes for a happy married <<<<<<< HEAD life.  
======= life. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Cowgill, Larry Gene and Lisa Renee Stephen
            And ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> And >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 we shall become one to share all the days of our lives.
Lisa Renee Stephen and Larry Gene Cowgill together with their parents Mr. and Mrs. Dale Stephen and Mr. and Mrs. Charles Cowgill invite you to share in the joy when they exchange marriage vows and begin their new life together on Saturday, the twenty-first of September, nineteen hundred and eighty-five at one-thirty in the afternoon at Main Street Church of Christ, Caldwell, Ohio.

Cox, A. Mansil Cox

Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
     Barnesville - A. Mansil Coss, 91, of the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Barnesville - A. Mansil Coss, 91, of the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Walton Retirement Home in Barnesville, formerly of 36400 Connor Ridge Road, Woodsfield, died at 3 a.m. Wednesday (October 16, 2002) at Barnesville Hospital in Barnesville.
     He was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 June 14, 1911, near Marr to Arthur Cleveland and Anna B. Hall Coss. He was a retired welder for Republic Steel and L.T.V. Steel in Massillon. He was a U.S. Army veteran of World War II, serving during the Normandy Invasion. He was recently named the oldest Monroe County recipient of the Normandy Medal. He was a member of Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 5303 and American Legion Post 87, both at Woodsfield.
     He is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by one brother, Merle Coss and his wife, Jeannette, of Woodsfield; one niece, Becky Highman and her husband, Paul, of Woodsfield; two great-nieces, Mollie Landefeld and her husband, David Jr., of Woodsfield and Sarah Sawyers and her husband, Rustin, of Dublin; and one great-great-nephew, Dustin Wyatt Landefeld of Woodsfield.
     He was preceded in by his parents.
     Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was preceded in by his parents.
Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are at 2 p.m. Saturday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Pastor James Porter officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield with full military graveside services conducted by the Belmont Veterans Council. Friends will be received from 3 to 9 p.m. Friday at the funeral home.

            Woodsfield ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 - Gladys M. Cox, 97, of 39887 Stonehouse Road died at 7:40 a.m. Sunday (May 26, 2002) at the Monroe County Care Center in Woodsfield.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born July 18, 1904, near Antioch to William H. and Anna Payne Cline. She was a graduate of Muskingum College at New Concord. She retired as a school teacher, having taught in various schools throughout Monroe County. She was a member of Plainview Church of Christ near Woodsfield, the Ohio Retired Teachers Association and the Monroe County Retired Teachers Association. She was a 50-year member of the Graysville Grange.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is survived by three daughters, Mrs. Arnold (Helen) Miracle of Jeromesville, Ohio, Mrs. Dale (Jean) Morris of Woodsfield and Mrs. Daniel (Janet) Belford of Massillon; one brother, Doyle Cline of Seville, Ohio; eight grandchildren; and 16 great-grandchildren.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by her husband, Willis E. Cox, on November 15, 1969; one son, Robert D. Cox, on July 5, 1998; her parents; five brothers, Orville, Boyd, Bernie, Wilford and Harold Cline; and one grandson, Bruce E. Miracle.
            Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are at 11 a.m. Wednesday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Harold Kinney Jr. officiating. Burial is in Antioch Cemetery in Antioch, Ohio. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Tuesday at the funeral home.
 
Cox, Margaret L.
Died: February 23, 1919
 
Cox, Margaret M. Cox
Died: October 10, 1936
 
Cox, Perthena E. Cox
Died: Aug 13, 1908
 
July 19, 1999
Woodsfield
 
 
Roger J. Cox
 
Source:The Marietta Times, dated, Monday February 9, 2004
 
Woodsfield - Roger J. Cox, 96, of Woodsfield died Thursday (February 5, 2004) at the Columbus Colony Care Center in Westerville, Ohio. He was born August 6, 1907, in Graysville, Ohio, to Leander Cox and Clorinda Daugherty Cox. He was a retired rural mail carrier for 42 years, and also owner/operator of the Cox Sawmill and Started the first automated car wash in Woodsfield. He was a member of St. Paul's United Church of Christ at Woodsfield and K of P Lodge at Woodsfield.
 
He is survived by one son, William Cox and his wife, Patsy, of Port Charlotte, Fla.; one daughter, Pamela Faiella of Columbus; 11 grandchildren; 10 great-grandchildren; and one great-great-grandson.
 
He was preceded in by his wife, Perthena Baker Cox, in 1999; two sons, Jack E. Cox and Eugene Cox; three brothers; two sisters; and one infant sister.
 
Services are at 11 a.m. today at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with the Rev. Cliff Garris officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield.
 
 
Cox, RoseMary Cox
 
Dec 24, 1926
 
September 1, 2001
Woodsfield

  Jacob A. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>
Jacob A. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Craig, 74, a retired farmer and livestock Dealer of near Miltonsburg, Ohio, died at 11:00 a.m. Tuesday, November 26, 1963, at his home, after a short illness.
  He was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 near Woodsfield, January 21, 1889, a son of John Thomas Craig and Loretta Fisher Craig, who preceded him in death.
  On October, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On October, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 29, 1913, he was united in marriage with Mary K. Hibbs, of Parkersburg, W.Va., and to this union three sons were born: Delbert Craig, of Woodsfield, Route 4;
Virgil Craig, of Clarington, Route 1, and Vernon Craig, of New Philadelphia.
  Also surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Also surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are thirteen grandchildren; five great grandchildren; three sisters, Mrs. Annie Holtsclaw, of Woodsfield, Route 4; Mrs Ella Griffith, of Woodsfield, Route 4, and Mrs. Marie McKelvey, of Woodsfield, Route 3, and one brother, Chester Craig, of Woodsfield, Route 4. He was preceded in death by three sisters and one brother.
  He also leaves to mourn his death a host of cousins, neighbors and friends.
  Mr. Craig was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He also leaves to mourn his death a host of cousins, neighbors and friends.
Mr. Craig was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a devoted husband, a loving father, a kind and helpful neighbor. He will be sadly missed by all who knew him.
  Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held in The Bauer and Turner Funeral Chapel on Friday afternoon at two o'clock, with Rev. Richard Perkins officiating. Interment was in the Moffett Cemetery.

Craig, Rosemary Iches

July 27, 1972

DEATH

Rosemary Craig Iches

Source: Beacon

   Mrs. Rosemary Craig Iches, 36, of ======= JA'> Mrs. Rosemary Craig Iches, 36, of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Wooster, Ohio, formerly of Woodsfield, died Thursday, July 20, 1972 at her home.

   She was born August 30, 1935, near ======= JA'> She was born August 30, 1935, near >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Woodsfield, the daughter of Clark and Helen Truax Craig, of Woodsfield Route 4.

   Mrs. Iches was an employee of the ======= JA'> Mrs. Iches was an employee of the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 United Telephone Company of Wooster the past eighteen years.

   Surviving in addition to her ======= JA'> Surviving in addition to her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 parents, are four sisters, Mrs. John Wilson of Wooster; Mrs. Gary Rostetter of Wooster Route 2; Mrs. Edgar Pfalzgraf of Clarington Route1, and Miss Linda Craig of Moundsville, West Virginia; three brothers, Stephen Craig of Wooster; David Craig and Robert Dean Craig of Woodsfield, and her grandmother, Mrs. Lucy Craig of Woodsfield Route 4.

   The body was brought to the Bauer ======= JA'> The body was brought to the Bauer >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Turner Funeral Home on Sunday where friends were received.

   Funeral services were held in ======= JA'> Funeral services were held in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 their chapel on Monday afternoon at one o'clock, with Minister J.V.A. Traylor officiating. Interment was in Goudy Cemetery, near Woodsfield.

            RINARD ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> RINARD >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 MILLS - Sarah Elizabeth Craig, 99, of Rinard Mills died at 12:15 a.m. Thursday (March 7, 2002) at Harmar Place in Marietta.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born March 7, 1903, in Ellenboro, W.Va., to Joseph and Lucinda Wince Grimes. She was a homemaker and a member of Rinard Mills Methodist Church.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is survived by one son, Joseph H. Craig and his wife, Maxine, of Rinard Mills; two grandsons, Russ Craig and his wife, Patty, of Nokesville, Va., and Jeff Craig and his wife, Holly, of Cincinnati; two great-grandchildren; and two sisters, Lorena Jordan, of Reno and Flora Ward, of Mineral Wells, W.Va.
On May 15, 1923, she married Bernard Austin Craig. He died June 6, 1985. She was also preceded in death by her parents; three brothers, Ted, Harry and Hosie Grimes; and four sisters, Mattie Say, Blanche Haddox, Letha Grimes and Bessie Karcher.
            Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will be held at the convenience of the family at Hadley Funeral Home, New Matamoras. Crawford, Barbara E. Crawford
 
 September 2, 1845 Seneca
 January 9, 1928
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> September 2, 1845 Seneca
January 9, 1928
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Barbara E. Crawford, (nee Pfalzgraf)
The Spirit of Democracy Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, January 1928
  There comes a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> There comes a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 time in every home when its occupants must experience the deep sadness and innumerable heartaches that accompany the grim reaper, , which in spite of kind treatment and all that willing hands can do thrusts its unwelcome sickle here and there and plucks from earth its chosen victims.
  Shortly after ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Shortly after >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 noon on January 9, 1928, our Heavenly Father in whose hand is held dominion over life and , called to peaceful rest, the soul of Barbara Rubel Crawford (nee Pfalzgraf), her being due to a hemorrhage.
  The deceased ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The deceased >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born in Seneca Township, Monroe County, Ohio, on September 2, 1845, being at he time of her 82 years, 3 months, and 10 days old.
  She was confirmed and joined the Evangelical church at St. Johns Middle Church at an early age, of which she remained a consistent member till her .
  In 1865, she ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was confirmed and joined the Evangelical church at St. John s Middle Church at an early age, of which she remained a consistent member till her .
In 1865, she >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was united in marriage to Jacob Rubel, who preceded her to the Great Beyond in 1883. To this union were born five children, Mrs. Joseph Betts, of near Bucyrus, Ohio; L. D. Rubel, of Barnesville, Ohio; G. A. Rubel and Mrs. William Goodhart, of near Summerfield, Ohio and John Rubel who preceded her 14 years ago.
  In 1886, she ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In 1886, she >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was united in marriage to G. W. Crawford. To this union was born one daughter Mrs. C. F. Betts of the home.
  Besides the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Besides the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 husband and children she is survived by four sisters, Mrs. Elizabeth Eberle, of Woodsfield; Mrs. Eva Christman of near Lewisville, Ohio; Mrs. Fred Keylor of Edwina, Ohio; Mrs. Christina Brownfield of near Antioch, Ohio; two brothers, Lewis Pfalzgraf of Rockport, West Virginia, and George Pfalzgraf of near Lewisville; 40 grandchildren and 27 great grandchildren.
Added to these are many more relatives and a host of friends to mourn her departure.
  Kindly and ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Kindly and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 generous in hart she was beloved by everyone, denying herself to give to those in need. She was a mother to them all.
  Services were ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services were >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 held at the home on Wednesday afternoon by the Reverend Weber of Miltonsburg, Ohio. After a last farewell the body was taken to Calais cemetery, Calais, Ohio where it was surrendered to the earth and consecrated to the last general resurrection when all those who sleep in Christ will rise in honor and glory.
  A precious one from us has gone
  A voice we love is stilled.
  A place is vacant in our home
  That never can be filled.    --B. D. R.
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A precious one from us has gone
A voice we love is stilled.
A place is vacant in our home
That never can be filled. --B. D. R.

Crawford, Beulah M.

In Loving Memory            Beulah M. Crawford

>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Beulah M. Crawford
September 16, 1920--July 7, 2004
Beulah M. Crawford, 83, of 501 Plum Street, Summerfield, Ohio died at 11:25 p.m. Wednesday, July 7, 2004 in the Marietta Memorial Hospital, Marietta, Ohio
She was born near Calais, Ohio on September 16, 1920 a daughter of the late Dory and Alda Wickham Morris.
She was a homemaker and a member of the Seneca Valley Church of Christ at Calais, Ohio.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Ervil Crawford, two brothers; Clyde and Chester Morris; one sister, Grace Henthorn.
Surviving are one daughter; Lucile English of New Matamoras, Ohio; one son, Eugene Crawford and his wife Eleanor of Summerfield, Ohio; one brother, Freeman Morris of Sardis, Ohio; three sisters,Gladys Salisbury of Sardis, Ohio, Mary Riggs of New Matamoras, Ohio and Ellen Nolen of North Carolina; two grandchildren, Cecile English and her fiance Ryan Watters and Tiffany English; seven step-grandchildren; 15 step-great grandchildren; several nieces and nephews.
Friends will be received at the Brubach-Watters Funeral Home, Summerfield, Ohio from 6-9 p.m., Friday  where funeral services will be held at 1:00 ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> where funeral services will be held at 1:00 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 p.m. Saturday with Frank Love officiating. Burial will follow in the Batesville Cemetery, Batesville, Ohio.

Crawford, Clara

     Mrs. Clara ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Clara >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Crawford, age 82 years, died early Sunday morning. She was a splendid woman and her passing brings much sadness to the home and community.
     Surviving are three daughters and one son, as ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are three daughters and one son, as >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 follows: Mrs. Frank Buckio, with whom she made her home, in Woodsfield; Mrs. Oscar Headly of Woodsfield, Mrs. Earl Noble, of Bellaire, and Everett Crawford, of Laings.
     Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held at the Buckio home on Tuesday afternoon at 4:00 o'clock in charge of Rev. W. H. Petry assisted by Rev. W. J. Jones. Interment was made in Oaklawn Cemetery.

Crawford, Edna Crawford nee Houge
Mrs. Raymond Crawford Dies Suddenly

     Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Raymond Crawford, aged 22 years, died early last Saturday evening at the family home of Woodsfield, Rt.1.
     Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Crawford was a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ronane Houge of Graysville, Rt.1, and besides her parents she is survived by her husband and two infant sons; one sixteen months and the other only about one week old. was due to complications following childbirth.
     Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were conducted at the home Monday afternoon being in the charge of Evangelist A.E. Harper, of St. Mary's,W.Va. Church of Christ and were largely attended. Interment was in Moffett Cemetery.
 
Crawford, Ervil A.
Source--News Clipping
Published--July 1996
SUMMERFIELD-- Ervil A. Crawford, 89, of 309 Cross Street, died Monday, July 15, 1996 at Summit Acres Nursing Home in Caldwell.
He was born June 14, 1907 in Millwood Township, Guernsey County, near Quaker City, to John Samuel and Lorena Morris Crawford.
He was a retired farmer and a member of the Seneca Valley Church of Christ near Calais. He was a United States Army veteran of World War II and a member of the Disabled American Veterans.
He is survived by his wife, Beulah Morris Crawford, whom he married December 31,1945; one daughter, Lucile English and her husband Paul of Woodsfield; one son Eugene Crawford and his wife Eleanor of Summerfield; one sister, Merle Crawford of Zanesville; two granddaughters; seven Step-grandchildren; 15 step-great-grandchildren.
He was preceded in death by one brother, Raymond Crawford.
Services are at 2 p.m. Thursday at Brubach-Watters Funeral Home, 202 Main Street, Summerfield, with Keith Jones officiating. Burial is in Batesville Cemetery with full military graveside services conducted by the Belmont Veterans Council. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Wednesday at the funeral home.
 
Crawford, Ervil A.

>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Crawford, Mr. and Mrs. Floyd
Source--Monroe County Beacon    Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--Thursday   ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--Thursday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 March 2, 2004
On February 24, 1960, Linda Claus and Floyd Crawford were united in marriage. The couple celebrated their 40th anniversary with an overnight trip to the Amish Country, where they enjoyed a fabulous dinner.
Mrs. Crawford has driven school busses for 29 years, and is currently employed by the Canal Winchester School System. Mr. Crawford is a truck driver who transports Jet fuel for the BP Oil Company.
The Crawfords have four children, Mrs. Dennis (Rhonda) Pilck, of Pleasant City, Billy Joe Crawford, deceased, Mrs. Al (Lori) Fauley, of White House and JR and Trudy Crawford, of Pickerington. They enjoy visits with their three granddaughters and two great grandsons, and expect two new additions to the family at any time.
A second celebration will be enjoyed when they travel to Paradise Island in the Bahamas for a vacation with children. The Crawfords reside at 2938 Hubberdton Place, Reynoldsburg, Ohio 43068, and would enjoy receiving cards and letters.

Crawford, Helen D.
Source:Daily Jeffersonian, Cambridge, Ohio, January 3, 2003
HELEN D. Crawford 1934-2003
Woodsfield  Helen D. Crawford, 68, of Cuyahoga Falls ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Woodsfield Helen D. Crawford, 68, of Cuyahoga Falls >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Antioch, died Thursday (January 2, 2003) at the Monroe County Care Center in Woodsfield.
  Friends may ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends may >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 call from 2 to 9 p.m. Sunday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services will be 11 a.m. Monday with Keith Jones officiating. Burial will be in Antioch Cemetery in Antioch.
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Crawford, Hugh
              One by one of our friends are dropping from ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> One by one of our friends are dropping from >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the activities of life. Mr. Hugh Crawford, a lifeLong friend of the writer, died Sunday evening after a short but very painful illness.
  Mr. Crawford ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Crawford >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born in Ireland November 18, 1835, and died at his home on Maple Avenue November 25, 1917.
  He came to ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He came to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 America with his parents when very young and spent his life in Monroe County, Ohio. He was a Tanner by trade and at one time was engaged in that business inBeallsville, Ohio, Ohio, later coming to Woodsfield conducting the same line of business for a number of years. He was known by almost all of the people of Monroe County and enjoyed their confidence, having won their respect because of his honesty and faithfulness toward his fellow man. When Hugh Crawford promised you anything he made good that promise. He was a manly man.
  He was united ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was united >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in marriage to Miss Margaret Craig and to this union were born seven children- - four girls and three boys, all of whom are living and all were present when their father passed into the great beyond.
  Deceased was a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Deceased was a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 member of the Presbyterian Church and lived in accordance with his profession. The funeral was held Tuesday and was conducted by the Reverend L. R. Lawther of St. Clairsville, Ohio.
  May he rest in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> May he rest in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 peace and may the peace of Him whom he trusted for future salvation be a comfort to the bereaved family.
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Thursday,  November 29, 1917
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> November 29, 1917 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Crawford, Johnny Grover
Source--The Times Reporter    New Philadelphia, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> New Philadelphia, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--February 20, 2005
Crawford , John Grover , age 67, of Parral died early Saturday morning, February 19, 2005, in Union Hospital at Dover. For the last six years, Mr. Crawford bravely battled lymphoma. Born in Noble County, Ohio., November 19, 1937, he was a son of Juanita Mae Bunting Crawford of Newcomers-town, Ohio., and the late Raymond B. Crawford. John was a 1956 graduate of Batesville High School in Noble County and worked at various places before illness necessitated his retirement from Wayne-Dalton of Mount Hope. John loved to travel in his camper. He and his wife would stay in K.O.A. campgrounds from coast to coast. In 2002, he and his wife made a memorable trip to Hawaii. Friends and neighbors will remember Mr. Crawford for his careful restoration of two classic pickup trucks, a 1952 and a 1932 - both Fords. Most of all, John loved his family, and always looked forward to spending time at cookouts and holiday events. John regularly attended swap meets. Survivors include his wife of 47 years, the former Clara Regina Morris. Together, they raised a family that includes two daughters, Cynthia (Dennis) Colvin of Uhrichsville and Lisa (Jim) Rothacher of Dover; two sons, Daniel Crawford and Michael Crawford, both of Dover. He'll be sadly missed by nine grandchildren, Regina Swauger, Lee Swauger, Chrystal Bayang, John R. Crawford, Jesse James Rothacher, Kaci Rothacher, Tyler Crawford, Karley Crawford and Houston Crawford; a great-grandchild, Makayla Contrael; and a sister and brother-in-law, Mary and Bob Ryan of Newcomerstown. In addition to his father, Mr. Crawford was preceded in death by an infant brother, Kinnith Lee Crawford. Private family services were held Sunday evening in the Geib Funeral Center at Dover. Local cremation is under the care and direction of Geib's North Dover Crematory. There are no public calling hours. To share memories or condolences with the family, please visit the online memorial to Mr. Crawford's life on the funeral home's Web site. The family requests that memorial contributions be made to Hospice of Tuscarawas County, 201 West 3rd St., Dover Ohio ,44622. www.geibfuneral.com
 
 
Crawford, John W.
May 13, 1866, Woodsfield
November 26, 1931
Woodsfield
John W. Crawford
The Spirit of Democracy Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, December 3, 1931
  John W. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> John W. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Crawford, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Crawford, was born near Woodsfield, Ohio on May 13, 1866 and departed this life at his home in Woodsfield on November 26, 1931, at the age of 65 years, 6 months and 17 days. He was a son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Crawford, the former coming to this country <<<<<<< HEAD at an early age from Derry County Ireland. His mothers maiden name was Miss ======= at an early age from Derry County Ireland. His mother s maiden name was Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mary Cooper. To their happy union, six children were born, one son Hugh having preceded his brother John to the better land.
 
  The brothers ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The brothers >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and sisters surviving are James Crawford, of Estherville, Iowa; Mrs. Lydia Bothwell, of Formoso, Kansas; Dave G. Crawford and Mrs. William McCue of the home. Two nieces and four nephews also mourn the loss of their beloved uncle.
  Mr. Crawford ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Crawford >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 grew to manhood on the farm and during the past several years was associated with his brother Dave in the firm of Crawford Bros., Dealers in lumber and timber.
  Mr. Crawford ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Crawford >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 never married and made his home with his brother and sister after of his parents. He was industrious and honorable in his relations with fellowmen and though retiring in disposition those who knew best respected him most.
  At an early ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> At an early >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 age, Mr. Crawford became a member of the Presbyterian Church Body and was always faithful in his attendance and other duties therein. At any time and in any way and at any place where service was needed in his neighborhood, Mr. Crawford was always ready to go and do anything within his power.
  Mr. Crawford ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Crawford >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was seriously ill only a few weeks, from stomach and intestinal complications and everything possible was done to restore his health, not only but his loved ones, but by the best of medical skill and service. He bore his suffering patiently and with a confidence born of rectitude and faith, his spirit returned to Him who gave it.
 
  Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held on Saturday afternoon at the McCue home, in charge of the Reverend W. H. Petry, pastor of the Woodsfield Presbyterian Church, and were largely attended. Interment in Oaklawn Cemetery Woodsfield.

January 17, 1930
