George D. Cree
The Spirit of Democracy Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, January 22, 1930
  George D. Cree, aged 80 years, one of Woodsfields most highly respected citizens, died ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> George D. Cree, aged 80 years, one of Woodsfield s most highly respected citizens, died >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at his home on Oak Lawn avenue Friday morning, January 17, 1930, following an illness of several months of complications arising from a paralytic stroke.
  Mr. Cree ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Cree >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 formerly resided near Graysville, Ohio, and has been interested in oil field work in the County the greater part of his life.
  He is survived ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He is survived >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 by his wife, five daughters and three sons; James W. Cree of Tulsa, Oklahoma; George B. Cree of Pampa, Texas; O. R. Cree, of Wichita, Kansas; Mrs. W. A. Winland of Graysville; Mrs. S. G. Clegg of Barnesville, Ohio; Mrs. Ella Frank of the home; Mrs. T. A. Jefferson of Cleveland, Ohio; Mrs. B. L. Hoover of Pampa, Texas.
  Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held Monday afternoon at 2 p.m. from the late home and interment was in Oaklawn cemetery, Woodsfield. The Reverend J. F. Casin conducted the service, assisted by Minister J. V. A. Traylor, of Woodsfield Church of Christ.

Creighton, James Creighton
February 9, 1916
 
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Creighton, Sr., John Robert "Bob" Creighton
Source:Marietta Times   Marietta, Oh   Dec 2002
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Source:Marietta Times Marietta, Oh Dec 2002 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
     MATAMORAS - ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> MATAMORAS - >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 John Robert "Bob" Creighton Sr., 72, of 518 Third St., died at 12:47 a.m. Saturday (December 28, 2002) at Marietta Memorial Hospital.
     He was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 March 14, 1930, in Monroe County to Harold F. "Ted" and Iva Amanda Petty Creighton. He graduated from Matamoras High School in 1948. He was a machinist and welder for Creighton Machine Shop. He was a member of Matamoras First Baptist Church and American Legion Post 378 at New Matamoras. He was a life member of Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 5108 at Marietta.
     He is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by his wife, Patricia J. Locke Creighton, whom he married on July 11, 1950; two daughters, Teresa Swan and her husband, Mike, of New Matamoras and Tammy Powell and her husband, Dave, of St. Marys, W.Va.; one son, John R. Creighton Jr. and his wife, Melanie, of New Matamoras; and grandchildren, Sara and Shana Swan of New Matamoras, Dawn and Joe Swan and Missy Factor, all of Columbus, Brittany, Lindsey and Lydia Powell, all of St. Marys, and John Paul Creighton, Coty Creighton and Tammy Wilfong, all of New Matamoras.
     He was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 preceded in by his parents; and one brother, Dean F. Creighton, on August 16, 1999.
     Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are at 11 a.m. Tuesday at Hadley Funeral Home, New Matamoras, with the Rev. Rick Smith officiating. Burial is in Matamoras Cemetery. The family will receive friends from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. today at the funeral home.
     Memorial ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Memorial >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 contributions may be made to Matamoras First Baptist Church, P.O. Box 566, New Matamoras.

======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
James William Criswell
 
The Marietta Times, Friday, January 17, 2003
  LEWISVILLE, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> LEWISVILLE, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio - James William Criswell, 50, of Township Road 15, Lewisville, died Wednesday (January 15, 2003) at his home. He was born March 27, 1952, at Fort Bragg, N.C., to Linsly and Pat Stewart Criswell. He was a 1970 graduate of Shenandoah High School and a 1976 graduate of Bowling Green State University. He was a former science, health and physical education teacher at Meadowbrook High School, where he also served as head wrestling coach and assistant
footBall coach. He had also acted as wrestling coach at Shenandoah High School for one year. He had attended Whigville Community Church.
  He is survived ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He is survived >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 by one daughter, Emma Jo Criswell of Caldwell; his parents of Caldwell; one sister, Judy (Frank) Loraditch of Cumberland; and several nieces and nephews.
  Services are ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at 1 p.m. Saturday at McVay-Perkins Funeral Home at 416 East St., Caldwell, with Pastor Cam Hayes and Pastor Gary Jacobs officiating. Burial is in Calais Cemetery. Friends may call from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. Saturday at the funeral home.
 
 
Criswell, Lessie Mildred 'Pat' (nee Stewart)
Source:The Marietta Times, dated Saturday, December 27, 2003
            CALDWELL ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> CALDWELL >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 - Lessie Mildred "Pat" Criswell, 89, formerly of Lewisville, died Wednesday morning (December 24, 2003) at Summit Acres Nursing Home in Caldwell. She was born June 4, 1914, in Culman, Ala., to George and Emma Bonner Stewart. She was a homemaker and was a Protestant by faith.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is survived by one daughter, Judy (Frank) Loraditch of Cumberland; one sister, Tammie Clark of Jonesboro, Ga.; and two grandchildren, Emma Criswell and Rebecca Loraditch.

Cronin, Albert
     Albert Cronin was born December 17, 1848 ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Albert Cronin was born December 17, 1848 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and died January 1, 1911, aged 62 years and 15 days. He was united in marriage with Miss Ellen J. Baker. To this union were born five children, two sons and three daughters. Two daughters, Libbie Jane and Mary Ellen preceded him to the home beyond the dark river of . The living children are. S. L. Cronin and Mrs J. A. Hines of Woodsfield and M. L. Cronin of Wayne township. He obeyed the gospel and became a Christian in 1871 under the ministry of Elder Joseph WalterS, Since his plighted faith in Jesus the Christ he has fought the good <<<<<<< HEAD fight and kept the faith, having finished lifes course with courage and ======= fight and kept the faith, having finished life s course with courage and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 honors, he now enjoys the rest of those who die in the Lord.
     Few men were better known and more highly ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Few men were better known and more highly >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 respected in the community in which they were born and raised than Brother Albert Cronin was in Wayne township where he was born and spent his life. He was a farmer and stock raiser and was successful and prosperous; a man of nature judgment, a companion well informed in a general way, which make him an interesting conversationalist. He was for a number of years prior to his one of the overseers or Bishops of the Church of Christ at Richfork; so that he will be sadly missed in many relations of life; in the family; as a loving husband and father and counselor; in the community as a neighbor and citizen, in the church as one of the pillars and faithful members. But what is loss to us is gain to him.
     Funeral services were conducted at the ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Funeral services were conducted at the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christian house of Worship at Woodsfield, Ohio, by Elder K. W. Harkins Tuesday January 3 in the presence of a large number of relatives and friends and former acquaintances. At the hour of 1 p.m. after services at the church we went to the old Barber cemetery where a host of neighbors waited in the cold and storm to get the last look at the cold house of clay in which formerly had dwelt their neighbor and brother.
     The bereaved family have the sincerest ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The bereaved family have the sincerest >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 sympathy.
Albert Cronin (2nd obituary)
     Albert Cronin, aged about 62 years died Sunday evening at the home of his daughter, Mrs. J. A. Hines on Maple Avenue after an illness of several months from stomach trouble. All last summer science, skill and nursing were employed to restore his usual good health but in vain. The funeral was held Tuesday morning at 11 oclock from the Church of ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Albert Cronin, aged about 62 years died Sunday evening at the home of his daughter, Mrs. J. A. Hines on Maple Avenue after an illness of several months from stomach trouble. All last summer science, skill and nursing were employed to restore his usual good health but in vain. The funeral was held Tuesday morning at 11 o clock from the Church of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christ of which he had been a member for years. The services were conducted by Eldwer D. W. Harkins. Interment in the Barber cemetery.

Cronin, Crawford

Deceased was born in Monroe County and resided here for many years. He was married to Miss Mary A. FISHER in 1860, who with five children still survive. Mr. Cronin was a member of the Christian Church from early manhood and always took great interest in religious matters. He has many relatives and friends in Monroe County.

Cronin, Ellen J. Cronin
April 15, 1926
 
Ellen Jane Cronin nee Baker
 
     Mrs. Ellen ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Ellen >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Cronin, aged about 79 years, died at 12:30 Thursday afternoon of last week at the home of her daughter Mrs. Viola Hines, on Maple Ave after an illness of several months from paralysis. Funeral services were held at the residence on Sunday afternoon in charge of her pastor, H. H. Adamson, of the Church of Christ. Besides her daughter Mrs. Cronin is survived by two sons, S. L. Cronin, of Mexia, Texas; and Roy Cronin, of Woodsfeild.
 
     Interment ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Interment >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was made in Barber Ridge cemetery by the side of the body of her late husband, Albert Cronin.
 
     Ellen Jane ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Ellen Jane >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Baker, daughter of John and Elizabeth Baker, was born July 20, 1847, and departed this life April 15, 1926, at the age of seventy-eight years, 8 months and 25 days. She was married to Albert Cronin over sixty years ago, and to this union five children were born, three girls and two boys; and besides these they raised two others, Mary Early and Edna Cronin. Her husband preceded her to the Great Beyond about fifteen years ago and two of the girls died in infancy. Those left to mourn her loss are S. L. Cronin, of Mexia, Tex.; Roy Cronin and Mrs. Viola C. Hines, both of Woodsfield; one sister, Mrs. Mary E. Winland, of Woodsfield seven grandchildren and five great grandchildren, besides a host of relatives and friends.
 
     She obeyed her Saviors call at the age of sixteen at the Richfork congregation of the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She obeyed her Savior s call at the age of sixteen at the Richfork congregation of the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Church of Christ at which place she still held her membership.
 
     Those who ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Those who >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 attended the funeral from a distance are Crawford Cronin, of Smackover, Ark.; Mr. and Mrs. H. H. Silverman, of Marsceilles, Ohio; Mr. and Mrs. A. P. Staudt, of Akron; Mr and Mrs Asa McMullen, of Barnesville; Mr. and Mrs. A. R. Baker, of Pittsburg; S. L. Cronin, of Mexia, Texas; J. T. Winland, son and daughter, of sycamore Valley; Albert Hines, of Pittsburgh; and Miss Alberta Hines, of New Concord, Ohio.

Hines and strange to say it was just one year to the day from the time that Mrs Hines buried her husband, Elder J. A. Hines, until her mother passed away.

     A lingering ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A lingering >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 illness resulted in the Wednesday morning of last week of Mrs. Mary Cronin, aged 38, wife of Emil Cronin, at the home of her parents, Mr. and Mrs. John Denbow, of Lewisville, Route 4. Besides her husband, she is survived by one son. Kenneth; one sister, Mrs. Rena Morris, of Lewisville, and three brothers, Jennings, of Ashland; Martin and Charles of Lewisville. Cronin, Milton L.
May 10, 1937
Milton LeRoy (Roy) Cronin
 
     M. L. Cronin, better known as Roy Cronin, aged 60 years, highly respected resident of the Richfork community in Wayne township, passed away at his home at 1:20 oclock Monday afternoon, following an extended illness.
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> M. L. Cronin, better known as Roy Cronin, aged 60 years, highly respected resident of the Richfork community in Wayne township, passed away at his home at 1:20 o clock Monday afternoon, following an extended illness. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
     He is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by his widow; one son, Willard of the home; one grandchild; one sister, Mrs. Viola Hines, of Maple avenue, Woodsfield, and one brother, S. L. Cronin, of SAginaw, Michigan and Fort Worth, Texas. Many more distant relatives and scores of friends also mourn his departure. For a number of years Mr. Cronin and family resided on Eastern Avenue, Woodsfield, during which time he was engaged in the oil industry. Funeral services were held at the late home at <<<<<<< HEAD 2:00 oclock Wednesday afternoon, in charge of Minister J.V.A. Traylor, pastor ======= 2:00 o clock Wednesday afternoon, in charge of Minister J.V.A. Traylor, pastor >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of the Woodsfield Church of Christ. Burial was made in Oak Lawn cemetery, Woodsfield.
 
     Mr. Cronin ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Cronin >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a son of the late Albert and Ellen J. Cronin, and a man of fine character. Industrious and self-reliant, trustworthy and capable, he was a valued employee in his oil fiend connections, commanding confidence and respect of his employers at all times. By his neighbors and friends, as well as by his family, he will be greatly missed.

Cronin, Warren Clark Cronin
Died: February 24, 1931
Provided by Lena Kahrig Pettit, typed by Betty Lendon Matson
     Warren ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Warren >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Clark Cronin, born January 10, 1923, departed this life February 24, 1931, being 8 years, 1 month and 14 days old when he passed away.
     Warren was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Warren was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a great lover of music, was often found sitting by the radio, being mesmerized by the music in the air--music which seemed to breathe a thought in language sweeter than was ever uttered by human tongue. He was often heard singing his favorite songs. He was continually scattering bright smiles in the home and among his associates--his smiles and songs brought much happiness into the home. He leArned early in life the good trait of dividing his possessions with his joyful playmates.
     He was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 looking forWard with untold pleasure to this coming summer to spend it in the County where he could hear the humming of the bees and hear sweet songs flowing from mellow throats of mocking birds; but now he has gone to that sinless summerland where the birds are forever singing and the flowers in their beauty never fade over Jordan's swelling stream, over the silent sea and by the shining shore, waiting to welcome us there when we too shall bid farewell to time.
     Warren was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Warren was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in the third grade. he was a regular member of The Sunday School Class. He was just sleepy and never complained during all his suffering.
     He leaves ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He leaves >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to mourn, father and mother, Mr. and Mrs. Clark Cronin; one sister, Helen; one brother Ward; grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. Ardell Smith, of Parkers Landing, Pa.; Mr. and Mrs. E.E. Cronin of Woodsfield; also leaves a number of aunts and uncles, cousins and a host of friends.
 
      Little Warren has gone and left us.
       We are sad and will miss him so;
     But God in His Infinite wisdom
       Knows ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Little Warren has gone and left us.
We are sad and will miss him so;
But God in His Infinite wisdom
Knows >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 best and called him from this world of woe.
 
      So let us all try to live to meet him
       In that beautiful land above
      Where we will dwell together forever,
       With God ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> So let us all try to live to meet him
In that beautiful land above
Where we will dwell together forever,
With God >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and his angels of love.
 
     Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were conducted by the writer, J. V. A. Traylor.
 
                     Card of Thanks
     We wish to ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Card of Thanks
We wish to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 take this means of thanking each and everyone who helped to make our burden lighter during the time of the of our beloved son and brother, Warren. Your acts of kindness and sympathy will never be forgotten.---Mr. and Mrs. Clark Cronin and family.

Crooks, Casey Daniel and Trisha Lynn Luke
Engagement
Luke--Crooks
Source--Times Leader     Martins Ferry, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Martins Ferry, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--January 24, 2005
Claude and Diane Luke of Shadyside, Herman Crooks Jr. of Beallsville and Tammy McCarthy of Cleveland announce the engagement of their children, Trisha Lynn Luke and Casey Daniel Crooks. The bride-elect is a 1997 graduate of Shadyside High School and a 2001 graduate of West Virginia Northern Community College with a degree in human services and child development. She is employed with the Belmont County Treasurer's Office as a deputy clerk. Her fiance is a 1998 graduate of Beallsville High School. He is employed with American Energy Century Mine Corporation. A May 21 wedding is being planned.

Crooks, Donald C.
 
Dec 11, 1931
 
October 15, 1999
 
Lewisville
 
 
Richard Robert Crooks
 
Source:The Marietta Times, dated, Friday, August 1, 2003
 
Woodsfield - Richard Robert Crooks, 68, of North Main Street died Wednesday (July 30, 2003) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center. He was born July 2, 1935, in Belmont County, Ohio, to Bruce W. Crooks and Pearl Rothwell Crooks. He was a U.S. Army veteran and was a member of Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 5303 in Woodsfield.
 
He is survived by four sisters, Shirley Pittman ofBeallsville, Ohio, GArnet Piatt of Lewisville, Martha Lisk of St. Clairsville, and Frances Kinsey ofBeallsville, Ohio; and several nieces and nephews.
 
He was preceded in by his parents; three brothers, Chester, Kenneth and Harold Crooks; three infant brothers; one sister, Wilma Wortman; and three infant sisters.
 
Services are at 1 p.m. Monday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home at 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with the Rev. Dave Langdon officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield with full military services to be conducted. Friends will be received from 7 to 9 p.m. Sunday at the funeral home.
 
Crooks, Roy Crooks
 
January 22, 1898
 
November 1976
 
Beallsville
 
Crooks, Samuel
Aug 21, 1900
January 1975
Beallsville
 
Crosier, William Fritz  ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Crosier, William Fritz >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Teresa Marie Thomas
Lowell and Judy Thomas of Jerusalem announce the engagement of their daughter, Teresa Marie to William Fritz Crosier, son of James and Deborah Crosier of Barnesville. The bride-to-be is a 1999 graduate of Barnesville High School. She attended Ohio University in Athens and received her bachelor's of science degree in secondary education in 2003. She is employed by Advantage Sales and Marketing in Columbus. Her fiance is a 1999 graduate of Barnesville High School, attended Ohio State University and received his bachelor's of science degree in civil engineering in June 2004. He is employed by URS Corporation in Columbus. A May 7 wedding is being planned.

Crum, A. E. Bert
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Crum, A. E. Bert >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
ProminentBeallsville, OhioMan Passes Away
September 24, 1931
Provided by Lena Kahrig Pettit, typed by Betty Lendon Matson
     Funeral services for A.E. Bert Crum, prominentBeallsville, Ohioresident, an account ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral services for A.E. Bert Crum, prominentBeallsville, Ohioresident, an account >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of whose may be found in this issue, were held Wednesday afternoon at 1 o'clock. The services were held from TheBeallsville, OhioChurch of Christ, and were largely attended, it being estimated that more than many people were unable to gain admission to the building. Special music was rendered by The Plainview Choir.
The Knights of Pythias Lodge ofBeallsville, Ohioattended in a body. Business was at a standstill while the village paid tribute to a respected citizen.
     Mr. Crum ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Crum >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 possessed considerable musical, ability, being a leader of the devotional services at his church and was also leader of the Crum String Orchestra.
 
 
Crum, Bernard Crum
 
June 17, 1923
 
May 1968
 
Beallsville
 
 
Crum, Mrs. Campsadell , nee Truex                    
======= style='mso-tab-count:2'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Died: February 12, 1943
Provided by Lena Kahrig Pettit, typed by Betty Lendon Matson
  Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Campsadell Armi Truex Crum was born November 9, 1861, and died February 12, 1943, aged 81 years , 3 months and 3 days. She was the mother of 13 children, of whom survive. There is also 60 grandchildren and several great-grandchildren. Eight grandchildren and 3 great-grandchildren preceded her in death.

Crum, Haren, Edna, nee Crum
Published--February 2002
      Haren,Edna ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Haren,Edna >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 A. Haren, 93, of South Sycamore Street died Saturday (Feb. 9, 2002) at Barnesville Hospital.
     She was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 born Sept. 17, 1908, in Noble County to George and Gertrude Ritterbeck Crum. She was a member of St. Sylvester Catholic Church at Woodsfield and the Catholic Women's Club.
     She is survived by several nieces and nephews.
     She was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She is survived by several nieces and nephews.
She was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 preceded in death by her husband, Clem Haren, in 1965; six sisters, Mary Dimmerling, Matilda Kullman, Emma Haren, Blach Nauer, Cora Michel and Estella Sebold; and four brothers, Lewis, Raymond, Urban and Harry Crum.
Mass of Christian burial is at 11 a.m. today at St. Sylvester Catholic Church at Woodsfield with Father David Gaydosik officiating. Burial is in St. Sylvester Catholic Church Cemetery. Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield is in charge of arrangements.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Crum, Edna Pearl Crum nee Bruce
Died May 13, 1967
     Mrs. Edna ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Edna >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Pearl Crum, 76, of Barnesville, Route 1, died unexpectedly of an apparent heart attack at ten o'clock Saturday morning, May 13, 1967, at her home.
     Born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 January 17, 1891, in Monroe County, she was the daughter of James W. and Anna McKnight Bruce. Her husband, Elmer Crum, died April 6, 1967.
     Mrs. Crum was a member of The Church of Christ.
     Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Crum was a member of The Church of Christ.
Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are three sons, Warren Crum, of Caledonia, Ohio; Edison Crum of Barnesville, Route 3 and Charles Crum, of Santa Clara, California; five daughters, Mrs. Elta McMahon, of Painesville,Ohio; Mrs. Wilma Lucas and Mrs. Eileen Davis ofBeallsville, Ohio; Mrs. Mary Bonar, of Carrolton, and Mrs. Nora Lee Mobley, of Louisville, Ohio; one brother, John Bruce, of Riverbank, California; one sister, Mrs. Cora Crammer, of Porterville, California; thirty-one grandchildren and twenty-nine great-grandchildren. A son, Earl, is deceased.
     Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held Tuesday afternoon at 1:30 o'clock, in The Campbell Funeral Home, at Barnesville, with Minister John Hamilton, of Woodsfield officiating. Burial was inBeallsville, OhioCemetery.
 
 
Crum, Elmer E. Crum
Elmer E. Crum Dies;
Was Retired School Teacher and Mail Carrier
Provided by Lena Kahrig Pettit, typed by Betty Lendon Matson
     Elmer Earl ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Elmer Earl >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Crum, 83, of Barnesville Route 1, died April 6 at his home following a short illness.
     He was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 February 7, 1884, nearBeallsville, Ohioin Monroe County, a son of Joseph and Campsadell Truex Crum, and was a retired school teacher, farmer and mail carrier. He was a member of The Armstrong Mills Church of Christ.
     Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are his widow, Edna Bruce Crum; five daughters, Mrs. Ella McMahon of Painesville, Mrs. Wilma Lucas and Mrs. Irene Davis ofBeallsville, Ohio, Mrs. Mary Ruth Bonar of Carrolton, and Mrs. Dora Lee Mobley of Louisville; three sons, Warren of Caledonia, Edison of Barnesville and Charles of Santa Ciara, Calif.; two sisters Mrs. Grace Montgomery of Jerusalem and Mrs. Mary Kinemond of Key; three brothers, Harley and John of Barnesville and Clyde of Canton; 31 grandchildren and 29 great-grandchildren. A son, two sisters and five brothers are deceased.
     Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 were held Sunday at The Campbell Funeral Home, Barnesville with Evangelist James Gallagher officiating. Burial in TheBeallsville, OhioCemetery.

Crum, Nancy J. , nee Mercer
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, December 15, 1996
  Nancy J. Crum, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Nancy J. Crum, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 60, of 35626 Harper Ridge Road, Jerusalem, Ohio died
December 15, 1996, in Druid City Hospital, Northport, Alabama. She was born April 22, 1936, in Calais, Ohio, a daughter of the late James and Ocie Carpenter Mercer.
  She was a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 member of the Jerusalem United Methodist Church and Order of Eastern Star Chapter 24,Beallsville, Ohio, Ohio. She was a retired dietary supervisor at American/Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
  Surviving are her husband, Clayton, whom she married on May 22,1954; four sons, Reggie and Marlene, of Cottondale, Alabama, Brent and Pat, and Shawn, all of Jerusalem, Brian Buck and Sharon, of Woodsfield; a daughter, Mrs. Tod (Thalia) Kahrig, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are her husband, Clayton, whom she married on May 22,1954; four sons, Reggie and Marlene, of Cottondale, Alabama, Brent and Pat, and Shawn, all of Jerusalem, Brian Buck and Sharon, of Woodsfield; a daughter, Mrs. Tod (Thalia) Kahrig, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Woodsfield; one brother, James Mercer, of Jerusalem and three sisters, Lodena Christman, Mrs. Bert (Emma) Bates, and Ocie McFrederick, all of Jerusalem; and 10 grandchildren.
  In addition to ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In addition to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 her parents, she was preceded in by an infant daughter, Tama Lodena; three brothers, Donald, Joseph, and Ellis Mercer; four sisters, Betty Mercer, Bonnie Egger, Opal Mercer and Martha Lou Betts.
  Friends were ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends were >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 received December 19 at the Harper Funeral Home,Beallsville, Ohio, where services were held December 20, with the Reverend Richard Wilson officiating. Interment followed inBeallsville, OhioCemetery. Eastern Star services were held December 19 at the funeral home.

               Mr. J. Wade CULP of Vandergrift, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. J. Wade CULP of Vandergrift, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Pennsylvania, and Miss Grace REED of Woodsfield were married at the home of the bride August 22, 1916 at 11:30 a.m. by Elder D. W. HARKINS. They left at 1:30 p.m. for Barnesville, Ohio to get train No. 104 for their home in Vandergrift. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William REED.
 
Cunningham, Clarence W.
 
May 15, 1918
 
Feb 22, 1999
 
Woodsfield
MARRIAGE of Lorna Lou Christman, to Mr. Harold William Good
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, dated January 8, 1945
 
Mr. and Mrs. R. E. Christman of Maple Avenue, are announcing the marriage of their youngest daughter Lorna Lou, to Mr. Harold William Good, of New Lebanon, Ohio.
 
The wedding was an event of Saturday afternoon, December 23, at Covington, Kentucky, with the Rev. E. C. Rose performing the ceremony.
 
Mrs. Good is a member of the 1944 graduating class of the Woodsfield High School.
 
The happy young couple are both employed at the Dayton Rubber Company and are making their home in Dayton. They have the best wishes of their many friends.

Cunningham, Raymond Irvin
Source--Marietta <<<<<<< HEAD Times    >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Marietta, Ohio
Published--January 26, 2005
COLUMBUS - Raymond Irvin Cunningham, 68, of 350 Chase Road, Columbus, died at 5:50 a.m. Tuesday ,January 25, 2005 at Riverside Methodist Hospital in Columbus. He was born January 30, 1936, in New Matamoras, a son of Paul and Eldene (Fulmer) Cunningham. He attended Matamoras United Methodist Church and worked as a lab technician for Battelle Memorial Institute until he retired in 1995 after 33 years of service. He graduated from Matamoras High School. On May 14, 1960, he married Beatrice Marie Taft, who survives of Columbus. In addition to his wife, he is survived by two sons, Paul Cunningham and his wife, Kathy, of Sheffield, Ohio, and Joe Cunningham and his wife, Doti, of Delaware, Ohio; one daugther, Melissa Pack and her husband, Warwick, of Sydney, Australia; his mother, Eldene Seidenable of New Matamoras; six grandchildren, Jodi Cunningham, Annemarie, Colletta, and Brianna Cunningham, and Amy and Chole Pack; and two sisters, Betty Cunningham of New Matamoras and Mary Ellen Martin and her husband, Norman, of Sardis. He was preceded in death by his father; one daughter, Amy; and one infant son. Funeral services will be held at 11 a.m. Friday at Hadley Funeral Home, New Matamoras Chapel, with the Reverend Cy Broughton officiating. Family will receive friends from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Thursday.
 
Cunningham, Virgil H.
Source:Marietta Times . . . Dec 2000
            HARRIETTSVILLE ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> HARRIETTSVILLE >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 -- Virgil H. Cunningham, 93, of Harriettsville (Ohio 145, Lower Salem) died Saturday evening (December 23, 2000) at Heartland of Marietta.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born December 10, 1907, in Bethel Township, Monroe County, to James Lynn and Jemima Springer Cunningham. He spent most of his life in the Harriettsville area and had been employed at Dragon Manufacturing Co. until his retirement.
            Cunningham ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Cunningham >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 served in the U.S. Army as a combat engineer during World War II in the European, African, Middle East Theater. He helped build bridges across the Rhine, Rohr and Elbe rivers and was aWarded a bronze Star.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a member of the Harriettsville baseBall team that was Noble County champs in 1931, 1932 and 1933. He was a member of Harriettsville United Methodist Church and American Legion Post 750 at Lowell. He had attended Lower Salem United Methodist Church.
            On ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 December 24, 1931, he married Marjorie Pauline Carnal, who survives with one son, James Cunningham of Whipple; one daughter, Faye Love and her husband, Ronald, of Harriettsville; 12 grandchildren, Marilyn Kehl and her husband, Dan, David Cunningham and his wife, Susan, Carolyn Bailey, Cindy Schott and her husband, Dan, Ryan Cunningham and his wife, Holly, Debra Haney and her husband, Roger, Mike Love and his wife, Carol, Doug Love and his wife, Cindy, Mitch Love and his wife, Lisa, Lisa Love, Landon Love and his wife, Charity, and Stacy Dimmerling and her husband, Chris; 21 great-grandchildren, Matthew Carpenter, Kala and Mark Kehl, Brandon, Derrick and Kent Cunningham, Chelsea Bailey, Chandler and Zachary Cunningham, Melissa and Christa Schott, Andrew and Shanaka Haney, Dustin Love, Alicia Love, Joshua Love, Leeanna Love, Jennifer Love, Joe and Kyle Love and Grace Dimmerling; a number of nieces and nephews; and four sisters-in-law, Mary Daniels of Silver Springs, Fla., Mildred Franks of Barberton, Jean Carnell of Wakeman and Rosalie Anderson of Hillsboro, N.D.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by two brothers, HoWard Cunningham and Ernest R. "Dick" Cunningham; and five sisters, a sister who died in infancy, Clara Lee, Mae Ullman, Nola Wilson and Elsie Crum; one son, Richard E. Cunningham, who died January 21, 1995; his daughter-in-law, Martha Ida Cunningham, who died January 5, 1997; and one grandson, James Randall Cunningham.
            Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are at 1 p.m. Thursday at McClure-Schafer Funeral Home in Marietta. Burial is in Salem Township Cemetery with military rites. Friends may call until the hour of the services at the funeral home.
